loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a 43-year-old dairy farmer.  He is married to Pauline, who is shown in the photo here and who helps him with the farming business.  They have two children.  Patrick has been doing dairy farming for the past year, and his monthly income is 7,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), which he uses to provide for the basic needs of his family.

Patrick has never borrowed from any microfinance institution (MFI) before.  He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and this is his first loan.  He plans to use the loan to purchase animal feeds (e.g., maize jam and dairy meal) and animal insecticides.  With the anticipated profits from the business, he intends to expand his dairy farming business and begin poultry farming.

Patrick was away on a business trip at the time his profile details were being gathered and thus we have featured the wife in the photo.  Patrick's hopes and dreams are to become a leading local dairy farmer in his hometown and to educate his children.

loans.use: To purchase animal feeds and animal insecticides

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius N., aged 39, is a livestock trader at Bissil Market, a busy market in Kajiado.  He is married to Itayo, a farmer who is 30 years old.  The couple has one child, Matthew, who is 14 years old and in school.  Julius has been running his livestock trading business for four years, with a monthly profit of 4,000 Kenyan shillings (KES).

Julius was introduced to KADET LTD. by the credit officer in charge of the Kitengela office.  He has applied for a loan that he will use to buy livestock for trading.  If the loan boosts his business, he will open a butchery so he can also target individual customers buying meat for home use.  This will enable him to support his son to a higher level of education.

Julius’s dream is to become a famous businessman.

loans.use: To buy livestock for trading

loans.name: George Njoroge

texts.en:
George, 40 years old, is married to Susan and a father of one child, 4 years old. He operates a secondhand stall where he sells secondhand curtains, bedcovers, towels, etc. This is his primary business and he has been doing it for a number of years. He stays and operates the business in Kangemi, which has a large population and is relatively busy in terms of business, a favorable aspect for George.

George got to know about KADET through a friend who was already a member. This is his second loan with KADET and he has not borrowed from other financiers before. With this loan, George plans to add more stock to his stall. In the future, he wants to open another stall where he can sell new items such as mattresses and other goods. He wishes to give a better future to his family and a good education to his child.

loans.use: to buy more bales of secondhand bedcovers, bedsheets and curtains

loans.name: Everline

texts.en:
Everline is a divorced woman with three children, two of whom attend school while one is still too young to attend. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Everline has operated a vegetable stall, selling sukuma wiki (green vegetables) for over three years. In addition, she operates a firewood business as another source of income. Her customers are her neighbors and passersby. She faces the challenge of seasonality in her business. During the hot, dry season, the supply of green vegetables is low compared to the rainy winter season when the supply of vegetables is high.

Everline decided to join Yehu to obtain loans to boost her business. With a 20,000 KES loan she wants to purchase crates of tomatoes, sukuma wiki and sugarcane for her vegetable stall. Everline hopes to establish a restaurant in the future.

loans.use: To purchase crates of tomatoes, sukuma wiki and sugarcane

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Yawa a 35 ans et mère d’un enfant. Elle   est née à Lomé et habite Totsi ou elle a le siège de son activité principale et est mariée. En effet, pour contribuer au ménage, elle exerce une activité  génératrice de revenus, la vente de fripperie. Elle achète  en gros à hedzranawoe et distribue en détail à côté de la station Totsi. Elle exerce cette activité il y de cela 2 ans. L’objet de ce prêt est d’augmenter son commerce par l’achat de 5 balles de fripperie.
texts.en: Yawa, aged 35, is married and the mother of one child. She was born in Lomé and lives now in Totsi, where her main business activity is located. Indeed, to contribute to the household expenses, she has an income generation activity, namely selling second-hand clothes. She buys wholesale in Hedzranawoé and retails in Totsi, next to the station. She has been in this trade for two years. Yawa will use her loan to buy 5 bales of second-hand clothes.

loans.use: To buy second-hand clothes

loans.name: Dilshod

texts.ru: Рачабов Дилшод житель города Куляб. Возраст, 34 года. Женат. Имеет 2 детей. Образование высшее, пожарник. По профессии не работает. Занимается животноводством. Разводит скот у себя дома. Он в основном разводит скот в дальнейшем для перепродажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже три с половиной года. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота, чтобы увеличить их количество.
texts.en: Dilshod R. is a resident of Kulob.  He is 34 years old, married, and has two children.  He has a vocational education as a fireman. He does not work in his trade.  He works in animal husbandry.  He raises cattle at home.  He basically raises cattle for resale. He has been doing this kind of work for three and a half years. He is taking out a loan to buy cattle to increase his herd.

loans.use: Buying cattle

loans.name: Avazjon

texts.ru: Билолов Авазчон проживает в районе Восеъ. Возраст, 26 лет. Женат. Имеет одного ребенка. Образование среднее. Работает на центральном рынке района. Арендует торговую точку, где продает продукты питания. В этой области уже 3 года. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en:
Avazjon B. lives in the Vosey region. He is 26-years-old, married and is the father of an infant. He completed secondary school. 

He works in the central market of the region. He runs a market stall, where he sells food products. He has worked in this area for three years. His loan is to be used for increasing inventory.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: San Antonio Iii Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre San Antonio  se conformó en fecha 25 octubre del 2.010, se encuentran en el 1°ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
Este comité está comenzando con mucha esperanza de trabajar un buen tiempo entre todas y trabajar para conseguir los beneficios para las mismas y para sus familias.
Cada una se encuentra trabajando en sus actividades y otras están comenzando con algún trabajo que les pueda generar ingreso y así pagar sus cuotas y al mismo tiempo obtener un ingreso para su familia. 

Una de las integrantes es la  Sr. Angélica G. quien se dedica a la compra y venta de ropas, y comenta que es muy difícil vender este producto en su comunidad por la competencia que hay, por ello solicita el préstamo para la compra de nuevas mercaderías que puedan atraer a clientes. 
Quiere contar con todas la prendas de vestir de temporada como vestidos, remeras, shorts y además calzados. 
Espera mejorar sus ventas y asegura que aprovechará al máximo el crédito que recibió y agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por la confianza en su comité.
texts.en:
The San Antonio III women's committee was founded on the 25th of October 2010.  They are in their first loan cycle as a united and supportive group within the program.

This committee is starting out with great hopes of working together for a long time and working to benefit themselves and their families.

Each one of the committee's members has her own business activity and some are starting out in a business activity which can generate income and thereby enable them to make their repayments and, at the same time, make profits for their families.

One of the committee's members is Angélica G. who buys and sells clothes.  She comments that it is very difficult to sell these products in her community because there is a lot of competition.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy new merchandise which can attract customers.  She would like to have all clothes which are in season such as dresses, t-shirts, shorts and also footwear.

She hopes to improve her sales and assures us that she will take maximum advantage of the loan which she received.  She thanks Fundación Paraguaya for the trust which they have placed in her committee.

loans.use: To buy footwear, t-shirts, blouses, dresses, etc.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en: Bernadette is a 41-year-old lady – a single mother of two children living in Fort Portal, Uganda in a rented house. Her dream is to have her own residential house in the next two years. Bernadette has a drug shop and has been in business for five years now. Her business is steadily growing. She needs this loan to buy cement and iron sheets for construction of her drug shop latrine.

loans.use: To buy cement and iron sheets for construction of her drug shop latrine

loans.name: Dzine

texts.en:
Dzine is a widowed woman with seven children, one of whom attends school. Six of her children have already graduated from school. She owns a house that does not have electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has operated a tailoring business for more than two years, selling on a retail basis to local neighbors and passersby. Dzine faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. During the month of January, schools are opening and parents purchase school uniforms for their children. When schools are closed during the holiday season, the demand for school uniforms is low. She hopes to purchase more materials and one more sewing machine in the future.

With the 20,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase materials for her tailoring business. She decided to join Yehu to get loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Jumanazar

texts.ru: Бобомуротов Джуманазар проживает в районе Кубадиян. Возраст, 51 год. Женат. Имеет 10 детей. Образование среднее. Имеет собственную мастерскую, где ремонтирует DVD и другие аппаратуры. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже 20 лет. Джумаразар берет повторный кредит. Целью кредита является закуп новых запчастей аппаратуры.
texts.en: Jumanazar B. lives in Kubadiyan region. He is 51 years old and is married with ten children. Jumanazar has secondary education. He has his own workshop where he repairs DVDs and other electronics. He has been in this business for twenty years. Dzhumarazar is applying for his second loan, which he is planning to use for the a purchase of new spare parts for electronics.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for electronics

loans.name: Zulma

texts.es:
La señora se dedica  a confección de ropas sobre pedidos, también uniformes para empresas, y de ropas para negocios en gran cantidad.
Comenta que gracias a la buena calidad de sus trabajos constantemente cuenta con mucho trabajo y pedidos de sus confecciones.
En ocasiones contrata mano de obra, cuando ella sola no puede con todos los pedidos. 
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de otra maquina de coser eléctrica  para usar cuando los pedidos aumentan.
texts.en:
This lady works making clothes to order.  She also makes uniforms for companies and a large quantity of clothes for businesses.

She comments that thanks to the good quality of her work, she constantly has a lot of work and orders for her clothes.

She sometimes hires workers when she can't manage all the orders on her own.

She is requesting this loan so that she can buy another electric sewing machine to use when her orders increase.

loans.use: To buy an electric sewing machine

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
La Señora Angela P., reside en la ciudad de Lambaré, es propietaria de un taller de confección de prendas de vestir, trabaja con exclusividad para la empresa COPA S.A. desde hace ya varios años.
Con el crédito de la fundación, ha podido comprar maquinas para trabajos específicos en el proceso de la confección de dichas prendas, además de terminar de techar un salón que un tiempo atrás comenzó a construir, el cual le permitirá tener un espacio físico mas amplio bajo techo, para producir su mercadería.
texts.en:
Angela P. lives in the town of Lambaré.  She owns a dressmaking workshop.  She has been working exclusively for the company COPA S.A. for several years.

With the loan from Fundación Paraguaya she has been able to buy machines for specific tasks in the process of making her clothes as well as finishing off the roof of a room which she began building some time ago.  This will allow her to have a bigger physical space under cover where she can produce her merchandise.

loans.use: To buy machines and finish off some construction work

loans.name: Anvarjon

texts.ru: Махмудчонов Анварчон житель района Дж. Руми. Возраст, 28 лет. Женат. Имеет одного ребенка. Образование высшее, экономист. По профессии не работает. Занимается торговлей на центральном рынке района. У него собственный продуктовый магазин. В этой области он уже два года. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота. Так как Анварчон только начинает свой бизнес, он хочет расширить свою деятельность и получить больше дохода.
texts.en: Anvarjon M., 28, lives in Rumi region. He is married with one child. Anvarjon has a university degree in Economics. However, he makes a living by selling goods at the central market. Anvarjon owns a grocery store. He has been in this business for two years, and is now applying for a loan in order to increase turnover. Since Anvarjon's business is still developing, he would like to increase turnover and profits.

loans.use: to increase turnover

loans.name: Arnaldo

texts.es:
Arnaldo tiene 47  años, vive en casa propia, está casado con la señora Cristina Marín, tienen cuatro hijos de los cuales 1 está cursando el segundo año de Administración en Empresas en la facultad, otro está en la secundaria y 2 están en la primaria, gracias al esfuerzo de sus padres todos tienen ls posibilidad de recibir buena educación.
Arnaldo emprendió su actividad como fletero hace más de 5 años cuando pudo adquirir para su camioneta que le es de mucha utilidad, pues actualmente está transportando caña de azúcar a la fábrica Alpasa distante a 12 km de la ciudad, además cuenta con una despensa donde atiende su esposa con la ayuda de sus hijos, cuentan con clientela formada.
Arnaldo es un señor muy sacrificado quien se esfuerza diariamente para brindarle lo mejor a su familia y buena educación a sus hijos para adquirir una profesión universitaria.
Necesita el crédito para la compra de cubiertas y mercaderías en general para aumentar su stock.
texts.en:
Arnaldo is 47 years old.  He lives in his house with his wife Cristina Marín.  They have four children; one is in the second year studying Business Administration in college,one is in high school, and two are in primary school.  Thanks to their parents effort, all four children have the opportunity to receive a good education.

Arnaldo began his work as a freighter over five years ago when he bought a truck, which has been very useful since he uses it to transport sugar cane from the Alpasa factory located 12km outside the city.  Additionally, the family has a small grocery store with an established customer base, which has wife takes care of with the help of their sons.

Arnaldo is a very selfless man who works every day to give his family the best and provide his sons with a good education so they can have advanced careers.

Arnaldo needs the loan to buy tires for his truck and general merchandise to increase the grocery's stock.

loans.use: Purchase tires and buy merchandise to stock his grocery.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is a single woman with five children, three of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor running water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For over eight years, Anna has operated a charcoal business. She sells charcoal to her neighbors and to the general public. Her major business challenge is seasonality. During the rainy winter season when demand is high, the charcoal supply is low and it is difficult for Anna to meet customer demand.

Anna decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business. She is requesting a loan of 40,000 KES to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. In the future, Anna hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Ozipa

texts.en:
Ozipa S. is a 61-year-old widow with five grown children.  Her youngest son Ramil lives with her and helps in the household. In 1992, Ozipa began her own cattle breeding business with the purchase of two milk cows. She also started to cultivate vegetables on a plot of land. Since then, she has worked hard to improve her harvests and provide high quality products. Ozipa’s efforts have been focused on supporting and expanding her household. Currently, she sells milk products to the local diary factory and earns about 5,000 KGS a month. 

Ozipa is requesting a loan of 50,000 KGS to buy milk cows. With the revenue from this investment, she plans to purchase a horse and a cart for transporting vegetables.

About Bai-Tushum and Partners:
 
Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target especially vulnerable populations. It is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that leads to increased employment and meets the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase milk cows

loans.name: Vanancio

texts.en: K. Vanancio is 33 years old and he has been running his agricultural business in Rukungiri for 5 years. The business has been bringing in 240,000 UGX for him. Vanancio is married with 2 children. He says that he will use this loan to pay for the upgrading of his banana plantations. He is also involved in the sale of soya beans, other beans, etc.

loans.use: to upgrade his banana plantations

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is a young man, age 34 years old, living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is married and has one child, age 9 months. He lives in a rented house and has a dream of one day being able to put up in his own family home. He is in the transport business and has a taxi. He has been in the business for eight years now. Before, he was just a driver, but later he got some credit and savings and started doing business with his own car. George intends to use this loan to buy a car for his transport business.

loans.use: To buy a car for a transport business

loans.name: Nameita

texts.en:
Nameita S., 35 years old, trades livestock and runs a retail shop at the busy Bissil market. She is married to Kilel S., a farmer, and together they have two children: Agnes, aged 4 years and Sapatu, aged 6 years. Nameita has been running these businesses for a period of 4 years and she earns a monthly profit of KES 20,000.

Nameita was introduced to Kadet by the credit officer in charge of the Kitengela office. She plans to use KES 30,000 of her loan to buy cows, goats and sheep for trading and KES 20,000 to increase the stock of flour, sugar, cooking fat and detergents in her shop.

If the loan boosts her businesses, Nameita will buy a piece of land and build commercial houses. She describes herself as a hardworking and industrious woman who dreams of building many commercial houses in the future.

loans.use: to buy cows, goats and sheep for trading and to increase stock in her shop

loans.name: Cerro Guy Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Yaguarón, distante a 22 Km. de la Oficina de Paraguarí, se reunieron unas mujeres con el fin de  capitalizar su actividad y otras para emprender actividades productivas, de ahí que coordinamos la reunión para interiorizarse sobre el programa, les resultó muy fructíferas  e interesantes por los beneficios brindados por el programa.
El comité lleva por nombre Cerro Guy debido a que todas son amigas, vecinas y por medio de este emprendimiento fortalecerían el lazo entre ellas, actualmente se encuentran en el quinto, integrada por 15  emprendedoras señoras, quienes ponen lo mejor de si para aumentar sus ingresos y por ende brindarle lo mejor a sus respectivas familias. Todas las integrantes son luchadoras, quienes han invertido sus préstamos en sus respectivas actividades.
La señora Librada quien se dedica a la venta de bebidas en la cantina que posee en su casa comenta que los créditos que obtuvo mediante su comité le sirvió bastante para cargar de mercaderias su negocio y sus ingresos lo destina tambien para ayudar a su familia con los gasto de la casa, alimentacion, agua, luz y otros.
Solicita nuevamente para la compra de bebidas, como vinos, cervezas, gaseosas y otros.
texts.en:
In the city of Yaguaron, some 22 kilometers from the Paraguari Office, a group of women meet for the purpose of funding their existing economic activities, or to begin productive activities.  They gather to internalize their program, which offers very fruitful and interesting results.

The committee goes by the name of Cerro Guy (Guy Hill), because they are all friends and neighbors, and by means of this undertaking, they fortify the links between them.  Presently, they are in their 5th loan cycle. The group is made up of 15 enterprising women who put forth their best efforts to augment their incomes and, as a result, to offer the best to their respective families.  All the members are fighters who have invested their loans in their respective activities.

Librada, who sells drinks in a cantina in her house, comments that the loans they obtain by means of the committee, serve her well for supplying her business with merchandise, and her earnings are destined to help her family with household costs, including food, water, lights, and other expenses.

She is applying anew, to buy drinks, including wine, beer, soft drinks, and other items.

loans.use: TO BUY SOFT DRINKS, WINE, BEER, AND OTHER MERCHANDISE TO SELL

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert M. is 44 years old and a father of five.  He has been running a restaurant in Bwombaso-Rukungiri for the past decade.  His business brings in 260,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) per month.  Robert plans to use his loan to restock his restaurant with more food supplies.

loans.use: The purchase more food supplies for his restaurant

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a 51-year-old married man with six children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has the zeal to increase his daily household income. He lives in his own house and is charged with the responsibility of providing basics for his five family members, with his wife providing backup. It is now ten years since he started commercial farming. With his earnings from the sector, he has been able to educate his children. His grand business idea is to become a mechanized farmer. Charles intends to use this loan to buy improved seedlings of maize and beans for planting.

loans.use: To buy seedlings of maize and beans for planting

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en: Damaris, 28 years old, is single and a mother of two children. She has been operating a clothing stall in Nairobi as her primary business for the last seven years. She got to know about KADET through a friend who was already a member, and she has never borrowed from other financial institutions. With this loan advance, she plans to buy more stock and move to a more spacious shop for her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock and to move to a more spacious shop

loans.name: Kituku

texts.en:
Kituku is a widowed woman with four children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor running water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

Kituku operates a charcoal business, selling charcoal to her neighbors and to the general public. Her major business challenge is seasonality. During the rainy winter season when demand is high, the charcoal supply is low and it is difficult for Kituku to meet customer demand. 

Kituku decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.  She is requesting a loan of 15,000 KES to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell. In the future, Kituku hopes to expand her business and establish a market stall in town.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon O. is 46 years old and a father of 10.  He has been in agriculture for 27 years.  He is a hardworking man who says his business brings in an average of 250,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) per month.  He plans to use this loan to upgrade his banana plantations with high-grade manure.

Simon is also involved in the sale of secondhand clothes, coffee, and other items, which helps to bring in more income.

loans.use: To upgrade his banana plantations

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a father of 6 and a resident of the town of Litein in the Rift Valley of Kenya. He has been doing mixed farming for 15 years, producing tea and milk and selling locally. He employs one farmhand.

John has applied for this loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He believes this will provide an alternative source of income to his mechanics business. He says that this improved income will ensure that his family has various assets and a better standard of living. John's main challenges are insufficient capital and animal feeds. He is hopeful that he will manage to have purebred cows in a modern zero-grazing unit. He says the loan service from Juhudi Kilimo has been supportive to many.

loans.use: Purchase and insurance of a dairy cow

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph M. K. is a 38-year-old hawker dealing in water pots in Mombasa.  He has been in this business for the last year and has done well.  He is married to Margaret Nduvi, who supplements his income as the couple has two children to support.

This is Joseph's second loan from KADET.  He would like to purchase more plastic water pots for resale and use the anticipated profit to rent a shop so he can start a new business in electronics.

Joseph hopes to own a big shop in the future and to provide for his family's needs.

loans.use: Purchasing more plastic water pots

loans.name: Sita

texts.en:
This is 34-year-old Sita T.. She is married and has two children, aged 16 and 7. In 2009, she established a vegetable farming business. Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, she supoorts her family. She has already received and successfully repaid two loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer for her farm.  

In the future, Sita plans to improve the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural.  Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer. With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.  

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner, MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW was Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to its clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community. For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates:

BPW Partner Page     
Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Elizabeth Wanjiku

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman and the mother of five children. She lives in Oloitoktok, a peri-urban town along the Mombasa Nairobi highway. Elizbeth operates a phone accessories shop and wants to diversify and sell cereals such as maize, beans and peas as well. 

Elizabeth got to know about KADET through World Vision staff. She has never borrowed from other financial institutions. In the future, Elizabeth hopes to become a wholesale trader. She has applied for a loan to add more stock to her shop and buy cereals to diversify and expand.

loans.use: to buy phone accessories and cereals

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda is a 48-year-old woman living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She is an innovative single mother of five children. She owns a house and dreams of mentoring her children to become entrepreneurs. For eight years now, Imelda has been selling clothes and this has enabled her to educate her children and renovate her house. She confesses to having challenges with her finances and this has deterred her from meeting ever-increasing customer demand. Imelda intends to use this loan to purchase trousers, shirts, shoes and dresses to sell in her shop.

loans.use: To purchase trousers, shirts, shoes and dresses for her shop

loans.name: Review Jeremiah

texts.en:
Jeremiah is a 48-year-old father with four children who is married to Lucy. For the past 17 years, Jeremiah’s primary business has been running a dairy and crop farming. Jeremiah lives in Kiambu, which is a relatively productive area that receives a good amount of rainfall every season making it favorable for agricultural activities.

Jeremiah got to know about KADET through a friend who was already a member. This is his second loan with KADET and he has also previously borrowed from other institutions. With this loan, Jeremiah plans to buy a water pump and irrigation pipes. He also plans to have electricity installed in his farm.

loans.use: to buy a water pump and irrigation pipes and to install electricity

loans.name: Kalpana

texts.en:
This is 45-year-old Kalpana S.. She is married and has three children, aged 22, 20 and 16. In 2006, she established a grocery store. Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, she supoorts her family. In the future, Kalpana plans to improve the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.  

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called pasals, are an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins. By keeping inventory stocked and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen. 

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to its clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community. For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates:
BPW Partner Page     
Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team

loans.use: To buy goods for her grocery store.

loans.name: Jane Wanjiku

texts.en:
Jane is a 52-year-old married woman who is the mother of three children aged 15, 17 and 22 respectively. She lives in Gathangara in Kiambu, a peri-urban town with a lot of agricultural activity. Jane sells cereals to the residents of Gathangara area and is also involved in tea farming. For the past four years, cereal selling has been her primary business. 

Jane got to know about KADET through a friend who was already a member. She has never borrowed from other financial institutions.  Jane would like to become a wholesale cereal seller and sustain her business. She has applied for a loan to add more cereals and grains, such as maize, beans, peas and potatoes, to her stock.

loans.use: to buy cereals and grains

loans.name: Israel

texts.en: Israel is a 30-year-old father of one child, living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His wish is to see his child graduate and work for a reputable organization. He is a motorcycle driver and, with the three years that he has been in the transport sector, he has been able to buy his own motorcycle. Israel intends to use this loan to buy land for the construction of a rental house so as to have increased sources of income.

loans.use: To buy land for construction of a rental house

loans.name: Seleina Ene

texts.en:
Seleina Ene S. is 33 years old, married and a mother of four children. She lives in Kimana in the Loitoktok district, and she raises crops and sells them to travelers on the highway between Nairobi and Mombasa and to the local community. She irrigates her crops, so this ensures there is water throughout her field. She has been selling her produce for four years.

Seleina got to know about KADET through a friend who was already a member. She has applied for a loan which she will use to buy seedlings, fertilizers, and other farm chemicals for her farm. She is very hardworking and determined to change the lives of her family members.

loans.use: To buy seedlings, fertilizers, and other farm chemicals

loans.name: Sanam

texts.en:
This is 39-year-old Sanam K.. She is married and has five children, aged 19, 18, 16, 14 and 11. In 2000, she established her dairy business. Working seven days a week and five hours a day, she supoorts her family. She has already received and successfully repaid two loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to purchase a young dairy cow.  

In the future, Sanam plans to improve the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal. Cows are never raised for beef, but for their milk from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made. Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking. On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about ten liters of milk each day. In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about USD $0.50.  

In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction, as fuel for fires, and can be captured in methane storage tanks. The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over. 

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women (Patan BPW). Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. It operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to its clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community. For more information, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates:
BPW Partner Page     
Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia W. is a married woman and a mother of five children. She lives in Gitiha in the district of Kiambu. This region is good for agricultural activities. She mainly relies on crop farming and has been doing so for the last ten years.

Sophia got to know about KADET through a friend who was already a member. She has never borrowed from any other financial institution. With this loan advancement she plans to expand her farming activities into dairy farming as well and so would like to buy a dairy cow for milk production.

From the profits gained from her farming, Sophia intends to buy a plot and develop it to achieve a higher income.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex K. is a very hardworking and self-motivated man from Rutabo LC I. He is 27 years old, single and a crop farmer who grows maize, beans and cassava for sale. For over the six years that he has been in business, he has developed a good clientele.

His dream is to continue growing and developing his crops as well as to be able to have his own family.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers for improved production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more palm oil, rice, and ground nuts.

loans.name: Ikatu Group

texts.es:
El comité lleva por nombre Ikatú, debido a que todas son amigas y piensan que con el apoyo todas saldrán adelante y podran superar algunas dificultades que actualmente tienen para trabajar.
Todas las integrantes son luchadoras, quienes han invertido sus préstamos en sus respectivas actividades.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Viviana, una mujer muy activa y tiene el cargo de presidenta dentro del comité, ella fue elegida por sus compañeras ya que confian en ella por que siempre demostro predisposión para todas la actividades y es una persona sumamente responsable.
Ella se dedica a la venta de mercaderías, como de ropas, articulos para el hogar, productos de limpieza, y de consumo.
Ella realiza sus ventas desde su casa y tambien ofrece en forma ambulante en vaR. negocios de la zona ya que ella adquiere las mercaderías en gran cantidad y buen precio, y por lo tanto ella tambien compite bastante bien con los demas vendedores. Trabaja a credito como al contado con sus clientes.
Solicita el prestamo para la como de remeas, shorts, zapatillas, sabanas, productos de limpieza y otros.
texts.en:
The name of this committee is Ikatú because its members are all friends and they believe that with support they will all be successful and be able to overcome some difficulties which they currently have working.

All the members of the committee are fighters who have invested their loans in their respective activities.

One of the committee's members is Viviana.  She is a very active woman and is the committee's president.  She was chosen by her friends because they trust in her as she has always shown an aptitude for all activities and she is an extremely responsible person.

Viviana works selling merchandise such as clothes, articles for the home, cleaning products and consumer products.

She sells her products from her home and also itinerantly in several businesses in the area.  Since she acquires her merchandise in large quantities and for a good price, she is able to compete pretty well with other salespeople.  She provides her goods to her customers on credit and also for cash.

She is requesting this loan to buy t-shirts, shorts, sports shoes, sheets, cleaning products, etc.

loans.use: To buy t-shirts, shorts, sports shoes, sheets, cleaning products, etc.

loans.name: Felista Wanjiju

texts.en:
Felista Wanjiju N. is a married woman and a mother of five children. She lives in Waratho in the Kiambu district area. This is a middle class estate with a high population. Felista has been operating a grocery stall for a number of years from which she sells various kinds of vegetables such as cabbages, onions, tomatoes and many more.

Felista learned about KADET through a friend who was already a member. She has never borrowed from any other financial institution. Felista has applied for a loan which she plans to use to buy a dairy calf worth 15,000 KES. This will enable her to boost her income and thus support her family better.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Thuli Maiya

texts.en:
This is 45-year-old Thuli Maiya L..  She is married and has 5 children aged 27, 22, 20, 16 and 12.  In 2003, she established  her grocery store business.  Working 7 days a week and 8 hours a day, she supports her family.  

She has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to purchase grocery goods for her shop.  In the future, Thuli Maiya plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen. 

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates:  BPW Partner Page.   Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team.

loans.use: To buy grocery store inventory

loans.name: Penninah Muthoni

texts.en:
Penninah Muthoni W. is 43 years old, married to Gerald who is in the transport business, and is the mother of two children who are 17 and 22 years old. She lives in Limuru where she raises dairy cattle for their milk which she sells to the residents in her town. She has been in business for a number of years.

Penninah got to know about KADET through a friend who was already a member. This is her third loan with no previous credit history. With this loan Penninah plans to buy another dairy cow so as to add to her milk sales. She dreams of becoming a major milk distributor in the region.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson is a very hardworking married man, aged 22 who is living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His greatest desire is to have his children go to school and to increase his daily savings at home. He is a motorcyclist and has been in the transport sector for the last seven years. Wilson is faced with a challenge of remitting 70% of the daily income to the motorcycle owner, thus leading to limited income and savings for him. He says that he has finally found a solution to income issues by getting himself a motorcycle and thus the need for credit. He intends to purchase a motorcycle for his transport business with the loan.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge tiene 22  años de edad,  es soltero, vive en casa propia con su padres.
Jorge empezó desde muy joven a trabajar como guarda de la Empresa de Transporte Paraguarí y la venta de leche, luego de adquirir un poco de capital emprendió una nueva labor la de macatero, que lo realiza todos los días después de trabajar como guarda y los fines de semanas en la ciudad de Paraguarí y las compañías cercanas a la ciudad.
Jorge es un joven muy sacrificado quién siempre tuvo que trabajar para ayudarle a sus padres  y hermanos para salir adelante y mejorar la calidad de vida, pues son personas muy humilde.
Necesita el crédito para la compra de mercaderías, por que gracias a su esfuerzo y a la calidad de sus productos cuenta con  una considerable demanda.
texts.en:
Jorge is 22 years old.  He is single and lives in his own home with his parents.

Jorge began working from a very young age as a guard with the Paraguayan Transport Company and also selling milk.  Then he acquired a little capital and began a new job as a travelling salesman which he does every day after he finishes his work as a guard and on weekends, in the city of Paraguarí and in companies near the city.

Jorge is a very selfless young man who has always had to work to help his parents and his siblings get ahead and improve their quality of life since they are very humble people.

He needs this loan to buy merchandise because, thanks to his hard work and the quality of his products, his products are in pretty high demand.

loans.use: To buy merchandise (t-shirts, jeans, sneakers, etc.)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more cotton and plastic slippers

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a married woman with five children, four attend school while one graduated from school. She owns a house that has piped water but not electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a fresh water selling business for over one year and sells from home to her neighbours. Judith faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. During the hot summer season, the supply of water becomes low compared to the high demand at the market. She hopes to open a poultry business in the future.

With the Kshs 25,000, she wants to start a poultry business and  purchase a brood of chicken. She decided to join Yehu to access loans and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase a chickens to start poultry business

loans.name: Jayanti

texts.en:
This is 39-year-old Jayanti B..  She is married and has 3 children aged 20, 18 and 13.  In 2007, she established  her vegetable farming business.  Working 7 days a week and 5 hours a day, she supports her family.  

She has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to purchase seed and fertilizer for her business.  In the future, Jayanti plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural.  Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land.  Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet.  With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seed and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market.  Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.  

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates:  BPW Partner Page.     Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team.

loans.use: To buys seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Odinga

texts.en:
Odinga T., aged 36 years, is a livestock trader. He is married to Kilena who is a farmer, and together they have three children aged fifteen, ten and four years. Odinga operates his livestock trading business in Enkaroni market in Kajiado which is a very busy market. He also sells his cattle to traders from Kitengela and to the Kenya meat commission for slaughter as well. Odinga has been running this business for eleven years, and his monthly profit is 25,000 KES.

Odinga was introduced to Kadet by the credit officer in charge of Kitengela’s office. He has applied for a 40,000 KES loan which he plans to use to buy cows and part of it will be used to buy goats for trade. If the loan boosts the business, Odinga will buy a pickup to help in transporting his livestock to other markets.

Odinga describes himself as hardworking and ambitious. He dreams of opening a butchery in Enkaroni market so as to sell meat to customers at retail as well as continuing in his livestock trade.

loans.use: To buy livestock for trading

loans.name: Ashkhen

texts.en:
Ashkhen P. is a widow living with her 2 student sons. She has been trading in tools and electric appliances at "Dinamo" market since 1995. 

Ashkhen’s business income covers the family’s general expenses and one of her son’s university fees. Ashken orders the inventory from a number of countries. With a good credit history behind her, Ashkhen has approached SEF for the first time after identifying it as a reliable lender, offering better terms and personalized service. Ashkhen’s loan will cover the customs fees of her inventory order.

loans.use: To pay custom fees for inventory order

loans.name: Pa Santigie

texts.en:
This is 50-year-old Pa Santigie. He is married and has 6 children ages 20, 15, 12, 10, 8 and 5. In 1995, Pa Santigie established his ground nuts business. He began his business through the help of his cousin because he wanted to generate more income. Working 5 days a week and 9 hours a day, he earns about Le 760000 every month. 
He would like a loan in the amount of Le 4000000 in order to buy more bags of ground nuts. He hopes this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 360000. In the future, Pa Santigie plans to establish a savings account for old age. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy ground nuts for resale

loans.name: Thikaymai

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Thikaymai D..  She is married and has 3 children aged 20, 18, and 13.  In 2009, she established  her vegetable farming business.  Working 7 days a week and 5 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 6 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer for her business.  In the future, Thikaymai plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural.  Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land.  Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet.  With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market.  Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.  

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates:
 BPW Partner Page.     Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El comité lleva por nombre Kuña Guapa de Curupayty debido a que todas conocidas y por medio de este emprendimiento fortalecerían el lazo entre ellas, actualmente se encuentran en el primer ciclo, integrada por 10  emprendedoras señoras, quienes ponen lo mejor de si para aumentar sus ingresos y por ende brindarle lo mejor a sus respectivas familias. 
Una de las integrantes y presidenta del grupo es la señora Sabina J. quien se dedica a la cria de gallinas ponedoras para vender huevos.
Actualmente cuenta con gran cantidad de gallina y abastece a varios negocios de la zona con sus productos.
Solilicita el préstamo para la compra de balanceado especiales para gallinas ponedoras.
texts.en:
This committee is called  Kuña Guapa de Curupayty since all the members of the committee are acquaintances and through this undertaking they will strengthen the bond between themselves.  They are currently in their first loan cycle.  There are 10 female entrepreneurs in this committee who all put the best of themselves into increasing their income and thereby providing the best for their respective families.

One of the members, and the president of the group, is Mrs Sabina J. who raises laying hens to sell eggs.

Currently she has a large number of hens and she supplies several businesses in the area with her products.

She is requesting this loan to buy special balanced animal feed for laying hens.

loans.use: To buy balanced animal feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en: Thomas is a 64-year-old married man with six children staying in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is vested with the duty of providing basics to eight household members and his family aspiration is being able to set up an income-generating activity for his children. For eight years now, Thomas has been farming and boasts of paying school fees of four of his children from the income generated from farming. His business dream is to buy more land and farm extensively. Therefore, he needs the loan to purchase a piece of land to make a plantation of bananas to sell when they mature.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land for planting bananas to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more gara clothing for resale

loans.name: Reynaldo De Jesus

texts.es: Reynaldo De Jesús tiene 23 años, su actividad es la venta de ropa en tienda. Hace más de 5 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que no ha sido fácil mantener este negocio, el ha sido un padre muy responsable y dedicado. Su mama tenía cierta experiencia con este tipo de negocio. La mayoría de sus clientes son sus amigos, vecinos y público en general el está pendiente de lo que sus clientes le solicitan. Reynaldo solicita este crédito para la compra de pantalones, camisas formales, vestidos, trajes para damas y caballeros entre otras pues se acerca la temporada navideña y tiene muchos pedidos.
texts.en:
Reynaldo De Jesús is 23 years old.  He sells clothes in a store.  He has had this business for over five years.  It has not been easy to maintain this business.  He has been a very responsible and dedicated father.  His mother has experience in this type of business.

Most of his customers are friends, neighbors, and the general public.  He is always concerned about his customers’ needs.  

Reynaldo is requesting a loan to buy pants, formal shirts, dresses, and suits for women and men, among others.  The Christmas season is coming, and he has a lot of orders.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Mariam N. M. is a 38-year-old retail shop owner in Jomvu, Mombasa. She is married to Patrick Kimathi who contributes to the family’s total income. Together they are blessed with three children. She has run a retail shop for the last year, and she says that business has been good so far.

Mariam joined KADET LTD just the other day. She has applied for her first loan which she would like to use to purchase more stocks of cereals, cooking oil and fats. She hopes to use the anticipated profits from her shop to boost her embroidery business as a secondary source of income.

She hopes to succeed in life.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of cereals, cooking oil and fats

loans.name: Osman

texts.en: This is 33-year-old Osman. He is married and has 2 children ages 8 and 5. He has two additional dependents who live with him because they help around his home. In 1999, Osman established his plastics business because he wanted to maximize profits and generate income. Working 6 days a week and 6 hours a day, he earns about Le 1090000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 4000000 in order to purchase more stock. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more plastic buckets, bowls, and slippers, etc.

loans.name: Celine

texts.fr:
Femme remarquable de 48ans très ambitieuse et responsable ayant 5 personnes en charge. Commerçante des friperies. Elle à fait preuve d’un bon remboursement lors du premier prêt.
Le prêt lui à permis à améliorer sa manière de gérer son commerce car elle à appris la gestion de stock, comment tenir un journal de caisse et grâce à cela ses revenus journaliers ont augmentés de 30.000frs à 55.000frs.
Avec  le prochain prêt, elle va augmentée son stock pour faire accroître son capital en achetant divers ballots de friperie comme les draps et serviettes non utilises.
Elle à améliorer ses conditions de vie et de ses 4 enfants, qui en plus ont été inscrits dans des institutions privées; elle tient a aller jusqu'au bout de son objectif, toujours avec Hope pour qu'elle accomplisse ses ambitions
texts.en:
Celine is a remarkable, ambitious woman of 48 years old who is responsbile for 5 persons. She is a seller of cloth. She already received and successfully reimbursed a previous loan, which allowed her to improve the management of her business by learning how to manage her stock and keep a record of transactions. Her daily profits increased from 30.000 frs to 55.000 frs.

With is asking for another loan in order to further increase her stock by purchasing large bundles of cloth such as sheets and towels. She increased the quality of her life as well as those of her children, who are also currently enrolled in private education institutions. She would like to continue with her objectives and work with Hope microfinance institution to achieve her ambitions.

loans.use: Purchase bundles of sheets and towels

loans.name: Dzende

texts.en:
Dzende is a married woman with one child who graduated from school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

She has been selling food from home for over seven years to her neighbours and passers-by. Previously, selling charcoal contributed to her other source of income.  Dzende faces a major challenge of thieves in her business. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase maize flour, wheat flour and cooking oil for her food stall business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase maize flour, wheat flour, cooking oil

loans.name: Lesian

texts.en:
Lesian O. Koshooi, aged 54 years, is married to Molomet, a farmer aged 54 years, and together they have five children. Two of their children are married farmers, and the other three, aged fourteen, thirteen and ten years, are in school. He describes himself as hardworking and ambitious.

Lesian trades livestock in Enkaroni market in Bissil, which is a busy market. He sells his livestock to the Kenya meat commission and to butchers in the Kajiado and Kitengela areas. He has been running his business for ten years and earns a monthly profit of 13,500 KES.

Lesian was introduced to KADET by the credit officer in charge of Kitengela’s office. He has borrowed 40,000 KES with which he plans to use 20,000 KES to buy cows, 10,000 KES to buy goats and 10,000 KES to buy sheep for trading. If the loan boosts his business, he will buy a piece of land and build some commercial houses.

Lesian’s dream is to become a big supplier of livestock to the Kenya meat commission’s slaughter houses.

loans.use: To buy cows, goats and sheep

loans.name: Adjélé Mawuégna

texts.fr: Adjélé a 32 ans et est mariée à un médecin.  Elle a un enfant. Elle est née à Lomé et habite vakpossito. Elle a remboursé beaucoup de crédits.  Pour contribuer au ménage, elle fait le commerce de charbons de bois et compte dans cette activité 3 ans déjà. Elle achète à Kpalimé et revend à Lomé près de L’EPP makafui à vesomé. Le prêt demandé lui permettra d’acheter 28 sacs de charbons pour satisfaire  plus de clients.
texts.en: Adjélé is 32 years old and married to a doctor. She has one child. She is born in Lomé and lives in Vakpossito. She has repaid many prior loans. In order to help with household expenses, she sells charcoal and has three years of experience in this business. She stocks up in Kpalimé and resells in Lomé, near to the EPP Makafui building in Vesomé. The requested loan will allow her to buy 28 bags of charcoal to be able to accommodate more customers.

loans.use: Purchasing charcoal

loans.name: Laurence

texts.en:
Laurence is forty four years old. She is married and has five children between the ages of two and twenty two. One of her children goes to school. Her husband works as a rock extractor. Laurence sells green bananas. 

She would like to request this loan to buy more green bananas to sell. With the profit from this business she will renovate her house and save money. Her business prospers because she provides good customer care. In the future she would like to buy a motorbike to help her in this business.

loans.use: To buy more green bananas to sell

loans.name: Lesalaon

texts.en:
Lesalaon Ole K., aged 42 years, is married to Meeli Lesalaon. Together they have three children: Mary, aged 24 in college; Judy, aged 20 in secondary school; and John aged 10 in primary school. Lesalaon trades livestock in Bissil market, which is a busy market. He sells his livestock to butchers in Kajiado and Kitengela for slaughter. He has been running his business for ten years and gets a monthly profit of 25,500 KES. He describes himself as hardworking and focused.

Lesalaon was introduced to Kadet by the credit officer in charge of Kitengela’s office. He is borrowing 20,000 KES with which he plans to use 10,000 KES to buy cows, 5,000 KES to buy goats and 5,000 KES to buy sheep for trading. If the loan boosts the business, he will buy a pickup for transporting his livestock to other towns.

Lesalaon’s dream is to become a big supplier of livestock to the Kenya meat commission’s slaughter houses like that in Dagorreti in Nairobi.

loans.use: To buy cows, goats and sheep.

loans.name: Pablo Marvin

texts.es: Pablo Marvin tiene 64 años, su actividad es el servicio de comedor. Hace más de 10 años que tiene este negocio. El inicio este medio de vida porque tenía una familia de la cual hacerse cargo. Pablo es un hombre muy trabajador y siempre se ha caracterizado ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes. Uno de sus mayores desafíos es la gran competencia que tiene debido a esto le brinda buen servicio y platillos cómodos y algunos buenos clientes tienen crédito. El motivo de Pablo con este financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima como granos básicos, verduras, jugos, gaseosas entre otras actualmente se aproxima la época navideña.
texts.en:
Pablo Marvin is 64 years old.  He runs a small restuarant and has been for more than 10 years.  Pablo began this type of life because he has a family to take care of.  Pablo is a very hard working man, characterized by always offering the best service to his customers. One of his greatest challenges is the competition his restuarant faces.  Because of this, Pablo offers good service and convienent food and gives some clients meals on credit.

Pablo wants to use this loan to buy primary goods like basic grains, vegetables, juice, and soft drinks among other things, since it is entering the holiday season.

loans.use: Buying food and drinks for his restaurant.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more jeans, t-shirts and shoes

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 51  años, vive en casa propia, está casado con la señora Amada Duarte, tienen seis hijos de los cuales 3 ya son profesionales y los restantes  están cursando sus respectivos estudios, gracias al esfuerzo de sus padres todos tienen posibilidad de recibir buena educación.
Pedro emprendió su actividad como carpintero hace más de 25 años, heredó la profesión de su padre quién fue unos de los carpinteros más conocido de la ciudad, Pedro cuenta con clientela formada. Realiza todo tipo de muebles para cocinas, puertas talladas, marcos para puertas y ventanas.
Pedro es un señor muy sacrificado quien se esfuerza diariamente para brindarle lo mejor a su familia y buena educación a sus hijos para adquirir una profesión universitaria.
Necesita el crédito para la compra de maderas en general para aumentar su stock.
texts.en:
Pedro is 51 and lives in his own home with his wife Amada Duarte. They have six children, 3 of whom are already professionals and the rest are studying. Thanks to their parents' efforts they all have a chance to receive a good education. 

Pedro started as a carpenter more than 25 years ago. He learned from his father who was on of the most recognized carpenters in the city. Pedro has an established clientele. He makes all types of kitchen cabinets, doors, door frames and windows.

Pedro is a dedicated man who strives daily to offer his family a better quality of life and a good education for his children, so they can get a college degree. He needs the loan to buy different wood to increase his stock.

loans.use: Purchase wood

loans.name: Esperance

texts.en:
Esperance is 33 years old and married to a driver. She has four children who are between six and eight years old. Only one of her children attends school, the others are expected to be enrolled next year. 

Esperance owns a lady’s salon and she has been doing this business for four years. She has requested this loan to buy more hairdressing supplies and beauty products. She is expecting to save her money in the account she has at Urwego. In the future, she would like to be an entrepreneur and employ many employees in her business.

loans.use: To buy hair dressing and beauty products

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew, age 56, is married to Shiprah Wangeci, and together they have three children. He is a photographer within the Nairobi business center.

Andrew was introduced to Kadet by a friend who was already a member. This is his first loan with KADET. He intends to use it to buy a digital camera for his business since the one he has been using is an older model.

From the returns of this loan, Andrew intends to expand his business and be able to open another outlet. In the future, he hopes that he will be able to open his own studio.

loans.use: To buy a digital camera

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is 27 years old. She is married to a motor vehicle mechanic and they have three children who are aged between three and ten. Rachel sells car fuel, spare parts and gas. She has been in this business for ten years. 

She will use this loan to buy more fuel and spare parts to sell and the profit from the business will be used to set up a business which will facilitate her business in terms of transportation. Her business has helped to solve some family needs and to raise school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts to sell

loans.name: Safiya

texts.en:
Safiya is 28 years old. She is married to an accountant who works for the bank. They have two children who are two and ten years old. Safiya owns a beauty salon and she has had this business for four years. 

She has requested this loan to buy more shampoo, conditioner and hair care products. The expected profit from this business will be used for savings. Safiya says that her business has done achievable things like paying school fees for her children and also sustains her home needs.

loans.use: To buy hair care products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more shoes

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 32 years old.  He is married to a farmer. He has four children who are between four and seven years old. Two of his children go to school while the other two are still too young to go to school. 

Daniel sells clothes and he has spent thirteen years in this business. He needs this loan to buy more men's clothes to sell.  He says that his business is successful because it sustains the family's needs. He expects to expand his business from the profit that will be obtained.

loans.use: To buy more men's clothes to sell

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is a married woman with two children, one attends school while the other one is still too young for school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are electricity bills and food for the family. 

For over five years, she has operated a Kikoi selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passers-by.  She hopes to expand and open a boutique in the future. 

With the Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase a bale of Kikoi's for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get loans to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase a bale of Kikoi's for resale

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary N. lives in the Mengo Mackay neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has  2 children, all of whom are in school.  

Mary  has a business of  crafts.  She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week.  Mary  sells her products door-to-door, by means of wholesale.  

Mary  has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy  more mats and baskets. The main business challenges for  Mary  include  transportation and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are  to start weaving mats and baskets herself.    

Mary  lives in a home that she owns.  She doesn't have access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include  school fees and feeding the family .

loans.use: To buy mats and baskets for resale

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Appolonie

texts.en: Appolonie is single. She sells women's clothes and has been doing this for three years. She would like this loan to buy more blouses, skirts and dresses to sell. The profit from this business will be used to replenish her inventory. Appolonie says that her business helped a lot in her education and even helped support her relatives.

loans.use: To buy more women's clothes to sell.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en:
Jeanne is 30 years old. She is married and has four children who are between three and ten years old. All her children are enrolled in school except the youngest. Her husband works as a stonemason. Jeanne has a restaurant business. She has been doing this business for a period of five years. 

Jeanne would like to get a loan to purchase more utensils and other food and beverages to sell. With the profit from the business, she would like to establish a new business of tailoring because she is qualified in that field. Her business helped a great deal as she has managed to raise enough to help with construction.

loans.use: To buy more food and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a resident of Litein Town in Rift Valley, Kenya and has been doing mixed farming and selling her produce of tea and milk locally. She employs a farmhand and has seven children. 

She has requested a loan of 70,000 KES to improve her dairy production. She previously acquired a loan of 40,000 KES and paid it back. She hopes to generate better income to take good care of her family. She has no challenges in her business except for finances.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en:
Zainabu is 31 years old. She is a widow and has three children between the ages of eight and sixteen. Zainabu owns a salon for ladies and she has been working in this business for many years.  She has had a very difficult life and started working when she was 13 years old. 

Zainabu has requested this loan to buy more beauty care products and cosmetics to sell. She says that the profit will be used to finance her daily home expenditures and pay school fees for her children. She would like to have a large business in the future.

loans.use: To buy more beauty care products to sell.

loans.name: Komla

texts.fr: Il a 25 ans et est marié. Il est né à Tsévié et vit à Lomé quartier avédji ou il a le siège de son activité principale. Il exerce comme activité génératrice de revenus, la vente de pièces détachées à deux roues et compte dans cette activité 2 ans déjà.  Il s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé et  revend à avedji  à côté de la limousine. IL espère accroitre son commerce avec le crédit sollicité.
texts.en: He is 25 years old and married. He is born in Tsévié and lives in Lomé, in the Avédji district, which is also where his store is located. He sells spare parts for motorbikes. He has two years of experience in this business. He stocks up at the big market of Lomé and resells in Avedji, by the limousine service. He hopes to be able to expand his business thanks to the loan he is requesting.

loans.use: Purchasing spare parts

loans.name: Hazron

texts.en: Hazron is a 28-year-old married man.  He is blessed with a two-year-old child.  For a living, he sells wood products and runs a boutique.  He has been in the business for nine years.  In addition, he sells fruits and vegetables for extra income.  He gives gratitude to Faulu Kenya for helping him to improve his business.  He has also managed to save his money through Faulu Kenya.  He has requested a loan of 60,000 Kes to buy African design fabric called Kitenge, children’s clothes and bed covers.

loans.use: To buy African design fabric called Kitenge, children’s clothes and bed covers.

loans.name: Seraphine

texts.en:
Seraphine is 52 years old. She is a widow and has five children who are between the ages of 18 and 30. Three of her children go to school. Seraphine sells green bananas. She has had this business for seven years. 

Seraphine is requesting this loan to buy more green bananas to sell. With the profit from this business, she will be able to increase the volume of green bananas she has been selling. She says that business is successful because her bananas are attractive and she has many customers.  In the future, she would like to own her own truck to supply food to big institutions.

loans.use: To buy more green bananas to sell.

loans.name: Lassie

texts.en: This is 47 year-old Lassie. She is married and has five children ages 4, 7, 9, 12 and 16. In 2005, Lassie established her textile and suitcase business. She began her business because she wanted to help her husband improve their home from the profit generated from her sales. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,200,000 every month. She would like a loan of Le 4,000,000 to add more stock to the business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 800,000. In the future, Lassie plans to educate her children and buy land to build a house. She wants to purchase stock from Sierra Leone's neighboring country, Guinea, to make more profit by selling wholesale to other traders. She is very hard working and dedicated and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy suitcases and clothing

loans.name: Philomene

texts.en:
Philomene is 49 years old. She is married and has five children who are between 14 and 21 years old. Philomene sells local juice. She has spent 17 years in this business. 

Philomene is requesting this loan to buy more local juice to sell. With the profit from this business, she will increase the quantity of what she has been selling. She says that her business is well known because people like the local juice. She would like to own a big shop in the future.

loans.use: To buy more local juice to sell.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is 53 years old. She is married and has five children between the ages of 16 and 30.  One of her children goes to school.  Her husband works as a farmer. Marie has a shop where she sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, lotions, and biscuits. She has had this business for six years. 

With this loan, Marie will buy more sugar and rice to sell. She will save money from the profit of this business.  Marie believes she has a successful because many people like what she sells. She would like to have a nice looking house in the future.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, rice and biscuits to sell.

loans.name: Joselyne

texts.en:
Joselyne is 28 years old. She is married and has three children between six months and seven years old. One of her children goes to school. Her husband works as a technician. Joselyne sells spare parts for bicycles. She has spent seven years in this business. 

With this loan, she will buy more spare parts for bicycles to sell. She will continue to increase her stock of spare parts from any profits made. She says that she is successful because she has a unique business. If she gets enough profits, she dreams of buying a car in the future.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts for bicycles to sell.

loans.name: Philippe

texts.en:
Philippe is 28 years old. He is married and has three children between the ages of two and eight. Two of his children go to school. He is married to a businesswoman. Philippe works as a transporter. He transports people and goods. He has had this business for five years. 

Phillippe is requesting this loan to buy another means of transportation which will bring greater returns to his business. With the profit from this business of transporting people and goods he will make sure that his children can be educated. He says that his business is successful because he has a lot of respect for his business. In the future, he would like to supply goods to others.

loans.use: To buy more vehicles for transportation, such as a motorcycle.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is a married woman with six adult children. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

She has owned a real estate agency for the past ten years in which neighbors and town dwellers are her potential customers. She faces a major challenge of delayed payments by tenants. She hopes to build more rental houses in the future. 

With the Kshs 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase cement to renovate her rental houses. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase cement to renovate her rental houses.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 32 years old, married and the father of one child. He operates a boda boda (transport) business in Mathanja, Kiambu district. James has been in business for the last four years and is relatively busy in terms of business and has a large clientele as well, which is good for any business.

He got to know about KADET through a friend who was already a member. This is his first loan with KADET and with no previous credit history. With this loan James hopes to buy another motorcycle and employ someone else to boost his profits.

He desires to give his family a good life and provide a good education for his child.

loans.use: To buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine is thirty-two years old. She is married and has five children who are between five and sixteen years old. All of her children go to school. Her husband is a farmer. Vestine sells food. She has spent sixteen years in this business. 

With this loan, Vestine will buy more food to sell. The profit from this business will allow her to increase the volume of food that she sells. She says her business is common and has a good reputation for customer service. In the future, she would like to double her business stock, as well as her profit.

loans.use: To buy more food to sell.

loans.name: Delphine

texts.en:
Delphine is 27 years old. She is married and has one child who is two years old. Her husband is a businessman who sells a variety of items for home consumption. Delphine sells food. She has spent 6 years in this business.
