She is requesting a loan to buy more food to sell. She plans to save the profits from her business. She says her business succeeds because of she is quite popular and well-known.  She would like to have a Frisian cow in the future.

loans.use: To buy more food to sell

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married woman. She is 40 years old and a mother of four children. She stays in the Mutomo area in Kibwezi. She sells her wares by hawking from door to door and from shop to shop and also in marketplaces. Her goods include body oils, soaps and tea leaves. This is her primary business, which she has been doing for six years now. 

She got to know about KADET through a KADET staff member. She has previously borrowed from other financial institutions. With this loan advance, she plans to increase her stock so that she can get better returns.

loans.use: Asha plans to buy body oil, bathing soap and other products

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha K. lives in the Kyebando neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has two children, one of whom goes to school.  She also takes care of additional family members (her parents). Aisha has a retail shop. She has been in this business for four years and works 6 days a week. She has requested a loan of 400,000/- Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt and boxes of soap. Her main business challenges include transportation and competition. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to expand. 

Aisha lives in a home that she rents. She has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt and boxes of soap

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy jeans and cosmetics

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josphine M., aged 33 years, runs a retail shop at the Bissil market. Her customers are mainly livestock traders and Bissil inhabitants. 

She is married to Joseph Thila, who is a farmer, and together they have two sons, aged 10 years in standard 7 and 2 years. 

She was introduced to Kadet by the credit officer in charge of the Kitengela office. She has been running this business for 10 years and her monthly income is 34,100 Kenyan shillings (Kshs).

This being her second loan with Kadet, Josphine plans to use 40,000 Kshs to buy bags of rice from Tanzania and Kshs 40,000 to buy bags of sugar. If the loan boosts the business, she will open a wholesale store.

Josphine describes herself as hardworking and she has dreams of having a big wholesale store in Bissil.

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar for sale

loans.name: Renacer San Francisco Group

texts.es:
El comité lleva por nombre Renacer San Francisco, actualmente se encuentran en el primer ciclo con calificación excelente, integrada por 15 emprendedoras señoras, quienes ponen lo mejor D. sí mismas para aumentar sus ingresos y por enD. brindarle lo mejor a sus respectivas familias.
Una D. las integrantes es L. señora Andresa quien se dedica a L. venta D. cosmetibles D. diferentes tipos.
Asi elL. todos los dias prepara sus productos para L. venta como empanadas, milanesa, tortillas, todos a precios muy accesibles para L. gente que trabajan por el barrio.
Comenta que tiene buena venta diariamente con L. misma cubre bien su cuota y los gastos diario para L. alimentacion D. su familia L. cual es muy importante para elL.,y asegura que seguira trabajando mucho.
Solicita le préstamo para L. compra D. carne y otros insumos para su cosmetibles.
texts.en:
The committee is named Renacer San Francisco ("Rebirth San Francisco").  They are currently in their first loan cycle with excellent grades.  It is maD. up of 15 entrepreneurial women, who put forth their best efforts to increase their incomes in order to give the best to their respective families..

One of the women is Mrs. Andresa, who sells different types of foods.  Every day she prepares food to sell--empanadas, breaded filets of meat, and tortillas--all at prices accessible for the people who work in her neighborhood.  Mrs. Andresa says she has good daily sales, so she is able to cover her payment installments and daily costs for taking care of her family, which is very important for her and ensures that she will continue working hard.

Mrs. Andresa is asking for a loan to buy meat and other ingredients for her food.

loans.use: Buy meat and other ingredients for food she sells

loans.name: Abra Fidèle

texts.fr: Fidèle a 48 ans, mariée et mère d’un enfant. Elle est née à agou et habite adidogomé.  Pour participer au ménage, elle exerce comme activité la restauration et cumule 5 ans déjà.  Elle s’approvisionne au  grand marché de Lomé et revend à Franciskain  en face de Leader Price adidogomé. Le crédit sollicité  permettra d’acheter 6 tas d’ignames et 5 sacs de maïs pour la restauration et satisfaire plus de clients.
texts.en: Fidele is 48 years old, married and the mother of one child. She is born in Agou and lives in Adidogomé. In order to help provide for the family’s needs, she prepares food for sale. She has been doing this for five years already. She stocks up at the big market of Lomé and resells in Franciscan district in front on the Leader Price supermarket of Adidogomé. The credit she is seeking will allow her to purchase six piles of yams and five bags of corn for her cooking, allowing her to serve more customers.

loans.use: Purchasing yams and corn to prepare food for sale

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice N., aged 30 years, is a single mother of three children. One of her two sons is employed while the other son and daughter are still in school. She sells clothes at Athi River Estate, which is a busy market, and to residents of Portland, Bamburi, Makadara, and at Kenya meat commission factories. She has been running her business for the last 16 years and she gets a monthly profit of 3,500 Kenyan shillings from the business.

Alice was introduced to Kadet by the credit officer in charge of the Kitengela office. She has applied for a loan, which she wants to use to buy more clothes for selling. If the loan boosts the business, she will open a boutique and sell both locally made and imported clothes.

Alice describes herself as a hardworking and focused lady who has dreams of having a big boutique in the future.

loans.use: To buy clothes for sale

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en: This is 41-year-old Kadiatu. She is married and has 2 children aged 4 and 8. In 2002, Kadiatu established her assorted drinks business. She began her business because she wanted to help her family. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 600,000 every month. She would like a loan of Le 3,000,000 to buy more stock of mega cola, coca cola and other drinks. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 400,000. In the future, Kadiatu plans to educate her children to university level and to use part of her profit to support her husband and to build a house. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more drinks for her business

loans.name: Manisha

texts.en:
This is 22-year-old Manisha S.. She is married and has one child, aged 3. In 2007, she established her tea shop business. Working 7 days a week and 7 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 4 loans from Patan BPW. She used her most recent loan to purchase food for her business. 

In the future, Manisha plans to lift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

Whether on the streets of Kathmandu or in the villages outside the capital, tea shops are places of business and meeting in Nepal. Called a chiya pasal, these tea shops make a sweet, milky tea that can be purchased for a few cents a cup. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to keep their store shelves stocked while increasing their profit margins by buying in greater volume. 

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community. For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates:
 BPW Partner Page     Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team

loans.use: to buy food for her tea shop

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a married man with seven children. Through farming, he is able to provide for his family. He has been farming for twenty years and has managed to employ one person. He appreciates Faulu Kenya for financially supporting him in improving his business and his standard of living. He has requested 50,000 Kes to buy seeds, fertilizers and farming equipment.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers and farming equipment

loans.name: Uulkan

texts.en:
Uulkan B. is a young and entrepreneurial woman. She finished secondary school, but could not continue her studies. In order to support her family,  Uulkan and her elder sisters began business activities in vegetables reselling. She started this business with a capital of only 300 KGS and managed to raise her own floating capital and start her own business at a different market.   

Uulkan is a handicapped person from birth, but in spite of this, worked hard to develop this business and achieved success. She was able to buy a small house near the market and adapt one of the rooms as storage for vegetables. Also, Uulkan is a very attentive daughter and supports her parents with monthly maintenance. 

Uulkan applies for a loan of 55,000 KGS to broaden an assortment of goods, in particular,  apples, cucurbits, persimmons and potatoes. It will allow her to increase her sales and also acquire new customers. With the revenues, she plans to renovate her house and broaden her business. 

Uulkan never despairs and is ready to achieve new levels in her life. As for her personal plans, she dreams to marry and give birth to a child. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To broaden an assortment of goods for resale

loans.name: Evelyn Vanessa

texts.es: Evelyn Vanessa se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Desde hace mas de 13 años, ella tiene su negocio pus siempre se preocupa por proporcionarle a sus clientes ella es una mujer muy lista y disfruta mucho de brindar a sus clientes lo mejor. Ella solicita este crédito para la compra de materia prima ya que acerca una buena temporada como es la navidad, necesita comprar toallas, sabanas, ropa, cosméticos y calzado. Sueña con seguir apoyando a sus 2 hijos menores de edad que todavía están a su cargo.
texts.en: Evelyn Vanessa makes a living selling all types of goods. She has been in business for the past 13 years as she always serves her customers. She is a smart woman who enjoys furnishing the best for her her customers. She is requesting this loan to buy inventory since Christmas is coming up. She needs to buy towels, sheets, clothing, cosmetics and shoes. She hopes to keep providing for her 2  children that still depend on her.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She operates a poultry business from home, her potential customers are neighbours and restaurant operators. Susan faces a major challenge of seasonality and the high cost of transportation in her business. She hopes that someday she will be a big supplier of chicken in the market.  

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the Kshs 80,000 she wants to purchase a brood of chicken and chicken feeds.

loans.use: To purchase chickens and chicken feeds.

loans.name: Mira

texts.en:
This is 23-year-old Mira M..  She is married and has one child, aged 7.  In 2009, she established  her vegetable shop business.  Working 7 days a week and 7 hours a day, she supports her family.

In the future, Mira plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural.  Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land.  Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet.  With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market.  Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.  

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates:  BPW Partner Page.    Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team.

loans.use: To buy vegetables for resale

loans.name: Juan Xxi Group

texts.es:
La B.C. “Amigas por siempre” inicia su ciclo Nº3 en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, es un grupo que ha compartido un año juntas, ya se conocen como amigas y también como garantes.  La banca comunal está compuesta por diez integrantes.  Los negocios que desempeñan son: macramé de mantas, venta de pollo a la broster, verduras, tejido de chompas, venta de mantillas, estilista, macramé, venta de carne de chancho, tejido de lanas, venta de queso y papa.

 La presidenta de la banca comunal, la señora Elsa  es una mujer joven de 23 años de edad, al momento se encuentra esperando su primer bebé.  Comenta que está en la banca comunal de “Amigas por siempre” desde su fundación.  La señora Elsa tiene como negocio tejido a máquina en lana de alpaca, de diferentes tipos de prenda, ponchos, chompas y otros.  Su primer préstamo fue por Bs.1000.- y fue invertido en la compra de lana, para este ciclo su solicitud fue de Bs.2000 con el mismo objetivo.
Cuando se le consultó que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella comenta que le gusta  compartir con sus compañeras.
texts.en:
The “Amigas por siempre” (Friends Forever) Community Bank is in its third loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Central Andean Region. This group has been together for a year, and they know each other as friends and loan partners. The group is comprised of ten members who work in various businesses, such as blanket weaving, broasted chicken sales, vegetables, knitting sweaters, selling lace, hairstyling, macramé, selling pork, knitting with wool, and selling cheese and potatoes.

Mrs. Elsa is the president of the community bank. She is a young woman, 23 years old, and is currently awaiting the arrival of her first baby. She shares she has been part of this community bank since it began. Mrs. Elsa works knitting alpaca wool by machine to make different types of clothing, ponchos, sweaters, and more. Her first loan of 1,000 bolivianos was used to buy wool. The current loan for this cycle is for 2,000 bolivianos to be used for the same purpose.

Her favorite part of working with Pro Mujer is that she likes sharing with her loan partners.

loans.use: To buy wool

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SUMAC PURIRISUN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Clotilde; ella tiene 38 años de edad, conviviente  y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de juguetes para niños como son pelotas, muñecas, robots, carros entre otros y lo vende en forma ambulatoria por las mañanas y por las tardes siendo este el único sustento para su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar mas su pequeño negocio y así poder sacar a sus hijos adelante.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Clotilde belongs to the “Sumac Puririsun” Communal Bank, located in the district, province, and department of  Cusco.  She is 38 years old, in a common law marriage, and has 4 children.  Clotilde's daily activities focus on her business, selling toys to children, including balls, dolls, robots, cars, and other things.  She sells them mornings and afternoons as an itinerant peddler.  This is her family's only source of sustenance.

Clotilde is requesting the loan to expand her small business and thus, advance her children.

Clotilde thanks all who in this manner form part of her dream and she promises to make her payments as scheduled.

loans.use: TO SUPPLY HER ITINERANT TOY-SELLING BUSINESS AND THUS, ADVANCE HER CHILDREN

loans.name: Marthe

texts.fr:
Vendeuse des produits divers, comme les ustensiles de cuisine, habits, chaussures, sandales , les produits cosmétiques et alimentaire.Ce prêt a été bénéfique pour elle,ces recettes se sont accrus cela  lui a permit de rembourser sans problème et d'épargner
Elle exerce ce commerce depuis 5ans, ses ventes journalières  ont augmentées de 15000f à 25000f .

Avec le nouveau  prêt ,elle pense continuer dans le même  élan pour aller de l’avant en  renforçant  son activité en effectuant des voyages afin d’aller acheter a Kinshasa, pointe Noire,elle compte aussi élargir en ouvrant  son restaurant
Orpheline et célibataire elle s’occupe de ses deux sœurs en les soutenant dans leurs études ainsi que de son fils tout en améliorant leur condition de vie.
texts.en:
Marthe M. is a seller of various products like cooking utensils, garments, shoes, sandals, cosmetics, and basic foodstuffs.  This loan will be beneficial to her.  Her earnings will accrue and it will allow her to reimburse her payments without issue and continue to save.  She has been running her business for five years.  Her daily sales have increased from 15,000f to 25,000f.

With this new loan, she intends to continue in the same manner in order to strengthen her business and make trips to Kinshasa and Pointe Noire to purchase goods.  She also intends to expand her business by opening a restaurant.  Orphaned and single, she takes care of her two sisters by supporting them in their studies along with her son, this will improve their quality of life.

loans.use: Buying cooking utensils, garments, sandals, and cosmetics

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María de 49 años, tiene un salón de belleza en la parte delantera de su casa. Vive con su  hijo de 14 años  en una zona urbana llamada Orquídeas ya que en su descubrimiento descubrieron muchas flores y en la actualidad hay un parque de estas flores. 

Hace 20 años atrás ella aprendió hacer manicura y pedicura para poder mantener a su hijo ya que su esposo la abandono, comenzó a hacer el trabajo de casa en casa hasta que con algunos ingresos pudo tener su propio local para tener su peluquería. En la actualidad tiene un salón de belleza donde trabaja sola y hace todo estilo de peinados, cepillados, alisados, tratamientos, pedicura, manicura etc.    

Para continuar con su negocio ella quiere comprar con el préstamo esmaltes, tintes, tratamientos para ofrecerles más alternativas a sus clientes. En el futuro quiere construir mejor su casa y terminar de construir su casa porque ahora es de caña.
texts.en:
María, 49, has a beauty salon in the front part of her house.  She lives with her 14-year-old son in an urban zone, called Orquídeas (Orchids), because when it was discovered there were a lot of flowers and now there is a park with those flowers.

Twenty years ago she learned how to do manicures and pedicures to be able to support her son since her husband abandoned them.  She started doing the work door to door until she was able to collect enough money to have her own place and have her barber shop.  She currently has a beauty salon where she works by herself doing all kinds of hair styles, comb outs, hair straightening, hair treatments, pedicures, manicures, etc.

In order to stay in business she wants to use the loan to buy nail polish, hair dyes and treatments to offer more alternatives to her customers.  In the future she wants to improve the construction of her house because it’s currently made from sugar cane stalks.

loans.use: For hair treatments, nail polish and dyes.

loans.name: Floria

texts.en: Floria is a 30-year-old business-lady who runs a grocery shop. Being a single mother of two, she works hard in her business to provide for and educate her children.  She hopes to be financially stable in the future.  She hopes to own a real estate in the future.  She has requested for 40,000 Kes to buy onions.

loans.use: To buy onions

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothes to sell and corn to make tortillas.

loans.name: Juvenal Angel

texts.es: El Sr.  Juvenal de 32 años y de estado civil soltero, tiene ya varios años dedicándose a la venta y comercialización de ropa, actividad que realiza para ayudar a sus padres a seguir adelante ya que ellos son personas ya de la tercera edad. Juvenal cuenta con un puesto en el Mercado y además de aquello cuenta con un puesto en la populosa Feria. A raíz de la creciente demanda Don Juvenal se vio en la necesidad de acudir a nuestra institución ya que le es imprescindible el poder adquirir más mercadería para los meses venideros ya que la influencia de gente en los distintos Mercados y Ferias se triplica. Don Juvenal presenta un buen historial de deudas en las diferentes instituciones donde ha trabajado y además de aquello cuenta con domicilio conocido en el B. Amboró del Sur de nuestra ciudad, razón por la cual no se le negó dicho crédito el Comprara mercadería por fardo de camisas.
texts.en: Mr. Juvenal, age 32 and single, already has several years experience selling and marketing clothing. He does this activity to help his parents to continue moving forward, since they are already quite old. Juvenal counts on his job in the market, and besides that, he counts on his job in the crowded Fair. Due to the growing demand, Mr. Juvenal saw the need to turn to our institution. For him, the power to acquire more merchandise is indispensable for the upcoming months, since the influence of people in different markets and fairs will triple. Mr. Juvenal presents a good record of debts in the different institutions where he has worked. Besides that, he counts on his well-known address in the "B. Amboró del Sur" ["B. Amboró of the South"] in our city, which is the reason he does not neglect the said loan. He will buy merchandise in the form of bundled shirts.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of shirts to sell as merchandise

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SUMAC PURIRISUN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Hilaria; ella tiene 41 años de edad, conviviente  y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra de material metálico para la carpintería metálica que está ubicado en su hogar a la vez  se dedica a la venta de fruta como plátano, manzana, piña entre otros.
 
La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar mas su carpintería metálica como por ejemplo para la fabricación de puertas, ventanas.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Hilaria, 41, is a member of the “SUMAC PURIRISUN” communal bank located in Cusco district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

She has a live-in partner and four children.  She alternates her daily chores with a business buying metal material for a metal carpentry shop that’s in her house.  She also sells fruits like bananas, apples and pineapples, among others.

She is asking for the loan to better stock her metallic carpentry shop; for example, to make doors and windows.

She thanks all those who share her dream and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To improve her metal carpentry; for example to make doors and windows.

loans.name: Trishna

texts.en:
This is 26-year-old Trishna B..  She is married and has one child, aged 9.  In 2004, she established  her tailoring shop business.  Working 7 days a week and 7 hours a day, she supports her family.  

She has already received and successfully repaid 4 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to purchase raw materials for her tailoring work.  In the future, Trishna plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.

In the Kathmandu Valley, clothing is made to order.  Tailor stalls line the streets where store owners sell material and work their sewing machines.  These skilled tailors make school uniforms for children as well as the the traditional women's kurta surwal and men's daura surwal.  With a Kiva loan, BPW borrowers are able to purchase additional cloth material or sewing machines that will increase production and profitability. 

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates:  BPW Partner Page.  Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team.

loans.use: To buys materials for tailoring business

loans.name: Josephine

texts.fr:
Vendeuse de la quincaillerie de 41 ans. Le premier prêt lui a été très  bénéfique et lui à permis d’améliorer ses conditions de vente et de gestion.
Femme de caractère, elle contrôle son activité chaque jour à l’aide de son journal de caisse.
Le prochain prêt, va lui permettre  d’augmenter  le stock de sa marchandise et d’améliorer ses services au près de sa clientèle.
Elle envoie acheter  sa marchandise a Kinshasa, Cotonou et au Nigeria afin de générer des bénéfices considérables.
Pour sa famille, elle se bat pour que les études de ses enfants aillent vers  de l’avant.
texts.en:
This woman is 41 years old, and she sells hardware supplies. The first loan she received was very helpful as it allowed her to improve her terms of sale and management methods.

A woman of character, she monitors her business on a daily basis using her cash book. 

The next loan will allow her to increase her stocks and improve customer service.

She sends for supplies in Kinshasa, Cotonou and in Nigeria, to generate substantial profits.

She strives to support her children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase electric wiring, light bulbs, outlets, circuit breakers, woodworking tools, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a photocopying machine.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah M. lives in the Kyebando Nsooba neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has 3 children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members.   

Sarah has a business selling second-hand clothes.  She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week.   Sarah sells her products door-to-door, by means of retail.      

Sarah has requested a loan of 400000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of second hand clothes.   She also generates additional income through room rentals.

The main business challenges for   Sarah   include transportation and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling wholesale only and start importing clothes. 

Sarah lives in a home that she owns.  She has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more second-hand clothes to resell

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal  “LOS LIDERES ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Alejandro; El socio tiene 68 años de edad, el es casado y tiene 7 hijos, el socio tiene un pequeño negocio de confección de ropa y tiendas de abarrotes, el socio trabaja desde hace 20 años en la atención de su tienda de abarrotes y en la confección de ternos para caballeros y señoras, el socio  requiere el préstamo para invertir en sus dos negocios la esposa de el socio  necesita aumentar productos para su tienda de abarrotes y el comprará hilos y reparará su máquina de coser. El socio solicita el préstamo para poder invertir en la compra de productos de primera necesidad como harina, leche, fideos, panetones, champan y el socio hilos y reparar su máquina  de coser.

El socio  agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su cuota en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Alejandro is a member of the communal bank "Los Lideres."  This communal bank is located in the Huanchac district, which is in the province and department of Cusco.

Alejandro is 68 years old, married, and has 7 children.  He has a small business making clothing and a grocery store.  He has been running his grocery store and making suits for men and women for 20 years. He needs a loan to invest in his 2 businesses.  His wife needs to increase the products in his grocery store, and he will buy thread and repair his sewing machine.  He requests this loan so that he can invest in consumer goods such as flour, milk, noodles, panettones (sweet breads typically sold at Christmas) and champagne, and he will also use the loan to repair his sewing machine.

Alejandro appreciates and values the loan granted through these means, and so is committed to making his payments according to the established time frame.

loans.use: he needs a loan to invest in consumer goods such as flour, milk, noodles, panettones, and champagne for his store, and thread and sewing machine repairs for his dressmaking business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The purchase of replacement parts to improve his truck.

loans.name: Jose Arnoldo

texts.es: José Arnoldo tiene 56 años, su actividad es una barbería y venta de productos de barbería. Hace más de 39 años que tiene este negocio, es un hombre responsable y que disfruta de su negocio y el poder hablar con sus clientes. La experiencia obtenida en este medio de vida todos los días se levanta temprano para realizar los arreglos correspondientes en su negocio que son necesarios. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima como talcos, tijeras, cuchillas, navajas y maquinas para afeitar.
texts.en: José Arnoldo is 56 years old.  He has a barber shop and he sells hair care products.  He has had this business for more than 39 years.  He is a responsible man who enjoys his work and talking to his customers, who has gained experience through his work.  He gets up early every day to carry out the necessary arrangements for his business.  The reason for this loan is to purchase supplies such as powders, scissors, blades, razors and shavers.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, needles and buttons

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SUMAC PURIRISUN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Dominga; ella tiene 70 años de edad, soltera  y tiene 6 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de animales como son cuyes, gallinas y luego lo distribuye a la selva, la socia es una persona muy emprendedora y con muchas ganas de seguir trabajando.  

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar más animales (cuyes, gallinas) y así poder vender más a sus clientes.
 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the Sumac Puririsun communal bank.  The bank is located in Cusco District, which belongs to Cusco Province and Department.

The member's name is Dominga.  She is a 70-year-old single woman with six children.  Dominga balances household duties with her business buying animals like guinea pigs and hens to sell to people in rural areas.  She is very enterprising and has a great desire to keep working.

She is asking for the loan to buy more animals (guinea pigs and hens) so she can sell more to her customers.
 
Dominga is grateful to all those who are helping to make her dream come true, and she promises to make her payments on schedule.

loans.use: Buy more animals (guinea pigs, hens) to sell to her customers

loans.name: Lideres Del Tercer Milenio Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LIDERES DEL TERCER MILENIO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la Cusco y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Srta. Rosvet; ella es soltera; La socia se dedica a la compra y venta de cuyes, ella estudio la carrera profesional de zootecnia y se dedica a la crianza de cuyes, ella vende en forma independiente en los diferentes mercados de la ciudad de Cusco como en el mercado San Pedro, la socia quiere mejorar el negocio de compra y venta de cuyes y también ampliar el negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar 300 a 250 cuyes.

 
Los otros socios  se dedican a la venta de libros, confección de ropa, distribución de libros y negocio de filmaciones de videos.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These women belong to the “Líderes del Tercer Milenio” (Leaders of the Third Millenium) community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Rosvet is single.  She buys and sells guinea pigs.  She studied a university course in zootechnics (animal husbandry) and she raises guinea pigs which she sells independently in the different markets of the city of Cusco such as the San Pedro market.  She would like to improve her guinea pig business and would also like to expand her business.  She is requesting this loan to buy 250 to 300 guinea pigs.

The other members work selling books, making clothes, distributing books and shooting videos.

Rosvet is grateful to those who will take part in her dream by funding her loan and pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy 250 - 300 guinea pigs

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
This is 25-year-old Sabina B..  She is married and has one child, aged 3.  In 2000, she established her vegetable farming business.  Working 7 days a week and 5 hours a day, she supports her family.  

She has already received and successfully repaid 5 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buys seeds and fertilizer for her farm.  

In the future, Sabina plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural.  Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land.  Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet.  With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market.  Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.  

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates:  BPW Partner Page.  Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Justine

texts.fr:
Commerçante marié de 49ans vendant des ustensiles de cuisine depuis 16ans. Elle à fait preuve d’un bon remboursement lors du premier prêt.  
Le prêt passé lui à permis de mieux gérer son stock  ainsi que de pouvoir bien contrôler  son revenu journalier. Ses recettes par jour sont passées de 10000frs à 350000frs.
Le prochain prêt lui permettra de mieux s’étendre sur le marche en renforcer son stock en allant acheter la marchandise à Kinshasa.
Femme entreprenante , elle contrôle ses recettes chaque jour en tenant son journal de caisse.
Elle est fière de pouvoir améliorer ses conditions de vies ainsi que de ses enfants en les scolarisant dans des bonnes conditions.
texts.en:
Justine N. is a businesswoman, married and 49 years old.  She has sold cooking utensils for 16 years.  She has a proven record of reimbursement since her first loan.  Her last loan allowed her to better manage her stock and allowed her to monitor her daily sales.  Her sales each day have increased from 10,000fr to 35,000fr.

The next loan will allow her to expand in the market and replenish her stock by going to purchase goods in Kinshasa.  As a woman entrepreneur, she controls her daily sales and manages her receipt books.  She is proud of her ability to improve the quality of her life and those of her children, by putting them through school comfortably.

loans.use: Purchasing cooking utensils, pots, cups, glasses, and table settings

loans.name: Magaly Virginia

texts.es: Magaly Virginia V. D. D. D. 33 años D. edad, resiD. en Colón, en el departamento D. La Libertad, en donD. vive junto a sus cuatro hijos todos menores D. edad, su esposo resiD. en Los Estados Unidos y le envía remesas, a pesar D. esto Magaly es una persona muy visionaria la cual desea salir adelante y así darles una vida mejor a sus hijos. Ella posee un pequeño bazar en su casa D. habitación, en el cual comercializa zapatos, bolsos, carteras, cosméticos, blusas, regalos y otros productos más, así mismo con el deseo D. poder obtener mayores ingresos, papeles para regalo y para usos escolares tales como: cartulina y hojas D. papel. D. esta manera ella trabaja  para lograr un mejor bienestar en su hogar. Magaly solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar sandalias, blusas y cosméticos, ya que son estos los que más venD. tanto en su hogar como fuera D. este, así mismo comprar productos que no posee con el fin D. poder brindar un mejor servio y aprovechar esta temporada D. fin D. año en el cual sus ventas se incrementan en gran manera.
texts.en:
Magaly Virginia V. D. D., 33, lives in Colón, La Libertad department, with her four minor children.   Her husband lives in the United States and sends monthly remittances.  Despite this, however, Magaly is a very visionary person who wants to get ahead in life and proviD. a better life for her children.  She has a small store in her home where she sells shoes, purses, wallets, cosmetics, blouses, gift items and other products.  In order to increase income, she also sells gift and school items like construction and writing paper.  This is how she works to obtain better wellbeing for her home.

Magaly is asking for a loan through which she can buy sandals, blouses and cosmetics because these are what sell best both from home and outsiD. it.  She also wants to buy products she currently does not have so that she can proviD. better customer service and take advantage of the end of year season when sales increase quite a bit.

loans.use: To buy assorted stock merchandise for the store.

loans.name: Ariel Freddy

texts.es: El señor Ariel es comerciante desde muy temprana edad el le ayudaba  a su mama en la venta de maletas y mochilas, ahora que ya es mayor de edad el se hizo cargo de todo el negocio ayudando de esta forma a los gastos de la casa le va muy bien y esta  prosperando la razón del crédito es para abastecerse para fin de año ya que en estas fechas la demanda de sus productos incrementa ya que también le seguirá el inicio a clases, y necesita abastecerse de sus productos, es un joven trabajador y muy responsable, esta muy agradecidos con la institucion por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Ariel is a merchant.  When he was very young he used to help his mother sell backpacks and luggage.  Now that he’s an adult he took over running the entire business helping to meet household expenses.  He does quite well and is prospering.

The reason for the loan is to stock up for the end of the year because during this season demand for his products increases.  In addition, the school year’s beginning follows and he needs to stock up on his products.  

He is a hard working, very responsible young man.  He thanks the institution for the support given.

loans.use: To buy backpacks and luggage in quantity.

loans.name: Sandra Yamile

texts.es:
Sandra de 39 años, vende Cd de películas, videos y da servicios de lavandería a sus vecinos. Vive en una zona periurbana en el Fortín de Guayaquil caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra.  

Comenzó con su negocio porque en el sector donde vive no había una tienda de CD y películas. Trabaja con sus hijos desde las 07h00am hasta las 20h00pm todos los días vendiendo Cd de películas y videos de música. Para tener más dinero ella ahora trabaja dando servicios de lavandería y así mantener estables a sus hijos en la economía ya que es madre soltera. Ella quiere continuar con su negocio para poder seguir manteniendo a sus hijos que están pequeños por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo Cd y una lavadora para incrementar sus servicios como lavandería.  

En el futuro quiere tener su casa de cemento porque ahora es de ladrillos y hacer mas grande su local de películas.
texts.en:
Sandra, 39, sells movie CDs, videos and provides laundry services to her neighbors.  She lives in a periurban zone, El Fortín de Guayaquil, noted for its unpaved streets.

She started the business because her neighborhood did not have a store that sold CDs and movies.  She works with her children from 7am until 8pm every day selling music and movie CDs.  To have more money she now also works providing laundry services in order to keep her children stable economically since she’s a single mother.

She wants to stay in business in order to continue to support her children who are still small so she wants to use the loan to buy CDs and a washing machine to increase her laundry services.

In the future she’d like to have a cement house because it’s currently made out of bricks and to enlarge her movie store.

loans.use: To buy CDs and a washing machine.

loans.name: Vilma Araceli

texts.es: Vilma Araceli R. D. C. D. 43 años D. edad, resiD. en San Vicente, en donD. vive junto a sus dos hijas, su esposo se encuentra en Los Estados Unidos, en donD. trabaja muy duro para enviar ayuda a su familia. Vilma posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos perecederos y D. primera necesidad para los hogares. Cuenta con la ventaja D. que la tienda esta ubicada en su casa D. habitación, y así mismo que es una D. las tiendas más conocidas en el lugar, por lo cual cuenta con muchos clientes fijos los cuales consumen a diario D. sus productos. Vilma solicita un préstamo, ya que cuenta con el enorme deseo D. poder surtir más su negocio, esto con el fin D. poder contar con todos los productos que sus clientes buscan, D. esta manera ella podrá satisfacer D. la mejor manera a las personas y así mismo ganar clientes nuevos, los cuales consuman a diario D. las ventas D. su tienda.
texts.en:
Vilma Araceli R. D. C., 43, lives in San Vicente with her two daughters.  Her husband is in the United States where he works very hard in order to send help for his family.

Vilma has a grocery store where she sells perishables and home use items.  She has the advantage of having the store located in her home and it is one of the better known ones in her location so she has quite a few regular customers who come by daily to consume her products.

Vilma is asking for a loan because she has an enormous desire to better stock her store in order to have all the products available that her customers request so that she can better meet their needs and secure new customers who will come by daily to buy from her.

loans.use: To buy perishables.

loans.name: Lydiah

texts.en: Lydiah is a married lady with three children.  For a living, she does dairy farming.  She started the business in 2005.  Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has improved her living standards because her business has grown.  Her desire is to be a successful dairy farmer with a good number of dairy cows.  She has requested 40,000 Kes to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary N.  lives in Ntinda the neighbourhood of Kampala city.   She is a single mother of four children  and only one of her children is in school.  She also takes care of additional family members ( 3 grand childrten ).  Mary has a business of  frying samosas and chapats.  She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week.    

Mary   sells her products in a shop, by means of retail.   Mary has requested for a loan of 400000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more jerry cans of cooking oil and baking flour.     She also generates additional income through renting rooms. 

The main business challenges for Mary include transportation and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling wholesale only and also start buying raw materials in bulk.   

Mary lives in a home that she owns.  She has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more baking flour and cooking oil

loans.name: Junita

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Junita T..  She is married and has 2 children, aged 11 and 4.  In 2007, she established  her vegetable farming business.  Working 7 days a week and 5 hours a day, she supports her family.  

She has already received and successfully repaid 4 loans from Patan BPW, and used her most recent loan to buys seeds and fertilizer for her farming.  In the future, Junita plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural.  Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land.  Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet.  With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market.  Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year. 

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates:  BPW Partner Page.    Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy corn to make tortillas and stock items for the store.

loans.name: Amélégan

texts.fr: Amélégan a 43 ans  et mère de 3 enfants. Elle est mariée et gère comme activité génératrice de revenus la vente de produits  d’alimentations générales pour contribuer au ménage. Elle cumule dans cette activité près de  20 ans. Elle est née à Vogan et vit à Bè Kpota mais exerce son activité à côté de la station akodessewa. Le crédit demandé permettra d’acheter 10 sacs de riz, 8 bidons d’huile et 5 cartons de liqueurs pour faire face à la demande sans cesse croissante.
texts.en: Amélégan is 43 years old and mother to three children. She is married and, in order to make a contribution to the household, has an income-generating activity selling general food products. She has been active in this business for nearly 20 years. She was born in Vogan and lives in Bè Kopta; she carries out her business next to the station in Akodessewa. The loan she has asked for will allow her to buy ten sacks of rice, eight containers of oil and five cartons of liqueurs, in order for her to satisfy her ever growing customer demand.

loans.use: Purchase of general food products

loans.name: Elsa Isolina

texts.es: Elsa Isolina P. G. de 44 años de edad, es una madre de familia responsable, la cual trabaja muy duro por sostener a sus dos hijos de 15 y 10 años de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar y junto a quienes reside en Colón, departamento de La Libertad. Elsa posee una venta de piñatas y accesorios para fiestas de cumpleaños, así mismo vende diferentes tipos de juguetes, su hija mayor en sus tiempos libres la apoya con las ventas al atender a sus clientes. Elsa solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para invertir en su negocio, comprando mayor cantidad de piñatas en diferentes figuras, y así mismo comprar más juguetes. De esta forma ella espera mejorar sus ganancias y poder contar con una vida mejor para sus hijos y ella.
texts.en:
Elsa Isolina P. G. is 44 years old. She is a responsible mother who works very hard to support her two children, ages 15 and 10.  The children attend school and they all live together in Colón in the department of La Libertad.  Elsa has a business selling piñatas and other birthday party goods.  She also sells different types of toys.  In her free time, her older daughter helps her with sales by waiting on customers.  

Elsa is requesting a loan so that she can have the money necessary to invest in her business.  She will buy a larger quantity of piñatas in different styles as well as more toys.  She hopes that this will improve her earnings and provide her and her children with a better life.

loans.use: To purchase piñatas and other party goods and toys

loans.name: Magdalena Del Carmen

texts.es: Magdalena del Carmen S. D. F. D. 39 años D. edad, resiD. en la ciudad D. San Juan Opico, en el departamento D. La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como motorista D. transporte público y junto a tres hijos D. 17, 10 y 7 años D. edad. Con el deseo D. poder brindarle ayuda a su esposo y así mismo aportar con todos los gastos del hogar, desD. hace 2 años y medio que Magdalena inició su propio negocio el cual es una tienda D. productos perecederos, la cual esta ubicada en su casa D. habitación. Magdalena atienD. el negocio D. lunes a domingo, su faena inicia cada día a las 6 D. la mañana y termina a las 10 D. la noche, a pesar que su trabajo es pesado ya que debe atender clientes a lo largo del día, le permite poder cuidar a su pequeño hijo. Es por esto que ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda invertir comprando mayor cantidad D. productos D. primera necesidad y D. esta manera mejorar sus ventas, contando con el enorme beneficio D. estar al cuidado D. sus hijos.
texts.en:
Magdalena del Carmen S. D. F., 39, lives in the city of San Juan Opico, La Libertad department, with her husband, who is a public transportation driver, and their three children, who are 17, 10 and 7 years old.

Hoping to help her husband by contributing to household expenses she started her own grocery store two and a half years ago in her home.  Magdalena is open for business from Monday through Sunday from 6am until 10pm.  Despite her work being hard, having to attend to customers throughout the day, it allows her to care for her small son.

She is asking for a loan through which she can buy larger amounts of basic needs items to improve sales while having the enormous benefit of being able to be watchful of her children.

loans.use: To buy perishables to sell.

location.town: San Juan Opico, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Felix

texts.es: Félix, de 54 años,  está casado con Demetria, de 56 años. Ambos tienen 4 hijos; todos ellos mayores de edad. Pero como buenos padres siempre los visitan, ya que viven solo en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad nativa de Centro Huachirick. El trabajo que desempeña, es la agricultura. Sus plantaciones de café, achiote, palta y plátano, son frutos que tiene mucha demanda dentro de su localidad, ya que su experiencia durante estos 25 años demuestran su superioridad en las técnicas de cultivo y eso se ve en la calidad de estos frutos. En estos últimos años Félix, se siente alegre por los éxitos obtenidos, es por ello que en cada cosecha, tiene buen juicio para poder vender sus productos a buen precio; sin embargo lo que desea Félix es ahorrar mayor cantidad de dinero y comprarse una casa en la ciudad, de esa manera darle una mejor calidad de vida a su esposa, y ayudarle a tener su propio negocio, para ello instalará una tienda de venta de comestibles. Es el tercer crédito con MFP y, se muestra satisfecho por el apoyo que le brindan en su banco comunal; donde cada día siente mayor apreció. Con el crédito que solicita, podrá comprar 10 sacos de abono orgánico, para sus plantaciones de café, que dará fruto en el mes de mayo y, si el dinero le alcanza, invertirá en el cultivo de 7 hectáreas de achiote.
texts.en:
Félix, 54, is married to Demetria, 56.  They have four adult children.  Like all good parents, however, they visit often.  They live alone in their own house located in the indigenous community of Centro Huachirik.

He is a coffee, achiote (small tropical shrub), avocado and banana farmer, all fruits that are in high demand in his locality.  His 25 years of experience have paid off in his superior techniques and high quality of products.

The last few years Félix has felt very cheerful thanks to the successes he’s had.  This is why he figures out at each harvest the way to get the very best sales prices for his products.  However, what Félix wants most is to save money to buy a house in the city so that he can provide his wife with better quality of life and help her have her own business; to do that, he plans to open a grocery store.

This is his third loan with MFP and he is satisfied with the support his communal bank provides where every day he feels more esteem.

He will use the requested funds to buy 10 sacks of organic manure for his coffee plants which will bear fruit in May.  If the money goes far enough, he will also invest in planting 7 hectares of achiote.

loans.use: To buy 10 sacks of manure.

loans.name: Kayi Mawuto

texts.fr: Kayi  a 44 ans.  Elle est revendeuse de produits  d’alimentations générales. Elle est née à Aného  et habite quartier Ahligo où elle a le siège de son Ets principal.  Elle s’approvisionne habituellement  au grand marché de Lomé.  Elle sollicite un prêt  au près de WAGES pour acheter 5 sacs de riz, 10 bidons d’huiles et 10 cartons de vins pour satisfaire plus de clients.
texts.en: Kayi is 44 years old. She sells general food products. She is born in Aného and lives in the Ahligo district, where her main business is also located. She usually stocks up at the big market of Lomé. She is seeking a loan from WAGES in order to purchase five bags of rice, 10 jugs of oil and ten boxes of wine in order to be able to serve more customers.

loans.use: Purchasing groceries

loans.name: Marvin Oswaldo

texts.es: Marvin Oswaldo C. G. de 26 años de edad, reside en ciudad de San Juan Opico, departamento de La Libertad. Él vive junto a su esposa y su madre, quienes le ayudan a atender el negocio y así mismo junto a su pequeño hijo. Marvin es un joven muy emprendedor, quien posee su propio negocio el cual es una tienda en la que comercializa productos perecederos y de primera necesidad, su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitación. Marvin solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda Comprar mayor cantidad de productos como: golosinas, desinfectantes, detergentes, y todos los productos que más son solicitados por sus clientes, pero sobretodo comprar mayor cantidad de bebidas y pan para comercializa en la temporada navideña. El mayor deseo de Marvin es el de poder mejorar sus ventas, ya que son estas las que le permiten sostener a su familia.
texts.en:
Marvin Oswaldo C. G. is 26 years old and lives in the city of San Juan Opico in the department of La Libertad.  He lives with his wife and mother, who help him with the business, as well as his young son.  Marvin is a very enterprising young man who owns his own store that sells perishable products and basic necessities.  His business is located in his home.  

Marvin is requesting a loan with which he will buy a larger quantity of products such as: candy, disinfectants, detergents and all the products that his customers request most often.  Above all he will buy a larger quantity of drinks and bread to sell during the Christmas season.  Marvin's greatest desire is to be able to improve his sales since this is how he supports his family.

loans.use: To purchase food and domestic use products

location.town: San Juan Opico, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Williams

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal  “LOS LIDERES ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Williams; El socio tiene 32 años de edad, el es casado y tiene 2 hijos, el socio se dedica  ala compra y venta de autos, el ahorra su dinerito y luego aumenta lo que le falta y compra un carro para luego venderlo, de las ganancias de la venta del carro el viajar y trae otro auto y lo vende, ahora en particular el socio está solicitando el auto para poder llenar el tanque de combustible y traer de retorno un nuevo auto.  El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar combustible y traer un nuevo auto.

El socio  agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su cuota en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
32-year Sr. William is a member of the ‘Leaders’ Community Bank located in Huanchac district, in the province and department of Cusco. He is married and has two children. His job is buying and selling cars. He has some money set aside, but he needs to have more to buy a car and then sell it. With the profit from the sale of the car, he will travel to find another one and then sell it. He is now seeking a loan so that he can buy a tank of gas, and then bring back a new car.

William is grateful for the opportunity to obtain a loan and promises to pay back the money according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy gas for his car-buying and selling business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sandals for her stall

loans.name: Marceline

texts.fr:
Elle vend des tissus au marché depuis 20ans et s’approvisionne auprès des grossistes de la place. Le premier prêt lui à été bénéfique surtout sur la manière de gérer son activité et sur la gestion de stock.l'impact a ete considérable sur ses remboursements, et ses épargnes.  
Ses revenus ont varié de 20000frs à  40000frs par jours.
Avec le prochain prêt elle compte créer des nouvelles activités ainsi que  renforcer son activité en s’approvisionnant à Kinshasa  et à Cotonou afin de générer et  de bien satisfaire ses clients en leurs offrants des produits de marque.
Femme courageuse, elle a  améliorer la qualitativement les conditions de vies de sa famille.
texts.en:
This lady has been selling fabrics at the market for the past 20 years. She gets her stocks from local wholesalers. The first loan she received was especially beneficial with respect to the way she ran her business and the inventory management. She saw a significant impact on her repayments and her savings. Her income ranged from 20,000 to 40,000 francs per day.

With the next loan, she plans to create new activities and strengthen her business by buying merchandise in Kinshasa and in Cotonou to attract and satisfy customers by offering brand name products.

A courageous woman, she strives to improve the quality of her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To buy silk fabrics, poplin for school uniforms, satin, gabardine, super 100, etc.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SUMAC PURIRISUN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio es el Sr. Jaime; el tiene 22 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; el socio tiene un negocio de compra y venta de carne el compra a menor precio para luego revenderlo y distribuirlo a la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado, a la vez el socio es obrero de construcción pero por ahora esta mas dedicado al negocio de la carne.

El socio solicita el préstamo para la compra de más carne para su pequeño negocio.   

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Jaime belongs to the “Sumac Puririsun” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Jaime is 22 years old and lives with his partner.  He has one child.  Jaime has a business buying and selling meat.  He buys it at a lower price to later re-sell it and distribute it in the city of Puerto Maldonado.  He also works as a construction worker but right now is more engaged in his meat business.

He is requesting this loan to buy more meat for his small business.

He is grateful to those who are taking part in his dream by funding his loan and he pledges to make his repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy more meat for his small business

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly Lusuuda is a 35 year old married lady.  She is blessed with three children who are in school.  She sells livestock to earn a living.  Her business is just one year old and she has managed to employ four people.  In addition, she sells clothes for extra income.

Nelly dreams of owning a ranch in the future.  Being a member of Diamond Women group in Faulu Kenya, she has been guaranteed a loan of 34,200 Kenyan shillings by the group members.

loans.use: To buy more sheep and goats

loans.name: Fernando Anselmo

texts.es: Fernando Anselmo M. de 55 años de edad, es un hombre muy responsable, el cual vive junto a su esposa la cual se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y así también vive junto a su hijo de 16 años de edad con quienes reside en el departamento de Santa Ana. Él es un señor muy emprendedor, quien posee su propio negocio el cual es una tienda en la cual comercializa productos perecederos y de primera necesidad, su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitación y es el que le permite contar con todo lo necesario para vivir de una forma estable junto a su familia. Fernando solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de productos como: bebidas, pan, golosinas, desinfectantes, detergentes, pan, cereales y todos los productos que más son solicitados por sus clientes. El mayor deseo de Fernando es el de poder mejorar sus ventas, ya que son estas las que le permiten sostener a su hogar.
texts.en:
Fernando Anselmo M. is 55 years old.  He is a very responsible man who lives with his wife, who is a housewife, and his 16 year-old son in Santa Ana department.  He is a very enterprising gentleman who owns his own business which is a store where he sells groceries and basic household products.  His business is located in his home and it enables him to have everything he needs to live in a stable situation with his family.

Fernando is requesting a loan to buy more products such as: drinks, bread, candies, disinfectants, detergents, bread, cereals and all the products that are most requested by his customers.  Fernando's biggest wish is to be able to improve his sales since they are what allow him to support his household.

loans.use: To buy basic household products

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS LIDERES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Luz Marina; tiene 39 años de edad, y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de artesanía y también trabaja en el sector educación en la parte administrativa y la artesanía lo vende en forma independiente, la socia quiere mejorar el negocio de artesanía. La  socia solicita el préstamo para comprar artesanía como chompas, mantas, chalinas y pantalones.


La socia agradece el préstamo solicitado  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This group member belongs to the "Los Lideres" (Leaders) Community Bank. The bank is located in the Cuzco district in the province of Cuzco.

Mrs. Luz Marina is 39 years old, married, and has two children. She alternates her daily work between working in handicrafts and in education administration. She sells her handicrafts independently and wants to improve this business. She is asking for a loan to buy handicrafts such as sweaters, blankets, shawls and pants.

She is thankful for the loan and promises to repay it on time.

loans.use: To buy sweaters, blankets, shawls, and pants.

loans.name: Aristides Vicente

texts.es:
Aristides de 23 años, tiene un negocio mixto que incluye centro de llamadas y cyber. Vive en una zona caracterizada como urbana porque la mayoría de sus habitantes son comerciantes llamada Suburbio de Guayaquil.  

Hace un años atrás el tuvo que vender su carro para tener su propio centro de llamadas y poder comprar algunas computadoras para ubicar un pequeño Cyber. Por esa buena decisión ahora tiene un negocio mixto con servicios de llamadas e internet. El trabaja todos los días con ayuda de su tía. Las llamadas las cobrar a un mínimo de $ 0.05 el minuto, y el internet la hora $ 0.60.  

Con el préstamo quiere comprar computadoras para su negocio y darle más comodidad a sus clientes al pedir los servicios de internet. En el futuro quiere comprar mas computadoras para hacer mas grande su negocio.
texts.en:
Aristides is 23 years old.  He has a mixed business which includes a public telephone business and an Internet café.  He lives in a district which is characterized as urban because the majority of its inhabitants are small merchants.  It is the suburb of Guayaquil.

A year ago he had to sell his car to obtain his own public telephone business and be able to buy some computers to set up a small Internet café.  Because of that good decision he now has a mixed business which provides customers with telephone calls and Internet access.  He works every day with the help of his aunt.  The calls cost a minimum of $0.05 a minute and the Internet access costs $0.60 an hour.

He would like to use this loan to buy computers for his business and to make it more comfortable for his customers who are requesting Internet access.  In the future, he would like to buy more computers to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy computers

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: Kossiwa est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle a 28 ans et est née à Vogan mais habite à Agoè.  Elle  a remboursé plusieurs crédits  déjà. Elle compte 7 ans dans cette activité et exerce son activité à Assigamé. Pour contribuer au ménage, elle fait la vente de tissus skaï. Elle s’approvisionne au Ghana à Accra et au Nigéria à Lagos pour pouvoir se procurer de ses marchandises.   Elle demande un prêt pour accroître son commerce.
texts.en: Kossiwa is married and the mother of two children. Born in Vogan, she is 28 years old and now lives in Agoè.  She has already repaid several loans. Kossiwa works in Assigamé and has been involved in this business for 7 years. To contribute to household expenses, she sells skaï fabric, traveling to Accra in Ghana and Lagos in Nigeria for her supplies. She is requesting a loan in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy skaï fabric

loans.name: Las Trabajadoras Group

texts.es: La Presidenta es la Sra.  Shirley, vive en una casa en anticrético tiene una tienda D. barrio en la final calle Bolívar  por la zona del Cementerio,  es una persona con mucha iniciativa y buena líder del grupo por su responsabilidad fue elegida como presidenta del Banco D. Emprendimiento, tiene dos hijos pequeños, y el dinero solicitado es para la compra D. juguetes al por mayor ya que estas épocas D. fin D. año ella tiene mucha venta y quiere surtir su Tienda D. barrio con juguetes para la venta.  la secretaria es la  Sra. Lourdes vive en la casa D. sus padres tiene 3 hijos  ella es padre y madre para sus hijos es muy trabajadora se dedica a la venta D. flores al frente del cementerio todos los días, el dinero solicitado e spara la compra D. una heladera para su domicilio, es un grupo  D. 8 personas  viven en sacaba hace muchos años cada una D. ellos tienen negocios independientes, son muy organizados  y responsables, se conocen bastante bien entre ellos .
texts.en:
Mrs. Shirley is this group's president. She lives in a house in Anticrético and has a neighborhood store on Bolívar Street near the cemetery. She is a person with a lot of initiative and a good leader for her group. Because of her responsibility, she was elected as the president of the Bank of Enterprises. She has two young children. The loan is to buy toys in bulk as the end of the year approaches and she has a lot of sales. She wishes to stock her store with toys for sale.

Mrs. Lourdes is the group's secretary. She lives in her parents' home. She has three children and is both father and mother to them. She is very hard-working and sells flowers outsiD. of the cemetery every day. She is asking for a loan to buy a freezer for her home.

This is a group of eight people who live in Sacaba. Many years ago they all started working independently. They are very organized and responsible and know each other well.

loans.use: To buy toys for the Christmas season

loans.name: Rosas De Tilata Group

texts.es:
La B.C. “Rosas de Tilata” inicia su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, es un grupo nuevo que se ha unido para recibir los servicios de crédito, capacitación y atención en salud.    La banca comunal está compuesta por nueve integrantes.  Los negocios que desempeñan son:  venta de verduras, tienda de barrio, venta de chompas tejidas, trenzado de mantas venta de papa, venta de comida, bordados, comida y tejidos.
La presidenta de la banca comunal, la señora Claudina,  está casada, es madre de 4 hijos.  La señora Claudina tiene como negocio la venta de café en la parada de un minibús del barrio donde vive, ella cuenta que cuando llegó hace 15 años a la zona, no se contaba con este servicio, por lo que le pareció un buen negocio.  A través de los años ella se dio cuenta que necesitaba un ingreso más, por lo que se decidió a  vender verduras en el mercado de la zona, los días martes y viernes. Su primer préstamo es por Bs.2000 con el objetivo de realizar una compra por mayor de insumos para el puesto de café y de verduras.
Cuando se le consultó que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella comenta que le gusta  capacitación y salud.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Rosas de Tilata," started their first loan cycle in the Cascada central office of Pro Mujer.  This is a new group that has gotten together to receive credit services, training and health care.  This communal bank has 9 members.  Their businesses are: fruit sales, neighborhood store, knitted sweater sales, weaving rugs, potato sales, food sales, embroidery, food production, and knitting.  The president of the communal bank, Claudina, is married and is the mother of 4 children.  Claudina has a business selling coffee at a mini-bus stop in the neighborhood where she lives.  She tells us that she arrived in this area 15 years ago, and as no one was providing this service she thought it would make for a good business.  Over the years she realized that she needed a better income, and so she decided to sell vegetables in the market in the area on Tuesdays and Fridays.  Her first loan was for 2,000 bolivianos, which she used to buy supplies at wholesale for her stall where she sells coffee and vegetables.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answered that she likes the training and health services.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as sugar and coffee

loans.name: Amadu

texts.en:
This is 49 year old Amadu. He is married and has 8 children ages 5, 8, 10, 12, 14, 16, 18 and 22 years. He has 8 additional dependents living with him who help him with his business.
In 1990, Amadu established his fish business as a way of improving his standard of living. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about 1,200,000 SLL every month. He needs a loan of 3,000,000 SLL in order to buy additional stock for his business. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 800,000 SLL.
In the future, Amadu plans to be a wholeseller and becomes a supplier to other traders. He also hopes to educate his children to university level. Amadu is serious and determined.He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more baskets of dry fish

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal  “LOS LIDERES ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Julio; El socio tiene 34 años de edad, el es casado y tiene 2 hijos, el socio se dedica  a la compra y venta de autopartes, el socio  trabaja vendiendo todo tipo de autopartes y accesorios para autos, el socio vende desde ropa para autos, pisos de autos, farros, copas de autos y mucho más. El socio tiene su tienda de venta de autopartes ubicado en la calle prolongación los ingenieros y el trabaja junto a su esposa. El socio requiere el préstamo para invertir en la compra de accesorios para autos, el viajara a Lima este mes. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar accesorios de autos. 

El socio  agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su cuota en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the "Los Lideres" ["The Leaders"] communal bank. This bank is located in the Huanchac district, in the department of Cusco.

The member is Mr. Julio. He is 34 years old and married, with 2 children. He works in purchasing and selling auto parts. He sells all types of auto parts and auto accessories, including car covers, car mats, headlights, hubcaps, and more.  His auto parts store is located on "prolongacion de Ingenieros" street, and he works with his wife. He needs a loan to invest in the purchase of auto parts and accessories. He will be traveling to Lima this month. 

The member appreciates and values the loans received through this service, and agrees to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: The member is requesting a loan to purchase auto parts and accessories.

loans.name: Yuri

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SUMAC PURIRISUN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio es el Sr. Yuri; el tiene 28 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; el socio se dedica  al negocio de restaurante conjuntamente con su esposa, el horario de trabajo es por las tardes, con este negocio el saca a su familia adelante.

El socio solicita el préstamo para la compra de productos para su negocio como son arroz, azúcar, verduras, menestras entre otros.   

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Sumac Puririsun communal bank. The bank is located in Cusco. 

The member is Mr. Yuri. He is 28 years old and lives with his partner and has a son. He works in the restaurant business with his wife. He works during the evenings, and with this business, he and his family are getting ahead. 

He is requesting a loan to purchase products for his restaurant, including rice, sugar, vegetables and soups, among others. 

He appreciates those that form a part of this dream, through this service, and agrees to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: The member is requesting a loan to purchase products for his business, such as rice, sugar, vegetables, and soups, among others.

loans.name: Delia Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS LIDERES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Delia Elizabeth; tiene 28 años de edad, y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de artesanía, ella vende en forma ambulatoria y también trabaja en una empresa privada de marketing, la artesanía vende en las ferias que se realiza en la ciudad del Cusco, la socia quiere tener una tienda de venta de artesanías. La  socia solicita el préstamo para comprar artesanía al por mayor.

La socia agradece el préstamo solicitado  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the "Los Lideres" ["The Leaders"] communal bank, located in Cusco.

The member is Mrs. Delia Elizabeth. She is 28 years old and is single. She alternates her regular daily activities with the sale of handicrafts. She is a street vendor, and also works at a private marketing business. She sells her handicrafts at the markets held in the city of Cusco. She would like to have a store to sell handicrafts. She is requesting a loan to purchase handicrafts wholesale. 

She appreciates the loan she is requesting, and agrees to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: The member is requesting a loan to purchase wholesale handicrafts

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
This is 55 year old Joseph. He is married and has 7 children ages 4, 6, 10, 12, 15, 18, and 22. In 2002, Joseph established his timber business in order to improve his livelihood. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about 1,500,000 SLL every month from this business.
