He would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL in order to buy additional stock for his business. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 1,200,000 SLL.

In the future, Joseph plans to sell wholesale and supply to other traders, hire workers to help in trading, and educate his children to a university level. He is serious and determined and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more timber

loans.name: Naftarly

texts.en:
Naftarly is 38 years old, married and the father of four.  He has been engaged in the business of quarrying for eight years.  This business has helped him to educate his four children.

He is a hardworking man who dreams of starting another business, which is selling bananas.  As a result, he has requested 30,000 KES to buy bananas.

loans.use: To buy bananas

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS LIDERES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Elena; tiene 36 años de edad, y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de enseñanza a niños del nivel inicial, ella es profesora y por medio de este trabajo saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere tener una tienda de abarrotes. La  socia solicita el préstamo para pagar la fiesta y el viaje de promoción de su hija.

La socia agradece el préstamo solicitado  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: This is Señora Elena.  She is 36 years old and a member of the communal bank "Los Lideres" (The Leaders) located in the district of Cusco, in the province and department of Cusco.  She lives with her partner and has 2 children.  She is a pre-school teacher and with this job she is able to provide for her children.  She would like to open a grocery store.  She is requesting a loan to pay for her daughter's graduation trip and party.  She is grateful for the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: To pay for her daughter's graduation trip and party

loans.name: Yadira Jamileth

texts.es:
Yadira Jamileth de 41 años de edad es soltera, tiene 2 hijos, el mayor de 18 años estudiando la universidad y el menor de 10 añitos en 4to grado de primaria. Yadira labora para la Alcaldia de Juigalpa como inspector ambiental desde hace 2 años. 

Esta solicitando  su 1er credito con el objetivo de mejorar su casa construyendo unas gradas en la parte trasera de la casa en là salida de la cocina y ademas desea pintar el frente de la casa para que ahora en navidad se le mire bonita.  

Su mayor sueño es que sus hijos estudien y sean personas de bien.
texts.en:
Yadira Jamileth is 41 years old and single. She has 2 children; the older one, age 18, is studying at the university, and the younger, only 10 years old, is in 4th grade at primary school. Yadira has worked for the Municipality of Juigalpa as an environmental inspector for 2 years.  

She is requesting her first loan with the aim of improving her home, by constructing some steps at the back of her home at the kitchen door, and she would also like to paint the front of her house, so that it will look nice for Christmas. 

Her greatest dream is that her children will receive a university education and become successful people.

loans.use: Building steps and painting her home

loans.name: Leslie Hindira

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SUMAC PURIRISUN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Leslie; ella tiene 30 años de edad, conviviente  y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de refrigerio en El Paraíso(es un lugar comercial donde venden todo tipo de celulares , ropa , productos para la casa , ollas entre otras cosas mas ) , la socia tiene un puesto en este establecimiento siendo su horario por las tardes ella vende café , mates , leche ,hamburguesas , tortas .

la socia solicita el préstamo para comprar más insumos para su negocio como azúcar , leche , café entre otros.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the community bank “Sumac Puririsun”.  The bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province and department of Cusco.

The member is Mrs. Leslie, she is 30 years old. lives with a partner and has 2 children.  She splits her time between her daily activities and a business of selling refreshments at El Paraiso ( a commercial center where cell phones, clothing, household goods, pots and pans and other items are sold).  She has a stand at this center. Her hours are in the afternoons and she sells coffee, mate, milk, hamburgers and cakes.

The member is requesting a loan to buy more supplies for her business, such as sugar, milk, coffee and others.
She thanks all that participate in making her dream come true and promises to comply with the loan installments in the established time.

loans.use: The associate is requesting a loan to buy supplies for her business, such as sugar, milk, and coffee among others.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is a 28 year old married man.  He is blessed with two children ages 8 and 6.  He runs a cosmetics shop and a barber shop.  He has managed to employ one person in the business.

In addition, he runs a video show (small theatre showing DVDs or television programs).  He says that through Faulu Kenya, he has been able to boost his business and save his money.  He hopes to continue growing his business through Faulu Kenya.

He has requested a loan of 60,000 KES to buy electronic items for his video show.

loans.use: To buy electronic items

loans.name: Farrah

texts.en:
This is 38-year-old Farrah. In 1988, Farrah established his carpentry items business, making and selling chairs, beds, and cupboards. He began his business because he wanted to generate income and establish a savings account for retirement. Working seven days a week and eleven hours a day, he earns about $150 every month from his business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL in order to buy more lumber. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately $300. In the future, Farrah plans to produce more quality products as the demand for his products is very high. He also hopes to buy more working tools, as he wants to train some younger workers. He is serious and determined and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more lumber

loans.name: Lisbeth Carina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS LIDERES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Lisbeth Carina; tiene 22 años de edad, y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de enseñanza a niños del nivel primario, ella es profesora, la socia quiere seguir estudiando y mejorar la enseñanza que tiene a los niños, la socia quiere abrir una tienda de abarrotes. La  socia solicita el préstamo para la mantención de su casa.

 La socia agradece el préstamo solicitado  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: This is Señora Lisbeth Carina.  She is 22 years old, single and a member of the communal bank "Los Lideres" (The Leaders).  It is located in the district of Cusco, in the province and department of Cusco.  She works as a elementary school teacher.  She wants to continue studying and improving education for children.  She would like to open a grocery store.  She is requesting a loan to for home maintenance purposes.  She is grateful for the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: For home maintenance

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more bags of onion, salt, and sugar and cartons of maggi

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is married and has a 10-year-old son. She runs a retail business selling cosmetics and perfumes. Her business is located in a department store where she rents space. She has been in this business for ten years. 

She is an honest, disciplined and entrepreneurial person. Her good location and many repeat customers help her to succeed in this business. 

Irina would like to borrow 8,000 UAH to increase the assortment of her inventory. She hopes to receive additional income and develop her business further.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventories

loans.name: Fanny Yolanda

texts.es:
Fanny de 62 años, confecciona y cose ropa en su casa. Vive en una zona caracterizada como urbana porque la mayoría de sus habitantes son comerciantes llamada Suburbio de Guayaquil.  

Desde pequeña ella aprendió a coser porque su mama le enseño para que tenga una oportunidad de trabajar independientemente. Hace 30 años atrás ella inicio cosiendo y confecciona ropa a sus vecinos y amigos poco a poco pudo comprar su propia máquina de coser y tener ya un numero definido de clientes. En la actualidad tienen su taller de costura y confección en su casa, trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 17h00pm de lunes a viernes haciendo ropa por pedido y enmendándola para entregarlo el fin de semana. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar una máquina de coser, telas, hilos porque la que tiene ya esta vieja. En el futuro quiere que su negocio siga para poder tener dinero y asegurar su vejez.
texts.en:
Fanny is 62 years old.  She makes and sews clothes at home.  She lives in a district which is characterized by the fact that most of its inhabitants are small merchants.  It is called Guayaquil suburb.

Fanny learned to sew as a young girl because her mom taught her so that she would have an opportunity to work independently.  30 years ago she began sewing and making clothes for her neighbors and friends.  Little by little she was able to buy her own sewing machine and attract a clearly-defined number of customers.  She currently has her sewing and dressmaking workshop in her home and works from 8.00am to 5.00pm Monday to Friday making clothes to order and fixing them so that she can deliver them on the weekends.

She would like to use her loan to buy a sewing machine, fabric and threads because the machine she has now is already old.  In the future she would like her business to continue so that she can make money and guarantee her old age.

loans.use: To buy fabrics, threads and a sewing machine

loans.name: Edwin Oscar

texts.es: El Señor Edwin se dedica a la elaboración de pan, es el hermano mayor de la familia por eso el trabaja arduamente en su panadería para generar ingresos y ayudar a su Madre  también estudia arquitectura actualmente cursa el tercer año, su trabajo y sus estudios son su prioridad es muy responsable para con su familia ya que el vela por sus hermanos y su Mama, un joven muy responsable y trabajador.  El se costea sus estudios, el dinero del crédito es para la compra de harina y azúcar por cantidad, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Edwin works making bread.  He is the eldest brother in his family and for that reason he works hard in his bakery to make money and help his mother.  He also studies architecture.  He is currently in his third year.  His work and his studies are his priority.  He is very responsible as far as his family is concerned since he looks after his siblings and his mom.  He is a very responsible and hard-working young man.  He is paying for his studies himself.  The money from this loan will be used to buy flour and sugar in quantity.  He is very grateful to our institution for the support we provide.

loans.use: To buy flour and sugar in quantity

loans.name: Las Tres Madres Group

texts.es:
El grupo las tres Madres lo conforman tres mujeres y madres trabajadoras y esforzadas una de ellas es la señora Jesica C. quien comercializa cosméticos (labiales, marbellí, delineador, bases, cremas, tratamientos) y ropa  (camisas, blusas, jeans, pantalones) en lo cual invertirán el crédito con la compra de mercadería. Ella inicio con unos cuantos productos el cual por medio de los préstamos y sus clientes fue creciendo. 
Las otras integrantes del grupo Adriana del Rosario Pavón quien vende verduras como ayote, chayote, chilote, yuca, ambulante en Nindiri y  Nora del Carmen F. tiene una pulperia.
texts.en:
The group Las Tres Madres( the three mothers) is made up of three women,all hard working mothers.  One of them is Mrs. Jesica C. who sells cosmetics (lipsticks, eye liners, foundation, creams, treatments) and clothing (shirts, blouses, jeans, pants).  She will invest the loan in her business by buying merchandise.  She started this business with some products and it has grown due to her customers and with the help of the loans. 
The other members of the group:  Adriana del Rosario Pavón sells vegetables, such as ayote , chayote (both a form of squash), yucca, as a street vendor in Nindiri and Nora del Carmen F. has a general store.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise.

loans.name: David's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is pleased to present to you teachers of the Islamic Da-Wah School, in Waterloo small town, where “Shine on Sierra Leone” partnered with SMT to start a branch. This school was founded in 2004 by Alpha Kamara to improve education in the community. The school is staffed with 7 teachers and 200 pupils.    

These hard working and dedicated teachers have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to seek a loan of SLL 5,300,000. With the help of this loan, these teachers can embark on some meaningful projects that they cannot do with their mere salaries alone. Some of them will use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, others to buy house-building materials or a piece of land, to pay school fees for their children, or to invest the loan in a business. 

David B. is the leader of this group of teachers. Born in Waterloo, David is married to a businesswoman and the couple has six children, three of whom are attending primary and secondary schools respectively.  Mr. B., who has been in the teaching profession for 11 years, is requesting this loan in order to buy house-building materials. He began constructing a house for his family but ran short of building materials to complete the building project. With the help of this loan, he will be able to buy the remaining materials needed to finish the construction. 

(Attached to this photo is a snapshot of a borrower who was not able to be present for the group photo).

loans.use: To buy materials to finish building his house

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
This is 60-year-old Hawa. She is married and has six children, ages 10, 15, 16, 20, 23 and 26. She also has two grandchildren living with her whom she helps rear.

In 1980, Hawa established her textile and shoe business. She began her business because she wanted to buy land and educate her children. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, she earns about $350 every month. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL. Hawa has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy lace, cotton, assorted uniform material and shoes. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately $200.

In the future, Hawa plans to educate her children and build a house with her husband.  She plans to travel to a neighboring country, Guinea, and sell on a wholesale basis to other traders. Hawa thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more fabrics for resale

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: Víctor, de 59 años, es un hombre sabio y maduro. Hace 10 años que falleció su esposa y desde entonces vive con su hijo Moisés de 40 años, quien cuida de él y le ayuda a salir adelante, en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad nativa Centro Huachirick (selva central peruana). Como buen hombre de campo, Víctor no descansa y, todas las mañanas como hace 30 años, se dirige a sus plantaciones de café, achiote, cacao y plátanos, los que cuida con mucho esmero pues todo este tiempo de sacrificios y esfuerzos le enseñaron que “cuando el alma de un hombre se siente dominado lo mejor es ¡trabajar! “.  Por eso  en todo este tiempo logró obtener 28 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas, que son el producto de su esfuerzo. En está etapa de su vida se siente satisfecho, ya que pudo sacar adelante a sus 9 hijos, los que ahora están en diferentes partes del país y asegura que no quiere nada más, solo espera seguir teniendo fuerzas para poder sembrar, ya que “eso es el motor de su vida”. Víctor, es el más alegre y entusiasta de su banco comunal y por ello incentiva a los integrantes a ser puntuales y responsables con MFP. Es el tercer crédito que tiene y se siente satisfecho por el éxito logrado. Con el crédito que solicita, podrá obtener más plantas para su vivero de café, con ello podrá renovar muy pronto sus sembríos y si el dinero le alcanza podrá pagar a los peones para que le ayuden en la siembra.
texts.en:
Víctor is 59 years old.  He is a wise and mature man.  Víctor's wife died 10 years ago and since then he has been living with his 40 year-old son Moisés who looks after him and supports him in his own home which is located in the native community of Centro Huachirick (in the central Peruvian jungle).  As a good country man, Víctor never rests and every morning, as he has done for 30 years, he heads out to his coffee, annattoo, cacao and banana plantations which he tends with great care since all this time of sacrifices and effort has taught him that “when a man's soul feels dominated, the best thing to do is work!”  For this reason, over time he has managed to obtain 28 hectares of farming land which are the product of his efforts.

At this stage of his life, Víctor feels satisfied since he has managed to get his 9 children ahead in life.  Now his children are in different parts of the country and he assures us that he doesn't want anything else.  He only wants to continue having the strength to be able to sow his crops since “this is the engine of my life”.  Víctor is the happiest and most enthusiastic member of his community bank and, for this reason, he encourages the other members to be punctual and responsible with MFP.

This is Víctor's third loan and he feels satisfied with the success he has achieved.  He will use this loan to obtain more plants for his coffee nursery.  This will enable him to renew the crops in his fields very soon and, if the money reaches that far, he will be able to pay laborers to help him sow his crops

loans.use: To buy coffee plants and pay laborers to help him sow his crops

loans.name: Hector Francisco

texts.es:
Hector de 52 años de edad es soltero, tiene 2 hijos, el mayor casado y el menor estudiando la universidad. labora para el Hospital Asuncion desde hace 31 años como tecnico en refrigeracion. 

Esta solicitando  su 7mo credito con el objetivo de construir los servicios higienicos de su casa ya que estan en mal estado. 

Su mayor deseo es poder tener su casa con las condiciones necesarias y que a su familia no le falte nada.
texts.en:
Hector is 52-years-old, single and has 2 children.  The older child is married, and the younger is studying in college.  He has worked at the Hospital Asuncion for 31 years as a engineer in refrigeration.  

He is requesting this loan with the goal of building hygienic toilets in the home because they are in poor condition.  

His greatest wish is to have his home with the necessary conditions so that he family does not lack anything.

loans.use: Construccion de servicios higienicos

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS LIDERES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Sonia; tiene 34 años de edad, y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa interior, ella vende medias, truzas y polos y luego los distribuye a las diferentes tiendas de venta de ropa, la socia también trabaja como ayudante de cocina en un restaurant turístico, la socia quiere aumentar el negocio de venta de ropa. La  socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería de ropa.

 La socia agradece el préstamo solicitado  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The partner belongs to the communal bank "Los Líderes" ["The Leader"]. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

The partner is Mrs. Sonia. She is 34 years old, lives with her significant other and has three children. She alternates her daily activities. With the business of selling underwear, she sells stockings, under garments, and polo shirts. Then she distributes them to the different clothing stores. The partner also works as an assistant chef in a tourist restaurant. She wants to grow the clothing sales business. She asks for the loan to buy clothing merchandise.

The partner is thankful for the requested loan and promises to follow through with the payments of her dues in the established installments.

loans.use: The partner asks for the loan to buy clothing merchandise.

loans.name: Etelvina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SUMAC PURIRISUN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Etelvina; ella tiene 34 años de edad, conviviente  y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de restaurante, ella sola lo administra ya que su esposo se dedica a la construcción de obras (maestro obrero) la socia es una señora muy emprendedora y con ganas de seguir adelante.    

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar más productos para su negocio como son azúcar, arroz, menestras entre otros.
 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The associate belongs to the community bank "Sumac Puririsun".  The bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province and department of Cusco.
The member is Mrs Etelvina, she is 34 years old, lives with a partner and has 2 children.  She divides her time between her daily family activities and a restaurant business.  She runs it by herself because her husband works on construction projects (master builder).  She is a very enterprising woman with desires to get ahead.

The associate is requesting a loan to buy more products for her business, such as sugar, rice, mixed vegetables among others.

The associate thanks all that are part of this dream and promises to comply with the loan payments within the time established.

loans.use: The associate is requesting a loan to buy more products for her business, such as sugar, rice, mixed vegetables among others.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal  “LOS LIDERES ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Fernando; El socio tiene 25 años de edad, el es conviviente y trabaja en una discoteca atendiendo la barra, el prepara todo tipo de bebidas alcohólicas; El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de un mueble para su cuarto el socio desea comprar una cómoda para su cuarto. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar una cómoda.

El socio  agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su cuota en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Fernando belongs to the “Los Líderes” (The Leaders) community bank which is located in Huanchac district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

Fernando is 25 years old.  He lives with his partner and works as a barman in a disco.  He prepares all sorts of alcoholic drinks.  Fernando is requesting a loan to invest in buying a piece of furniture for his room.  He is requesting this loan to buy a chest of drawers.

Fernando is grateful and appreciates his loan.  He pledges to make his repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy a chest of drawers

loans.name: Gerardina

texts.es:
Gerardina, de 30 años, convive con David, de 28 años. Ambos tienen 4 hijos, de los cuales 2 son de su compromiso anterior. Como una gran familia; ellos en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad nativa de Centro Huachirik. Como padres responsables, Gerardina y David, se esfuerzan por salir adelante. 

Por su parte David, trabaja durante el día con su auto propio, en el trasporte público, trasportando a sus pobladores en las rutas de: la ciudad de Yurinaki a la ciudad de Pichanaki. Mientras que Gerardina, cuida de sus plantaciones de café, palta y piña, en donde constantemente, riega, aplica abono y fumiga. Ya que el buen cuidado depende mucho del éxito de las cosechas, por ello la mayor parte del día la pasa en sus terrenos agrícolas, para cuando sus cultivos están aptos son comercializados en el mercado central de Pichanaki, aunque le es pesado tener que llevar todos sus productos hasta la ciudad a veces no logra encontrar transporte para regresar a casa, por eso se queda en algún hotel de Pichanaki. En adelante desea adquirir una pequeña casa en esa ciudad, para que pueda trasladarse sin difultad y poder vender toda su producción, además ya no tendrá la preocupacón de quedarse sin movilidad para retornar a su hogar. 

Es el tercer crédito con MFP y se siente satisfecha con el trabajo realizado en su banco comunal, donde lleva 2 años trabajado con ahínco y asegura que tendrá muchos éxitos futuros. 

Con el crédito que solicita, podrá obtener 4 sacos de abono orgánico, de S/. 150.00 soles cada uno; con lo que piensa esparcir en sus plantaciones de piña que dentro estos meses cosechará.
texts.en:
Gerardina, 30, cohabits with David, 28.  They have four children, two from her previous relationship.  Like a great family they live in their own house located in the indigenous community of Centro Huachirik.  As responsible parents, Gerardina and David work hard to get ahead in life.  

David works during the day providing public transportation services with his own car.  He transports residents along the route from the city of Yurinaki to the city of Pichanaki.  Meanwhile, Gerardina tends to her coffee, avocado and pineapple fields constantly watering, fumigating and fertilizing them because much of the harvest’s success depends on the good care she gives them.  She, therefore, spends most of the day in the fields and when the crops are ready for sale she sells them in the city’s central market.  In the future she’d like to acquire a small house in the city so that she can get around more easily in order to sell all of her produce; she would also no longer have the problem of being stuck without transportation to return home.

This is her 3rd loan with MFP and she is satisfied with the work of her communal bank where she has been working diligently for two years; she is sure of much future success.

She will use the loan to get four sack of organic manure, which cost 150 soles each, that she plans to spread among her pineapple plants that she will harvest these coming months.

loans.use: To buy 4 sacks of organic manure.

loans.name: Gricelda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS LIDERES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gricelda; tiene 30 años de edad, y es soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de productos naturales, ella vende en forma independiente y lo lleva a diferentes instituciones o al público en general, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio. La  socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos naturales al por mayor.

 La socia agradece el préstamo solicitado  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Gricelda, 30, is a member of the “LOS LIDERES” (The Leaders) communal bank located in Cusco district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

She is single and has a son.  She alternates her daily chores with the sale of natural products.  She works independently taking the products to various institutions or to the public in general.  She’d like to expand her business and is asking for a loan to buy natural products at wholesale.

She is grateful for the requested loan and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy natural products at wholesale.

loans.name: Foday

texts.en:
This is 45-year-old Foday. He is married and has three children, ages 2, 5 and 10. He has one additional dependent who lives with him because he is helping educate her. 

In 1992, Foday established his used clothing business. He began his business because he wanted to provide for his family. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, he earns about $175 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL. Foday has already received and successfully repaid four loans from ARD, and now requires a new loan in order to buy additional stock for his business. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately $300. 

In the future, Foday plans to sell wholesale and supply to other traders, build two additional stalls and hire a sales person. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used jeans

loans.name: Bayardo Heriberto

texts.es:
Don Bayardo de 49 años de edad es casado, tiene 3 hijos menores en edad escolar, labora para el Supermercado San Antonio como gerente de distribuidora de agua desde hace 20 años. 

Esta solicitando  su 2do credito con el objetivo de continuar mejorando su vivienda, esta vez echandole la ceramica y ademas ponerle el cielo razo y si el dinero alcanza poner azulejos al baño para de esta manera brindar mayor comodidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Don Bayardo is 49 years old, married, and has three children who are under school age.  He has worked for the San Antonio Supermarket as a distribution manager for water for 20 years.  

He is requesting his second loan with the goal of continuing to improve his home, this time laying the tile and putting up the ceiling, and if there is the money, laying bathroom tiles – all for the purpose of providing greater comfort to his family.

loans.use: Echar piso, poner cielo razo

loans.name: Amanda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS LIDERES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Amanda; tiene 40 años de edad, y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa americana de segunda mano y también es ayudante de cocina en un restaurant turístico, la socia vende ropa americana los días sábados desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de ropa. La  socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería como pantalones, polos, chompas y blusas.

 La socia agradece el préstamo solicitado  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Amanda, 40, is a member of the “LOS LIDERES” (The Leaders) communal bank located in Cusco district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

She is married and has two children.  She alternates her chores with the sale of American second-hand clothes; she’s also a kitchen helper in a tourist restaurant.

She sells clothes Saturdays from 8am until 5pm and wants to expand the business.  She is asking for a loan to buy merchandise like pants, polo-type shirts, sweaters and blouses.

She is grateful for the requested loan and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more peppers, groundnuts and beans

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS LIDERES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Luisa; tiene 26 años de edad, y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de carpintería y también se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de carpintería. La  socia solicita el préstamo para comprar una industria cepilladora para la carpintería.

 La socia agradece el préstamo solicitado  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Luisa, 26, is a member of the “LOS LIDERES” (The Leaders) communal bank located in Cusco district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

She has a life partner and one son.  She alternates her chores with a carpentry business and also sells beauty products.  She works from 8am until 6pm and wants to expand the carpentry business and is asking for a loan to buy an industrial sander for the shop.

She is grateful for the requested loan and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy an industrial sander for the carpentry shop.

loans.name: Edgar Wilber

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal  “LOS LIDERES ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Edgar; El socio tiene 51 años de edad, el es soltero; el socio tiene una peluquería el trabaja en su salón de belleza como estilista profesional, el socio conoce muy todo este mercado de la belleza y se ha especializado en maquillaje y cortes y peinados. El socio desea comprar productos de belleza como son tintes, peines, líquidos para ondulaciones y algunas tijeras. El socio desea invertir el capital en la compra de productos de belleza. 

El socio  agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su cuota en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Edgar, 51, is a member of the “LOS LIDERES” (The Leaders) communal bank located in Huanchac district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

He is single and has a barber shop.  He works in his beauty salon as a professional stylist.  He knows the beauty market very well and has specialized in make-up, haircuts and hair styling.  He wants to buy beauty products like hair dyes, combs, waving liquids and some scissors.  He wants to invest the capital purchasing beauty products.

He is grateful for and values the loan granted by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy beauty products.

loans.name: Abel

texts.en:
Abel is a 32-year-old poultry farmer.  He runs his business in a very competitive environment.  Apart from poultry farming, he sells milk.  Abel is really grateful to Faulu Kenya because he is able to save his money and get financial support through his group members.  

He has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to buy more chickens.  He hopes to start practicing dairy farming in the future.

loans.use: To buy more chickens

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy tools, spare parts and seats

loans.name: Sarai Group

texts.es:
El grupo sarai lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es María José Gómez quien desde hace cinco años tiene una pequeña venta de gaseosa y refrescos naturales de cacao, cebada, piña, arroz con piña, cálala, pitalla, limón, chilla…etc. 
Las otras integrantes del grupos son Melba B. quien realiza frescos naturales e invertirá en frutas, azúcar, hielo, bolosas y pajillas y María S. tiene una pulpería la cual tiene surtida con los productos de mayor venta.
texts.en: The Sarai group is made up of three hard-working women.  María José Gómez is one of the group's members and has sold soft drinks and natural fruit drinks (cacao, barely, pineapple, rice and pineapple,passion fruit, pitaya, lemon, chilla etc. ) for five years. The others who make up the group are Melba B. who makes natural drinks also and will invest in fruits, sugar, ice, bags, and straws and María S. who has a small grocery store in her home.  She will stock her store with products that sell the most.

loans.use: Soft drinks and fruits

loans.name: Lubov

texts.en:
Lubov is in the flower business. She raises flowers in a greenhouse and then sells them at the market. She has been in this business for ten years. She enjoys her flower business very much. The many repeat clients who buy flowers from Lubov every year are the key to her successful business.

Lubov is a hard working person. She would like to borrow 13,000 UAH to increase her assortment of flowers. She hopes to increase her profit and improve her living conditions. Lubov lives with her husband in a private house.

loans.use: to increase the assortment of flowers

loans.name: Washington

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “LOS LIDERES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.


El socio es el Sr. Washington; el tiene 53 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; el socio se dedica a trabajar en transporte, el trabaja en una combi haciendo servicio publico, el socio quiere mejorar el carro. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar llantas para la combi.


El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Washington, 53, is a member of the "LOS LIDERES" (The Leaders) communal bank located in Cusco district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

He has a life partner and three children.  He works in public transportation driving a minivan.  He wants to improve the vehicle and is asking for funds to buy tires.

He thanks all who will share in his dream and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy tires for his minivan.

loans.name: Flor

texts.es: Flor, de 23 años, convive con Luis, de 26 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos, Luis, de 3 y Roly, de 5 años. Los cuatro viven en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad nativa Centro Huachirik. Hace tan solo 4 años, que viene dedicándose a la agricultura, sus  principales sembríos constan de café, plátano y achiote. Estos productos son muy solicitados en su comunidad, por eso Flor, en cada temporada de cosecha, contrata operarios, para que trabajen en sus 2 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas y pueda obtener mayor productividad de estos frutos, ya que obtiene buenos ingresos y utilidades, pues los vende en el mercado de la ciudad de Pichanaki. Pero consiente de sus necesidades y dar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos, planea acondicionar un pequeño espacio en su casa, en el que piensa abrir una tienda de comestibles, para poder obtener mayores ingresos. La principal característica de Flor, es la responsabilidad; por eso es muy respetada en su banco comunal, donde todos son puntuales con MFP. Es el tercer crédito que tiene y se siente feliz por el apoyo brindado. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará varios sacos de abono orgánico, para sus cultivos de maíz híbrido y si el dinero le alcanza, obtendrá herramientas de trabajo para limpiar sus terrenos de la maleza que crece.
texts.en: Flor, 23, lives with Luis, who is 26.  They have 2 children: Luis, who is 3, and Roly, who is 5.  The four of them live in their own home, located in the indigenous community of Centro Huachirik.  For 4 years they have been farming, their main crops consist of coffee, banana and achiote.  These products are sought after in their community and so Flor, in every harvest season, hires workers to work on their 2 hectares of agricultural land.  This way she can get a better production of these fruits and obtain better profits and a better income.  She sells the products in the market of the city of Pichanaki.  But being aware of the needs of her children, and to give them a better quality of life, she plans to set up a small space in her house where she is thinking of opening a grocery store so that she can have better earnings.  Flor's most significant personality trait is responsibility, and for this reason she is well respected in her communal bank, where all the members are punctual with their payments to MFP.  This is Flor's 3rd loan, and she feels happy about the support being provided.  With the loan she requests, she will buy a number of bags of organic fertilizer for her cultivations of hybrid corn, and if there is enough money, she will buy some tools for her work to clear their land of weeds.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizer and tools to clear her land of weeds

loans.name: Segundo Manuel

texts.es: Segundo Manuel es un hombre de 58 años que vive en el barrio Las Moras de Soledad, él   en compañía de su cónyuge,  atienden su negocio llamado “Kiosco estadero donde Carmen”;  convertido es un sitio donde los clientes se alimentan y es también  una llantería, ubicada en un sitio estratégico de mucha circulación de vehículos; allí mientras presta el servicio de reparación y mantenimiento de  neumáticos  que inició hace 20 años, también tiene un punto de ventas  de desayunos, comidas, refrescos y meriendas atendido por su cónyuge, con quien tiene 3 hijos en las edades de 29 a 33 años.  Con los financiamientos recibidos por parte de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, le ha ido muy bien porque lo han impulsado al mejoramiento de sus ingresos de negocio y con  estos logros económicos ha podido educar a sus hijos y pagar la totalidad de su vivienda para brindarles y mejor estar a su familia. Su máximo desafío se presenta cuando su esposa por motivos de salud no puede atender su negocio de alimentos y  debe dirigir todos sus esfuerzos a que todo continúe como antes. Con su credikiva comprará  materias primas e insumos para sus dos negocios: neumáticos, rines, goma y llantas y para su kiosco  gaseosas, jugos, cervezas, arroz, aceite y azúcar, y condimentos en mayor volumen. Su sueño es automatizar un poco su negocio, comprando una maquina despegadora automática y un botellero para mejorar su sistema de refrigeración y ofrecer mejor servicio a sus clientes y aumentar sus utilidades  que hasta el momento representan un  promedio del 25% después de los costos.
texts.en:
Segundo Manuel, 58, lives in the Las Moras de Soledad neighborhood with his spouse.  They tend to a kiosk called “Kiosk Estadero Donde Carmen” which has become a place where customers come to eat.  It’s also a tire store located in a strategic spot with lots of vehicular traffic.  While he provides tire repair and maintenance services, a business he started 20 years ago, he also has a sales point for breakfasts, lunches, refreshments and evening snacks that his spouse runs.  They have three children whose ages range from 29 to 33 years.

He has done well with loans from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo because they have brought about improvement in his income and this economic improvement has made it possible for him to provide an education for his children and pay his household expenses thereby providing wellbeing for his family.

His greatest challenge presents itself when his wife’s health prevents her from tending to the food preparation business and he must direct all his efforts toward insuring that everything runs as before.

He will use his Kiva loan to buy raw materials and supplies for his two businesses:  inner tubes, rims, rubber and tires and for his kiosk, soft drinks, juices, beer, rice, cooking oil, sugar and condiments in volume.

His dream is to automate his business a bit buying an automatic unfastening machine and a bottle cooler to improve his refrigeration system thus offering better customer service and increasing profits which to date represent, on average, 25% after costs.

loans.use: Will buy raw materials and supplies for his two businesses:  inner tubes, rims, rubber and tires for one and for his kiosk, soft drinks, juices, beer, rice, cooking oil, sugar and condiments in large volume.

loans.name: Zenzontle Group

texts.es:
El grupo Zenzontle lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras una de ellas es la señora María Felix Hernández comerciante de cosa de honor, repostería popular a base de maíz y queso que se acompañada de un café por las mañanas o las tardes sabe muy rica. Ella desde hace 9 años se dedica a realizar este producto los cuales vende de manera ambulante.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son María del Rosario G. quien vende cosméticos desde hace 4 años y Paula del Carmen Rodríguez quien vende cosméticos y ropa usada.
texts.en:
The “Zenzontle” (Mockingbird) group is composed of three hard working, dedicated, enterprising woman.  One of them is María Félix Hernández who sells “Cosa de Honor” (A Matter of Honor) which is a popular corn and cheese based pastry that is usually enjoyed with a cup of coffee in the morning or evening; it is very tasty.  She has been making this product for 9 years and she sells it as a street vendor.

The other group members are María del Rosario G. who has sold cosmetics for four years and Paula del Carmen Rodríguez who sells cosmetics and used clothes.

loans.use: For corn, cheese, milk, etc.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “LOS LIDERES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.


El socio es el Sr. Juan; el tiene 33 años de edad y es soltero y tiene 2 hijos; el socio se dedica al negocio de taller mecánica, el arregla diferentes carros, el trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, el socio quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar repuestos para arreglar los carros.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Juan, 33, is a member of the “LOS LIDERES” (The Leaders) communal bank located in Cusco district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

He is single and has two children.  He is a mechanic.  He repairs different cars working from 8am until 6pm.  He wants to expand and improve the business and is asking for a loan to buy replacement parts to repair cars.

He thanks all those who will share in his dream through this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy replacement parts for vehicle repair.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is a married man who operates a salon and barber shop.  He has engaged in the business for three years.  He has also been running a grocery store for three years to earn extra income.  With income from his businesses, he is able to educate his three children.  

Geoffrey wants to open a hair-dressing school in the future.  He has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to buy a shaving machine and hair chemicals.

loans.use: To buy a shaving machine and hair chemicals

loans.name: Rosa Angelina

texts.es: Rosa Angelina tiene 27 años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este tipo de negocio, por lo que no ha sido fácil administrar este negocio, con tanta competencia que tiene. Ella inicio con pocos ingresos, pues no tenía el capital suficiente para invertir en más productos. Ella es una mujer luchadora  que siempre busca la forma como trabajar para mantener su hogar. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de toallas, sabanas, ropa en general, cosmético y calzado.
texts.en: Rosa Angelina is 27, and she sells general merchandise.  She began 5 years ago but it hasn’t been easy since there is a lot of competition.  She started with few items since she didn’t have enough capital to invest in many products.  She is a hard-working woman who is always looking for a way to support her household.  She will use the loan to buy towels, sheets, clothing, cosmetics and shoes.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 33 years old, married and has three children.  She is a new client with Faulu Kenya and she hopes to grow her business through them.  

She sells shoes and fish for a living.  She was previously selling food to earn a living.  Janet hopes to expand her business and open a cereal shop in the future. 

In ten years, she hopes to supply fish to hotels.  She has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to buy a freezer.

loans.use: To buy a freezer

loans.name: En El Nombre De Dios Group

texts.es:
El grupo en el nombre de Dios está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es Ana María quien  se dedica al comercio de cosméticos como perfumes, cremas, labiales, delineador, marbellí, rubor, bases, sombras etc. en las cuales invertirá el crédito. 
Las otras integrantes son Miriam Alvares quien tiene una pequeña fritanga, restaurante popular a base de comida frita como enchiladas, tajadas con queso, pollo frito, asado, carne asada, maduros con queso etc. y Esmeralda L. quien vende ropa usada desde hace varios años.
texts.en:
The 'En el Nombre de Dios' (In the Name of God) group is made up of three hard-working women.  One of them is Ana María who works selling cosmetics such as perfume, creams, lipsticks, eye liners, blusher, foundations, eye shadows, etc. on which she will spend her loan.

The other members are Miriam Alvares who has a small restaurant, a popular restaurant which sells fried foods such as enchiladas, cheese fritters, fried chicken, roast chicken, roasted meat, fried plantain with cheese, etc. and Esmeralda L. who has sold used clothes for several years.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics such as perfume, creams, lipsticks, eye liners, blushers, foundations, eye shadows, etc.

loans.name: Richard

texts.es: Richard, de 30 años, está casado con Nilda, de 22 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Ángelo, de 4 y Kenyi, de 2 años. Los cuatro  viven en su casa propia ubicada en la ciudad de Pichanaki (selva central peruana). Desde que era niño, Richard, se dedica a la agricultura, pero desde hace 8 años, adquirió sus propios terrenos agrícolas, ahí siembra café y demás frutas oriundas del lugar, los que después de cada cosecha comercializa en el mercado central de la ciudad. Lo que más le gusta a él, son las temporadas de campaña agrícola, donde la demanda de los productos es mayor y por ende el precio de venta se incrementa. Sin embargo, Richard, aprovecha está temporada, para dedicarse a la compra y venta de productos, al por mayor, ya que son comercializados en las diferentes ciudades del país, obteniendo mayores ingresos. En delante desea comprar un camión; con el que piensa trasportase sin mayores problemas. Es el tercer crédito con MFP y se muestra muy agradecido por todo el tiempo que su banco comunal le ayudó para poder trabajar y progresar. Con el crédito que solicita, podrá comprar fertilizantes naturales (guano), para sus plantaciones de café y si el dinero le alcanza, invertirá en la compra de 3 sacos de abono orgánico.
texts.en: Richard is 30 years old and is married to Nilda who is 22 years old. They have 2 children, Ángelo is 4 and Kenyi is 2 years old. The four live in their own home located in the city of Pichanaki (central Peruvian jungle). Since he was a child, Richard has been involved in agriculture but 8 years ago he got his own land, he grows coffee and other fruits native to the area and after harvest season he sells them in the central market of the city. What he enjoys most is the countryside where the demand for his products is greater and as a result the sale price increases. Richard takes advantage of this season to buy and sell products wholesale since they are sold in different cities of the country which gives him more income. Richard wishes to buy a truck so that he will be able to travel without any major problems. This will be his third loan with MFP (Kiva’s field partner) and he is very grateful for all the time that his communal bank has dedicated to help him work and progress. With the loan he will buy natural fertilizers (guano) for his coffee crops and if there is money left over, he will buy 3 sacks of organic manure.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and 3 sacks of organic manure.

loans.name: Violeta Jazmin

texts.es:
Violeta de 22 años, tiene un cybe- café. Vive con su hijo de 2 años en una zona periurbana llamada Paraíso de la flor ubicada en una zona caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y montañas.  

Ella y su mama trabajaban vendiendo pollos pero como era muy cansado y dificultoso mantener a los pollos decidieron cambiar de negocio. Con un pequeño capital hace 6 meses comenzaron con su pequeño cyber-café para que Violeta lo administre. Atienden desde las 09h00am hasta las 21h00pm dando los servicios de internet, bebidas y telefonía. La hora de internet la da por $ 0.50, llamadas a celular a $ 0.05 el minuto, y las bebidas según la marca a $ 0.40. 

Ella quiere continuar con su negocio por eso quiere comprar dos computadoras par darle un mejor servicio a sus clientes. En el futuro quiere vender celulares y computadoras.
texts.en:
Violeta is 22 years old; she has an internet café. She lives with her 2 year old son in a semi urban area called Paraíso de la flor located in an area characterized by its dirt roads and mountains.

Violeta and her mother work selling chickens but it was too tedious and difficult to keep the chickens and they decided to change businesses. With a small capital, 6 months ago they began their small internet café that Violeta manages. They work from 9:00 a.m. until 9:00 p.m. providing internet, beverages and telephones for their customers. Internet service costs $ 0.50 per hour, cell phone calls are $ 0.05 per minute and beverages begin at $ 0.40 depending on the brand.

Violeta wants to continue with her business and that is why she wants to buy two computers to give better services for her customers. In the future, she would like to sell cell phones and computers.

loans.use: To buy computers.

loans.name: Gerson Goyo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal  “LOS LIDERES ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Gerson; El socio tiene 26 años de edad, el es soltero; el socio tiene un pequeño taller de melamina, el socio fabrica muebles de todo tipo en su taller en melamina, el realiza trabajos desde hace dos años, el hace mesas, escritorios, roperos, cocinas, cómodas, camas y otros, el socio desea poder implementar su taller con maquinaria para pintar y cortar melamina, también comprar material al por mayor para realizar sus trabajos. El socio invertirá su dinero en la compra de taladro y tornillos, también ganchitos llamados sapos. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar taladro y ganchitos para los muebles.

El socio  agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su cuota en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Los Lideres (The Leaders) communal bank, which is located in the district of Huanchac part of the Cusco province and Cusco department.

The member is Mr. Gerson; he is 26 years old and is single. He has a small melamine resin shop where he builds all types of furniture in his shop. He has been working in this business for two years; he makes tables, desks, closets, kitchen sets, chests, beds and other items. Mr. Gerson wishes to include in his shop machinery to paint and cut melamine resin as well to buy material wholesale to do his work. The member will use the money to buy a drill and screws, as well as hooks called frogs. The member needs the loan to buy the drill and hooks for the furniture.

Mr. Gerson is thankful and values the loan given to him through this medium and is committed to meet the payment quotas in the time agreed.

loans.use: The member needs the loan to buy paint, and minor tools.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more flour, onion, vegetable oil, maggie and tomato paste.

loans.name: Tamaneh Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Tamaneh” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. This is not the first loan these entrepreneurs have accessed from SMT/Kiva. However, with the help of this new loan, they will be able to further expand their businesses, make more profit and, consequently, improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is M’balu K..  M’balu is 49 years old. She was born in Magburaka town where she is currently residing together with her husband and four children. Her husband is a farmer and one of of her children is attending primary school. Another one is in secondary school and the rest are in college. For 25 years now, M’balu has been selling cotton, shoes, bed sheets, dishes, etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above-mentioned items in large quantity to add to her current stock.

loans.use: To buy cotton, shoes, bed sheets, dishes, etc. in large quantity to add to her current stock

loans.name: Franciscah

texts.en:
Franciscah is a 58-year-old business woman who runs a cafeteria and a grocery shop.  She is able to employ two people in her business.  She has been running her business for five years and she hopes to own a restaurant in the future.  

With the loan of 20, 000 KES, she will buy ingredients such as maize flour, maize, cooking fat, beans, sugar and firewood.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as maize flour, maize, cooking fat, beans, sugar and firewood.

loans.name: Dora

texts.en:
This is 36 year-old Dora.  She is married and has 3 children ages 4, 9 and 12 years old.  In 1990, Dora established her plastic bowl business.  She started her business because she wanted to sustain herself and family.  Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL 400,000 every month. 

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000.  Dora requires a loan in order to buy more stock for the business.  She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL 800,000.  In the future, Dora plans to improve her family's well being by educating her children to a university level.  She would also like to buy land and build a house.  In the future, she wants to purchase stock from the neighboring country, Guinea, to increase profits and sell wholesale to other traders.  She is very hard working and dedicated and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more plastic bowls.

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en:
Ivan is married with one teen-aged daughter.  He offers transportation services by taking passengers every day on a certain route.  His income is 4,000 Grivnas a month.

Ivan has been in the transportation business for 3 years.  He used to have a small store where he and his wife worked together.  Later his wife decided she would not sell alcohol and tobacco at the store.  Ultimately Ivan decided to sell the store and change the business.  

Ivan is requesting a loan of 13,000 Grivnas to fix the engine. The car broke and is not working at the moment. Ivan cannot make any income until he fixes the car.

loans.use: To fix car engine

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS LIDERES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gloria; tiene 30 años de edad, y es soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de un hotel que atiende en la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado, ella quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio. La  socia solicita el préstamo para comprar unos artefactos para su casa.

 La socia agradece el préstamo solicitado  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Los Lideres (The Leaders) communal bank, which is located in the district of Huanchac part of the Cusco province and Cusco department.

The member is Mrs. Gloria, she is 30 years old, is single and has a son. The member alternates her day-to-day activities with business of a hotel that she takes care of in the city of Puerto Maldonado, she wishes to enlarge and improve her business. The member needs the loan to buy some appliances for her home.

Mrs. Gloria is thankful and values the loan given to her through this medium and is committed to meet the payment quotas in the time agreed.

loans.use: The member needs the loan to buy some appliances for her home.

loans.name: Chocolate Group

texts.es:
El grupo Chocolate lo conforman cuatro mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras una de ellas es Cecilia M. quien se dedica a la venta de Artesanías en distintos puntos del país y con el préstamo comprara mercadería para luego distribuirla entre sus clientes.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son Luz Amanda Palacio quien tiene una pequeña pero bien surtida pulpería  y vende ropa por encargo; Yeseling Auxiliadora V. vende artesanías de manera ambulante en especial en las ferias de pueblos y departamentos y Ángela del Socorro O. tiene una pequeña y modesta venta de palomitas, crispetas, tajaditas y chicharrones.
texts.en:
The group, Chocolate, is made up of four hardworking and enterprising women. One of them is Cecilia M. who sells crafts in different parts of the country and with the loan she will buy merchandize to later sell to her customers.

The other members of the group are Luz Amanda Palacio, she has a small convenience store but it is well stocked and she also sells clothing by orders. Yeseling Auxiliadora V. sells crafts as a street vendor, especially in village markets and other departments of the country. Ángela del Socorro O. has a small and modest store where she sells popcorn, plantain chips and fried crackling.

loans.use: To buy crafts.

loans.name: Bella Isabel

texts.es:
Bella vende productos Yambal (empresa que ofrece a mujeres emprendedoras comenzar con sus ventas independientes) y ropa. Vive con su esposo en Primavera de Duran (zona periurbana, con una ecología en disolución a las afuera de Guayaquil). 

Para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos de la casa ella empezó a trabajar vendiendo productos Yambal y ropa. Poco a poco a incrementado su cartera de clientes porque trabaja desde muy temprano ofreciendo los productos a sus vecinos y amigos, vende perfumes desde $ 20.00 hasta $ 75.00 c/u, cremas, ropa. Una de las preocupaciones que tiene es la delincuencia ya que comprar mercadería y la deja en stop. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar productos Yambal como perfumes, cremas, ropa. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Bella sells Yambal products (a company that offers enterprising women the opportunity to begin selling items independently) and clothing. She lives with her husband in Primavera de Duran (semi urban area with a loss to its ecology on the outskirts of Guayaquil).

To help her husband with the household expenses, Bella began working by selling Yambal products and clothing. Little by little she has been increasing her customer base because she works from very early in the morning by selling her products to her neighbors and friends; she sells perfumes from $ 20.00 to $ 75.00 per unit as well as creams and clothing. One of her concerns is the delinquency that hurts her business.

With the loan, Bella wants to buy Yambal products like perfumes, creams and clothing. In the future, she wishes to finish building her home.

loans.use: To buy perfumes, creams, and clothing.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Maria Elena tiene la edad de 31 años. Su negocio es la venta de mercadería en general. Esta no es la primera vez que solicita financiamientos pues ha sido muy beneficios. Ella ofrece los productos como calzado, cosméticos, ropa y otras cosas en general.  Por lo que tenía que pagar las cuentas de su vivienda y además buscar el alimento diario. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima necesaria. Su mayor sueño es seguir con vida para mantener esta actividad.
texts.en: Maria Elena is 31 years old, she sells general merchandize. This is not her first loan; the previous ones have been very helpful for her. She sells products like shoes, makeup, clothing and other general items. She has to pay her household bills as well as daily food. The reason for the loan is to buy raw materials and basic household goods. Maria Elena’s biggest dream is to keep living to keep working on her business.

loans.use: Work capital.

loans.name: Rocio Del Pilar

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS LIDERES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rocio del Pilar; tiene 30 años de edad, y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa y también es propietaria de un hotel en la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado, la socia por medio de estos pequeños negocios saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere mejorar el negocio. La  socia solicita el préstamo para comprar ropa como pantalones, blusas, chompas y polos.

 La socia agradece el préstamo solicitado  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Los Lideres (The Leaders) communal bank, which is located in the district of Huanchac part of the Cusco province and Cusco department.

The member is Mrs. Rocio del Pilar, she is 30 years old and lives with her partner and has 2 children. The member alternates her day-to-day activities with the business of selling clothing she also owns a hotel in the city of Puerto Maldonado. The member through these small businesses has been able to give her children a good start in life and she wishes to improve her business. The member needs the loan to buy clothing like pants, shirts, sweaters and polos.

Mrs. Rocio is thankful and values the loan given to her through this medium and is committed to meet the payment quotas in the time agreed.

loans.use: The member needs the loan to buy clothing like pants, shirts, sweaters and polos.

loans.name: Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El grupo Cayetano lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras una de ellas es Mayra Molinares Flores quien tiene una pequeña pulpería. Ella invertirá el crédito en la compra de arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite, carne, pollo, jabón, detergentes y chiverías.
La otras integrantes del grupo son Isabel H. tiene una pequeña venta de granos básicos (arroz, frijoles, aceite, azúcar) y chiverías y Paula María T. se dedica a la venta de tortillas bastimento a base de maíz que no falta en la mesa de los nicaragüenses; ella comercializa este producto en el mercado de Masaya y su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
The group Cayetano is made up of three hardworking and enterprising people. One of them is Mayra Molinares Flores; she has a small convenience store. She will use the loan to buy rice, sugar, beans, oil, meat, chicken, soap, detergents and dairy products.

The other members of the group are Isabel H. who has a small store where she sells basic grains (rice, beans, oil, sugar) and dairy products. Paula María T. sells tortillas made of corn that is never missing from Nicaraguan tables. Paula sells her product on the Masaya market and in her home.

loans.use: To buy basic grains, chicken, meat, soap…etc.

loans.name: Good Luck Group

texts.en:
Abibatu K. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. The twenty-nine-year-old Abibatu is married to a trader and the couple has two children. For over ten years now, she has been selling palm oil (the most popular cooking oil). With the help of this loan she will buy gallons of palm oil to add to her current stock. 

Abibatu and her group members are applying for a loan of SLL 2,200,000.00  to invest in their respective businesses. By investing the loan in their businesses, these entrepreneurs will be able to make more sales, better profit and consequently improve their living conditions.

loans.use: Buy gallons of palm oil to sell

loans.name: Granito Group

texts.es:
El grupo el granito lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras una de ellas es la señora Johana C. Mendoza quien se dedica al comercio productos lácteos como cuajadas, queso, crema y leche. Ella invertirá el crédito a la compra de dichos productos para mejorar el negocio.
Las otras integrantes son Agustin T. Torres quien se dedica al comercio de ropa de manera ambulante y Denis Francisco García vende granos básicos desde hace varios años. Ellos con el crédito compraran mercadería para su negocio.
texts.en:
The group El Granito is made up of three people who are hardworking and enterprising. One of the members is Mrs. Johana C. Mendoza she sells dairy products like curdled milk, cheese, cream and milk. She will use the loan to buy the products mentioned to improve her business.

The other members are Agustin T. Torres who sells clothing as a street vendor and Denis Francisco García who has sold basic grains for a couple of years. With the loan they will buy merchandize for the business.

loans.use: To buy dairy products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cement and sand.

loans.name: The Women´s Association Of Artisans Of Chira Group

texts.en:
The Women´s Association of Artisans of Chira is a legally recognized entity which is an association of entrepreneurs that has existed for 9 years. The 9 women members of this group live and work on the island of Chira, located in the province of Puntarenas, on the pacific coast of Costa Rica. The women know one another on a deep and personal level, having lived in the same community for the majority of their lives. Throughout the group’s existence, the members have received support and instruction from various public and private institutions, including universities and government bodies in charge of economic development. This will be the group´s second loan with Fundación Mujer. During the group´s first loan, the members demonstrated their ability to make punctual repayments and work well together as a group.   

The members of this group have a business producing various arts and crafts which they sell to tourists as well as locals at various fairs and sales events. The women work from 10 am to 4pm from Monday to Saturday. The work is separated into shifts, allocating some members to production and other members to sales, adjusting to supply and demand as the members see fit.  

On the production side, members work in their workshop in order to produce jewelry made out of fruit seeds, rock paintings, and gourd crafts (a gourd is called a Jicara in Spanish, a type of inedible fruit, which the women hollow out and paint, as can be seen in the picture). The gourd fruits are cultivated from the land of the members. 

On the sales side of things, the women have been successful in earning revenues at various fairs and community events. Additionally, the association has secured an agreement with a local hotel owner who gives tours to her guests.  One stop on the tour is the workshop of the association, whereby observers can view the artistic production process and purchase hand made arts and crafts.  The group members are well aware of the marketing appeal that is generated by having visitors to their workshop; for this reason, one of the groups goals is to use this loan to make improvements to their workplace and make it more presentable, one woman explained, "the workshop is the face of our business."   This loan will also be used to invest in work materials and tools, necessary for the production of various arts and crafts, including pliers, ropes, wires and wood.
 
Adilia Maria E. M. is a 29 year old single mother who lives with her mother and 5 children on the island of Chira. Adilia, like the rest of the entrepreneurs in this group, is dedicated to her productive activity.  The revenues earned by these hard working women represents a significant portion of family income.  The main obstacle the members face is securing a steady market for their products.  At the moment, sales are sporadic, in good months, the 9 members can earn up to $1,000 as a group, in bad months, only $400.  Currently, the group is awaiting the response for an application that has been submitted to the municipality of Puntarenas, which would grant them the right to make sales to tourists on cruise ships.  Various cruise ships dock in Puntarenas, and this represents an interesting opportunity for the group to increase their revenues.

loans.use: To purchase of materials and tools necessary for the production of arts and crafts.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
This is 33-year-old Nancy. She is married and has two children ages 17 and 6. In 2007, Nancy established her materials business in order to generate income. Her business is open seven days a week, six hours a day. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL in order to add more fabrics to her business. In the future, Nancy plans to expand and add additional stock to sell. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more fabric for resale

loans.name: Juan Bautista

texts.es:
Juan es un padre de familia de 52 de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el sector Las Pampas del distrito de Pimentel, la localidad es una zona rural y sus pobladores se dedican principalmente a la agricultura y a la ganadería. El lugar se encuentra ubicado a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace veinte años a labores asociadas a la agricultura, especialmente a la ganadería. El cría vacas en un terreno ubicado cerca a su domicilio, cuando estas ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que frecuentan la zona. Eventualmente también vende la leche que estas producen a sus vecinos.

Juan desea adquirir alimento balanceado para poder mejorar la crianza de sus animales y lograr que estas se desarrollen de mejor manera, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles con los cuales piensa lograr su objetivo.

Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario para brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Las personas que le conocen le consideran alguien respetuoso y confiable.
texts.en:
Juan is a 52-year-old father who lives with his wife and children in the Las Pampas sector of Pimentel District.  It is a rural area, and its inhabitants work mainly in agriculture and ranching.  The place is twenty minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

For twenty years Juan has done work associated with agriculture, especially ranching.  He raises cows in a field near his house.  When they have matured, he offers them for sale to businessmen who frequent the area.  He also sells the cows' milk to his neighbors.

Juan wants to get balanced feed so he can breed better animals and ensure that they grow well.  For this reason he has decided to apply to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 500 new soles.

His greatest desire is to continue growing as a businessman in order to offer his family a better quality of life.  People who know him say he is respectful and trustworthy.

loans.use: Buy balanced feed to improve the growth of his animals

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia tiene 43 años, esta casada con Walter de 44 años, que es confeccionista. Ambos tienen 4 hijos, de los cuales  los 2 mayores ya  trabajan y la ayudan en los gastos del hogar. Juntos viven en su casa que es propia. Cuando sus hijos empezaron a crecer tuvo más tiempo, así que decidió empezar con un negocio propio; han transcurrido 3 años y hasta la fecha se dedica en la venta de productos de belleza de diversas marcas que ofrece por catalogo. Le entretiene mucho su labor ya que tiene clientes fijos con las que conversa, mientras negocia, además su capacidad para convencer le ha permitido  recibir grandes incentivos de la compañía por el volumen de su  ventas. Por esta razón esta satisfecha, pues mientras trabaja y gana dinero no descuida las labores de su hogar, además ayuda a su esposo en los gastos, pero lo que le disgusta es que a veces sus clientes se demoran en pagar en la fecha indicada y eso genera un atraso de su capital. Como Sonia es una mujer emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado aumentar su mercadería y también quiere instalar una librería en su casa. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este préstamo que les permitirá continuar en su negocio. Sonia tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de cantidad de productos de belleza, pues necesita cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes, asimismo espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en: Sonia is 43 years old, married to Walter, a 44 year old tailor.  They have 4 children, 2 of which are older and already work and help with the household expenses. Together they live in their own house. When their children began to grow, Sonia had more time and decided to start a business; it has been 3 years that she has earned her living selling different brands of beauty products through a catalog. She enjoys her work very much, speaking and doing business with her steady customers; it has given her the ability to receive big incentives from the company for her volume of sales.  For this reason she is satisfied because as she works and earns money, she does not neglect her household chores, and helps her husband with expenses.  What she dislikes is that sometimes customers delay paying on the specified date and that generates a delay with capital. Sonia is an entrepreneurial woman; for the future she plans to increase her merchandise and also wants to install a bookstore in her home. It is her first credit MFP and promises to pay the assessed fees on time because she does not want to look bad with the people who made this loan possible and allow them to continue their business. Sonia has plans to invest the requested loan in the purchase of beauty products because she needs to meet the demand of her customers and hope to improve her profits.

loans.use: To stock up on beauty supplies

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.es:
Trinidad es una madre muy dedicada a su  familia, casada, siendo su esposo comerciante de granos básicos y albañil.
Hoy en día tiene dos trabajo uno fijo y otro la venta de tortilla que hace cuando llega de su trabajo como conserje,  ya que trabaja en turno en una cotran de buses, lo que se beneficia para palmear sus tortillas y lograr equilibrarse con su dinero.
Las mejoras la ha venido haciendo atreves de los prestamos en Afodenic, siendo una gran ayuda económica para una mejor vivienda.
Con el crédito anterior logro levantar un muro pero no lo concluyo por falta de materiales. Lo que con este nuevo préstamo seguirá con la construcción del muro en donde comprara: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro y comenzar.
texts.en:
Trinidad is a very dedicated mother; she is married and her husband is a trader in basic grains and a construction worker.

She currently has two jobs, one is a permanent job and the other is selling tortillas, which she does when she gets home from her job where she works shifts as a janitor in a bus station, and then she starts making her tortillas. This allows her to balance out her expenses.  

Through her loans from Kiva Field Partner, Afodenic, she has received the financial help required to make improvements to her home.
