With her last loan, she was able to start building a wall, but she was unable to finish it due to lack of materials. So with this new loan, she will continue with the construction of the wall, for which she will buy: stone, sand, cement and iron.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to continue building a wall that she was unable to finish due to lack of materials

loans.name: Que

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “LOS LIDERES ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Marlene; la socia tiene 35 años de edad, ella es casada; la socia tiene 2 hijos, la socia se dedica  a la administración de empresas y ella por su parte junto a su esposo está en el negocio de compra y venta de autos, el esposo de ella es el que coordina todos los trámites de la compra y estando aquí ella ve los compradores y la parte legal. La socia trabaja en una empresa como administradora y en sus tiempos libres se encarga de ofrecer los autos que ambos hayan adquirido. La socia solicita el préstamo para apoyar en el viaje a su esposo y de este modo el podrá viajar a comprar un nuevo auto o camioneta. 

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su cuota en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Marlene belongs to the communal bank "Los Lideres."  This communal bank is located in the Huanchac district, which is in the province and department of Cusco.  

Marlene is 35 years old, married, and has 2 children.  She works in business administration and, along with her husband, has a business buying and selling automobiles.  Her husband coordinates the paperwork for the purchase, and she sees to the buyers and the legal part.  She works in a company as an administrator, and in her free time she is in charge of offering the automobiles for sale that she and her husband have acquired.  Marlene requests a loan to assist her husband with his travels, so that in this way he could travel to buy a new automobile or van.

Marlene appreciates and values the loan granted through these means, and so she is pledging to make her payments on time.

loans.use: she requests a loan to assist her husband with travel expenses so that he can travel to buy a new car or van.

loans.name: Gibrilla

texts.en:
This is 41-year-old Gibrilla. He is married and has five children, ages 10, 8, 5, 3 and 1. In 1990, Gibrilla established his drinks and building materials businesses in order to generate income. Working six days a week and ten hours a day, he earns about $225 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL in order to buy more drinks and building materials to sell. In the future, Gibrilla plans to generate more income and to build a house for his children. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy for soft drinks for his stand

loans.name: Rosa Hilda

texts.es:
Rosa es una madre de familia de 26 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos en el sector La Clake, una zona rural dedicada principalmente a la agricultura, se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de Reque, una zona comercial situada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores agrícolas relacionadas con la crianza y venta de animales. Por un lado tiene un grupo de vacas de las cuales vende la leche que producen a sus vecinos, adicionalmente cría aves de corral y ovejas para comercializarlas a los negociantes de la zona. Con los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades ella ayuda a su esposo con el sostenimiento económico de su familia.

Rosa desea realizar algunas mejoras en su vivienda las cuales le permitirán vivir de mejor modo, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles con los cuales piensa lograr su objetivo. Ella es una mujer con muchas ganas de progresar y seguir apoyando a su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 26 year old mother who lives with her spouse and their two children in the sector La Clake, a rural zone principally dedicated to agriculture.  It is located in the Reque district, a commercial zone situated 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.
She works in agriculture, specifically in raising and selling animals.  She has a group of cows and she sells the milk that they produce to her neighbors.  Also, she raises domesticated birds for meat and eggs in order to sell them to the local businesses.  With the income that she gets from these activities, she helps her husband with the economic support of the family.
Rosa wants to make certain improvements in her house, which would permit them to live in a better manner.  For this reason she finds it appropriate to ask Edpyme Alternative for a loan of 2000 nuevos soles, with which she would achieve her goal.  She is a woman with a great drive to improve and continue helping her family.

loans.use: To make improvements to Rosa's home

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “LOS LIDERES ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Isabel; la socia tiene 50 años de edad, ella es secretaria en el colegio Clorinda Matto de Turner, la socia requiere el crédito para pagar una mensualidad de su hijo en la superior, la socia es nombrada en esta institución pero sin embargo este mes ella tuvo muchos gastos en casa y se le recorto el presupuesto, la socia ahora solicita el préstamo para poder pagar dos mensualidades que se le acumularon. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en el pago de mensualidades de su hijo.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su cuota en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the community bank Los Lideres (The Leaders).  The community bank is located in the district of Huanchac, which belongs to the province Cusco and the department of Cusco.  
The member is Sra. Isabel.  She is 50 years old and is the secretary in the high school Clorinda Matto de Turner.  She needs this load in order to pay monthly fees for her son in high school.  The member is employed in this institution, but this month she had many household expenses and she cut the budget.  Now, she is asking for the loan in order to be able to pay the two monthly fees that have accumulated.  The member is asking for the loan in order to invest in the monthly fees for her son.
The member is thankful and values the loan awarded in this manner and in the same manner she promises to complete her payments in an established schedule.

loans.use: Monthly school fees for Isabel's son

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es: Alejandro tiene 34 años, esta casado María de 32 años. Ambos tienen 4 hijos menores, juntos  viven en su casa que es propia y su fin es salir adelante. Desde hace 3 años instaló un negocio que le prometía buenos resultados económicos, y desde entonces no ha parado de trabajar en el estampado de polos, pues es una labor que le genera regulares ganancias. En la comodidad de su casa tiene su pequeño taller donde estampa polos en planchas semejantes a mesas, ahí puede pintar  hasta 12 polos a la hora y avanza muy rápido con la ayuda de su esposa y sus hijos mayores. Además como tiene todos los instrumentos necesarios ha logrado captar una buena cantidad de clientes y mayoristas que prefieren encargarle los trabajos, por la calidad de trabajo. Lo que no le gusta es que no sale mucho pues su taller esta en su vivienda, pero sabe que el trabajo con empeño le permitirá seguir progresando. Como es un hombre emprendedor para el futuro tiene planeado ampliar el negocio y lograr estampar mayor cantidad de polos, para mejorar sus ganancias. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente ya que no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este préstamo que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Alejandro tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de una mesa para ampliar su negocio y de esta manera espera mejorar su producción y sus ganancias, ya que tiene varios pedidos pendientes que espera concretar.
texts.en: Alejandro is 34 years old.  He is married to María, who is 32.  Together they have 4 small children, and together they live in the house he owns.  His goal is to move ahead in life.  Three years ago he began a business which promised him good economic results, and since then he has not stopped working printing polo shirts, as it is work which brings him regular income.  In the comfort of his home, he has his small workshop where he prints polos in irons similar to tables.  In this manner he can print up to 12 shirts an hour and move along very quickly with the help of his wife and his older children.  Also, as he has the necessary tools he has managed to gain a good number of clients and wholesalers who prefer to put him in charge of this task because of the quality of his work.  What he doesn't like is to not get out much, as his workshop is in his house, but he knows that determined work will permit him to move forward in life.  As he is a man who plans for the future, he has planned to grow his business and to be able to print a larger number of polos in order to improve his earnings.  This is the first loan that he has taken with MFP and he promises to make his payments punctually as he doesn't want to displease the people who make possible this load that will permit him to continue working in pursuit of progress.  Alejandro has planned to invest the requested loan in the purchase of a table in order to grow his business and in this manner he hopes to improve his production and his earnings, as he already has various pending orders that he hopes to secure.

loans.use: To buy a table to grow Alejandro's workshop

loans.name: Cusco Sur Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “CUSCO SUR”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. María Elena; ella tiene 33 años D. edad y es soltera y tiene 3 hijos; La socia se dedica a la venta D. flores y también se dedica a la venta D. artesanía, ella tiene un pequeño puesto en el mercado llamado Ccascaparo en el distrito D. la ciudad D. Cusco donD. venD. las flores y en forma independiente también hace aretes y los venD., la socia trabaja desD. las 7:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m y por medio D. estos pequeños negocios saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar su negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar flores y comprar materiales para hacer los aretes.
Los otros socios  se dedican a la venta D. flores, restaurant, tienda D. abarrotes, artesanía, venta D. productos D. belleza y  producción D. aretes.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte D. este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the Cusco Sur Community Bank. This bank is located in the district of Cusco in the department of Cusco.

Mrs. Maria Elena is 33 years old and is single with three children. She works selling flowers and handcrafts. She has a small stand in a market called Cascaparo in an area in the city of Cusco where they sell flowers. Independent of this work she makes and sells earrings. She works from 7:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m. and through these small businesses help her proviD. for her children. She hopes to grow her business. She is applying for the loan in order to purchase flowers and the materials to make earrings. The other members have a variety of businesses such as selling flowers, restaurants, convenience store, handcrafts store, cosmetics store, and earrings.

Maria Elena is thankful for those who help her fulfill her dreams through this opportunity and she promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar flores y comprar materiales para hacer los aretes.

loans.name: Monica  Antonia

texts.es: La señora Mónica C. tiene un pequeño almacén de misceláneas en el cual vende perfumes, calzado, ropa exterior e interior femenina, prendas de fantasía, accesorios y artículos de papelería. Ella es casada y tiene dos hijos de 17 y 12 años quienes en sus ratos libres le colaboran en atender el negocio. La experiencia de la microempresaria en el comercio se remonta al año 1999 cuando empezó vendiendo productos por catálogos, hace dos años decidió comprar una vitrina exhibidora y surtirla con todos los productos que vende. La mayoría de su clientela son vecinos del sector, amigos y referidos de otros barrios. Generalmente las ventas son de contado, pero en ocasiones otorga créditos con plazos hasta de 45 días. El monto promedio de las ventas diarias es de $ 60.000 y el margen de ganancia es de aproximadamente 40%. Este es el primer crédito que tramita con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y lo invertirá en la compra de ropa, calzado y regalos. Se espera que las ventas se incrementen considerablemente en el mes de Diciembre por la temporada de fin de año. La señora Mónica es una persona muy colaboradora con sus vecinos y amigos, algunos de los cuales son usuarios de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y la han recomendado ampliamente. Su sueño es llegar a tener un gran almacén y colaborarle a su esposo en la financiación de los estudios universitarios de sus hijos.
texts.en: Mónica C. has a small shop of miscellaneous goods where she sells perfume, shoes, clothing, underwear, fancy clothing, accessories, and stationery. She is married and has two children, 17 and 12 respectively, and in her spare time she runs her business. Her experience as a small businesswoman began in 1999 when she started selling catalog products. Two years ago she decided to purchase a display case and fill it with the different products she sold. Most of her clients are neighbors, friends, and people who have been referred to her. Generally payment is made on delivery, but on occasion she extends credit for up to 45 days. Her average revenues are 60,000 and her profit margin is about 40%. This is her first loan with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, and she will use it to buy clothing, shoes, and gifts. She hopes that her sales increase during the month of December for the end of the year shopping season. Monica is a great collaborator with her neighbors and friends others of whom are members of the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation and they wholeheartedly recommend her. Her dream is to have a large store and work with her husband to provide her children with a university education.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing, shoes, and gifts

loans.name: Ramatu

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Ramatu. She is married and has three children, ages 8, 5 and 3. She has two additional dependents who live with her to help around her home. 

In 1999, Ramatu established her food items business with the help of a friend. Working four days a week and seven hours a day, she earns about $50 every month. She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL in order to add more food items to sell. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately $90. 

Ramatu is optimistic about a brighter future in her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more food for her business

loans.name: Dios De Salvación Group

texts.es:
El grupo Dios de Salvación está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras una de ellas es Katty María S. quien se dedica al comercio de frutas y verduras en el Mercado Oriental. Ella invertirá el crédito en frutas de temporadas.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son Meyling del Carmen García C. quien vende frutas y verduras ella invertirá en limones  y Fidelina del Carmen  C. quien también comercializa frutas y verduras desde hace años.
texts.en:
The "Dios de Salvación" group is made up of three hard-working women. One of them, Katty María S., works selling fruits and vegetables in the Oriental Market. She will use the loan to buy seasonal fruits. 

The other members of the group are Meyling del Carmen García C., who sells fruits and vegetables and will buy lemons, and Fidelina del Carmen C. who has also sold fruits and vegetables for years.

loans.use: Purchase fruits

loans.name: Tomás

texts.es:
Tomás   tiene 58 años esta casado, con Dionisia Bareiro de 55 años   tienen  cinco hijos todos mayores de edad  e independientes.
Su esposa le ayuda en el hogar en los que haceres doméstico, y en la microempresa. Tomás primeramente hace más de 20 años empezó como vendedor y de a poco se hacia de capital hasta que abrió su propio negocio gracias a eso pudo criar a todos su hijos en armonia, actualmente todos sus hijos se dedican a la misma actividad debido que desde muy jóvenes trabajaron con su padre y quienes aprendieron el oficio de él.
Actualmente trabaja con él dos  sobrinos a quienes les enseña el oficio y a la vez les remunera por los servicios.
Necesita el crédito para la compra de sábanas, termos para agua fria, asaderas y otros.
texts.en: Tomas is 58 years old and is married to Dionisia Bareiro, who is 55.  They have 5 grown children who live independently.  His wife helps him with the household chores, and also in his small business.  Tomas started out more than 20 years ago as a salesman with little capital.  He eventually opened his own store, and thanks to this he was able to raise his children in harmony.  Now all of his children are working in the same area, due to the fact that from the time they were very young they worked with their father and learned the trade from him.  Now he works with 2 nephews to whom he is teaching the trade, and at the same time paying them for their services.  He needs a loan to buy bed sheets, cold water thermoses, cooking pans, and other items.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (bed sheets, cooking pans, cold water thermoses, etc.)

loans.name: Maricela Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maricela del Carmen P. es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora quien vende pollo desde hace cinco años y granos básicos. Ella con el préstamo comprara pollo en piezas, embutidos y arroz, frijoles, aceite y azúcar.
La meta de P. es que su negocio crezca y lograr tener una pulpería con las condiciones adecuadas y bien surtida.
texts.en:
Maricela del Carmen P. is a hard-working and enterprising woman who has sold chicken and basic grains for five years. With this loan she will buy chicken in pieces, meats and rice, beans, oil and sugar.

Her goal is to expand her business and be able to have a well-stocked grocery store in good conditions.

loans.use: Purchase chicken, meats and basic grains.

loans.name: William

texts.es:
William P. tiene 32 años y quiere tener su propia compañía de “chapiadores”  (Cortadores de césped).
Es el de Canalate de Alajuela, una comunidad caracterizada por el emprendurismo de sus mujeres ya que hay varias organizaciones lideradas por ellas así como empresas.
El tiene varios  años de dedicarse a la corta de Césped de las  en su comunidad, ahora los clientes son cada vez más, es porque él necesita ₡604 000 (Seiscientos Cuatro mil colones) para la compra de una desbrozadora nueva y para arreglar la que ya tiene. El dice que su meta es crear una sociedad donde pueda tener otras personas trabajando  y así poder atender más clientes.
El es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Canalete, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica .Este será su segundo crédito.
texts.en:
William P. is 32 years old, and wants to have his own lawn service company.

This is Canalate de Alajuela, a community characterized by the entrepreneurial spirit of its women, since there are a number of organizations led by them, as well as companies.

For a number of years, William has been cutting lawns in his community.  Now his customer base is constantly increasing, and for this reason he needs 604,000 colones to buy a new brush cutter and to fix the equipment he already has.

He says that his goal is to create a company where he could have other people working and in this way provide service to more customers.  

He is a member of the Canalete community bank, one of the 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica.  This will be his second loan.

loans.use: to buy a brush cutter

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia tiene 60 años, vive en su casa que es propia en compañía de sus 3 hijas mayores y sus respectivas familias, aunque esta dama no tiene hijos menores a su cargo se esfuerza cada día por salir adelante. Desde hace 5 años atiende su negocio de venta de golosinas, gaseosas y cervezas que tiene en la puerta de su casa. Esta muy satisfecha ya que obtiene regulares ganancias que le permiten ayudar a sus hijas en la crianza de sus nietas, que según sus palabras son el tesoro que la vida le ha dado. Ella empieza sus labores desde muy temprano y empieza en la atención  desde las 10 de la mañana hasta la noche. Le gustan las ventas pues es una actividad bastante tranquila que le permite trabajar en la comodidad de su casa; pero lo que le desagrada es que no puede salir muy seguido porque descuidaría su negocio. Esta muy satisfecha con el desempeño de su grupo. Para el futuro tiene planeado ampliar su negocio y surtirlo con mayor cantidad de mercadería. Es el crédito número 12 con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente ya que no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Julia tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de cantidad de mercadería e ingredientes para surtir mejor su negocio, de esta manera espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en: Julia is 60 years old.  She lives in her own home with the company of her 3 eldest daughters and their respective families.  Although this lady doesn't have young children in her care she works every day to get ahead in life.  For the past 5 years she has worked in her business selling sweets, soda pop, and beers from the door of her home.  She is very satisfied as she gets regular earnings that allow her to help her daughters to raise her grandchildren, which in her words are the treasures that life has given her.  She begins her work very early and attends her shop from 10 in the morning until night.  She likes sales because it is a fairly tranquil activity that allows her to work in the comfort of her home; but she doesn't like that she can't go out very often because it would neglect her business.  She is very happy with the performance of her group.  In the future, she plans to grow her business and to stock it with a larger quantity of merchandise.  This is her 12th loan with MFP, and she promises to make her payments punctually as she doesn't want to displease the people who make possible the support that will permit her to continue working in the pursuit of progress.  Julia plans to invest the requested loan in the purchase of some merchandise and ingredients to better stock her business, and in this manner she hopes to improve her earnings.

loans.use: To buy merchandise to stock Julia's snack shop

loans.name: Simón

texts.es:
Simón tiene 47 años de edad, es casado y tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar, reside en el disrito de La Victoria desde hace aproximadamente 10 años.. 

Es propietario de una pequeña granja que se encuentra ubicada en el caserío La Clacke del distrito de Reque, se dedica a la crianza de gallinas para producción de huevos, en este rubro tiene aproximadamente 3 años, y conoce bastante del manejo de esta actividad, el vende su producto diariamente a las bodegas, tiendas y publico de la zona, adicionalmente su esposa maneja un pequeño negocio de  venta de pollo y carnes rojas los cuales también reparte a las bodegas.

Simón desea adquirir alimento balanceado para mejorar la crianza de sus animales y poder obtener productos de buena calidad. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles. Su mayor anhelo es poder expandir aun mas su negocio y empezar a distribuirlos en la ciudad de Chiclayo.
texts.en:
Simon is 47 years old, married, and has 2 school-aged children.  He has lived in the La Victoria district for about 10 years.

He is the owner of a small farm located in the La Clacke settlement in the Reque district.  He raises hens for egg production.  He has been in this line of work for about 3 years, and knows quite a bit about managing this type of enterprise.  He sells his products daily in the shops, stores and to the public in the area.  In addition, his wife manages a small business selling chicken and red meat, which she also distributes to the shops.  

Simon wants to acquire some nutritionally balanced feed to improve the raising of his animals so that he can obtain products of better quality.  To do this he has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 2,000 Peruvian soles.  His main desire is to be able to expand his business even more, and to start distributing his products in the city of Chiclayo.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally balanced feed for his business raising animals

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “LOS LIDERES ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Felicitas; la socia tiene 64 años de edad, ella es casada; la socia  tiene 4 hijos y ella se dedica  a la compra y venta de muebles en si ella también vende muebles hechos que fabrica su hijo que es carpintero, la socia trabaja en el barrio de Santiago; la socia tiene su tienda en este barrio y es muy conocida la gente la visita los días sábados que hay feria de muebles. La socia invertirá su crédito en la compra de materiales de carpintería. 

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su cuota en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Felicitas is a member of the Communal Bank “Los Lideres” (The Leaders), which is located in the District of Huanchac, Province and Department of Cusco.

She is 64 years old, married, and has four children. Felicitas buys and sells furniture but she also sells pieces made by her son who is a carpenter. She works in the neighborhood of Santiago and has a local store. Felicitas is well-known among the people who visit the furniture fair on Saturdays. She will invest this loan in the purchase of carpentry materials.

Felicitas is grateful and values the loan she was provided. Therefore, she promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

loans.use: Purchase carpentry materials

loans.name: Leida

texts.es: Leida Nubia M. T., tiene 29 años de edad, se dedica a la distribución de comida criolla hace 10 años en  la excelente Soda Tapia, ubicada en Upala de Alajuela. Al obtener este primer crédito invertirá en un congelador y una urna que mejorara la disposición de los alimentos y beneficiara la calidad y el servicio de su negocio. Para lo anterior, solicita un préstamo es de ₡604.000 (seiscientos cuatro mil colones). Es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Canalete, una de las 100 empresas asociadas por EDESA, por lo que desea ser responsable con la misma.
texts.en:
Leida Nubia M. T. is 29 years old and has been selling food for ten years at Soda Tapia, which is located in Upala de Alajuela. She is requesting her first loan in the amount of 604,000 CRC to invest in a freezer and a storage case to help her preserve the quality of her food and provide better service.

Leida is part of the Canalete Communal Credit Enterprise, one of 100 member organizations of EDESA. She wants to be a responsible member.

loans.use: Purchase a freezer & a storage case

loans.name: Juana Yovana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “LOS LIDERES ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Juana Yovana; la socia tiene 49 años de edad, ella es soltera; la socia tiene 1 hijo y ella trabaja comprando y vendiendo muebles desde hace 8 años en el barrio de Santiago ella aprovecha los días de feria para ofrecer sus muebles que consisten desde sillas, hasta roperos, camas, cómodas estantes entre otros.  La socia también trabaja con sus familia que tiene años fabricando muebles, ella vende los muebles y a ellos les da una parte de las ganancias. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar barniz, y pintar su tienda para llamar la atención de los clientes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar pintura y mejorar su negocio.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su cuota en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Yovana is a member of the Communal Bank “Los Lideres” (The Leaders), which is located in the District of Huanchac, Province and Department of Cusco.

She is 49 years old, single, and has one child.  Yovana has been buying and selling furniture for eight years in the neighborhood of Santiago.  She takes advantage of fair days to offer furniture such as chairs, wardrobes, beds, dressers, and other pieces.  Yovana also works with her family who has been selling furniture for years and shares the profits with them.  She needs a loan to buy varnish and paint for her store so that she can attract more customers and improve her business.

Yovana is grateful and values the loan she was provided.  Therefore, she promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

loans.use: Purchase paint & varnish to sell

loans.name: Omolitan

texts.fr: Omolitan a 20 ans. Il fait la couture et la broderie et compte dans cette activité près de 2ans. IL est né à Assahoun mais vit à adidogomé à Lomé. Il  a employé 5 personnes qui l’aide dans ses activités. Il s’approvisionne habituellement  au grand marché de Lomé. Avec le crédit demandé, il pense acheter une machine à broder
texts.en: Omolitan is 20 years old. He has had a sewing and embroidery business for almost two years. He was born in Assahoun, but now he lives in Adidogomé in Lomé. He employs five people who help him with his business. He usually purchases his business' supplies in the large market in Lomé. With the loan requested, he intends to purchase an embroidery machine.

loans.use: To purchase an embroidery machine

loans.name: Luz Isabel

texts.es:
Luz tiene una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa, vive con sus dos hijos de 18 y 24 años  en Primavera de Duran (zona periurbana, con una ecología en disolución a las afuera de Guayaquil). 

Ella comenzó con una vitrina vendiendo dulces y bebidas, poco a poco fue surtiendo su local con víveres, hasta ahora que tiene una pequeña tienda surtida en la parte delantera de su casa vende dulces, bebidas, granos, enlatados etc. Trabaja desde muy temprano para poder tener tiempo para su familia. 

Ella quiere surtir mas su tienda por eso quiere comprar un congelador y bebidas y así surtir su negocio. En el futuro quiere incrementar su tienda con mas mercadería.
texts.en:
Luz manages a small store in the front part of her home. She lives with her two children (ages 18 and 24) in Primavera de Duran, a periurban area outside of Guayaquil with a deteriorating ecosystem.

Luz started with a small display case from which she sold candy and soft drinks. Gradually over time she stocked her store with provisions. Now she has a small store at the front of her house where she sells candy, soft drinks, grain, canned goods, and other items. She starts her work very early so that she can have time to spend with her family.

Luz wants to acquire more inventory for her store, so she plans to buy a freezer and soft drinks for her business. In the future, she hopes to expand her store with more merchandise.

loans.use: Purchase a freezer & beverages

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
La  señora Eva C., es de la Ciudad de  Capi´ivary barrio centro, es soltera tiene casa propia es propietaria de comercio roperia y zapateria anexo peluqueria con local propio. 
Según ella empezo a vender mercerias por la zona de Capi´ivary en una moto acompañado por un señor a quien ella le pagaba mensualmente, ella siempre soñaba de salir adelante  y de tener su propio local comercial, ahora ya cuenta con dos salones bien terminado, cuenta  con clientela bien formado.
La señora acude a la entidad en busca de un apoyo economico como manifesta si uno trabaja siempre necesita de una ayuda para poder comprar mercaderias y tambien mantener la buena imagen de su negocio. 
 Posee buenas referencias personales y no tiene deuda financieras ni comerciales en otras entidades, solicita el prestamo para compra de mercaderias.  
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de calzados y ropas.
texts.en:
Sra. Eva C. lives in a central neighborhood of the city of Capi´ivary. She is single and has her own home. Eva is the owner of a clothing and shoe store that is located next to a beauty parlor.

She says she began selling sewing supplies throughout Capi´ivary by traveling on motorcycle with a man who she paid each month. Eva always dreamed of getting ahead and having her own retail store. Now she has two boutiques that are finished and an established customer base.

Sra. Eva comes to Fundación Paraguaya in search of financial assistance since she always needs some help in her business with acquiring merchandise and maintaining a good image. She has good personal references and no other financial or business obligations with any other entity.

Eva is requesting a loan to buy merchandise, such as shoes and clothing.

loans.use: Purchase clothing & shoes

loans.name: Afi Mawussé

texts.fr: Mawussé est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle a 40 ans. Pour contribuer au ménage, elle fait le commerce de bijoux. Elle est née à kpalimé mais habite à adidogomé à Lomé et cumule dans ses activités près de 4 ans.  Elle s’approvisionne à Cotonou au Benin  et revend à adidogomé. Pour satisfaire plus de clients, elle sollicite au près de WAGES un prêt.
texts.en: Mawussé is married and the mother of three children. She is 40 years old. In order to contribute to her household expenses, she has a jewelry business - altogether, she has been in this business for almost four years. She was born in Kpalimé, but she now lives in Adidogomé in Lomé. She purchases her supplies in Cotonou in Benin and resells the goods in Adidogomé. In order to satisfy more clients, she is requesting a loan from the microfinance organization WAGES.

loans.use: To purchase jewelry for re-sale

loans.name: Poovi

texts.fr: Elle a 35 ans, mariée et mère d’un enfant. Elle est née à gbidji et habite à lomé quartier adidogomé. Elle est couturière de profession mais associe la vente de tissus et pagnes pour pouvoir contribuer au ménage. Ses activités rapportent tellement qu’il a déjà remboursé plusieurs crédits. Elle cumule dans cette activité près de 5 ans. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé et revend au carrefour lapampam. Elle est aidée par une personne.  Elle demande ce prêt pour acheter 40 pièces de tissus et 50 pièces de pagnes.
texts.en: She is 35 years old, married and the mother of one child. She was born in Gbidji and now lives in the neighborhood of Adidogomé in Lomé. She is a tailor by profession, but also sells cloth and "pagnes" (colorful African wax cloth) in order to contribute to her household expenses. Her business earns so much that she has already repaid several loans. She has been in this business for almost 5 years. She purchases her supplies in the big market in Lomé and resells the goods at the crossroads of Lapampam. She is helped by one employee. She is requesting this loan to buy 40 pieces of fabric and 50 pieces of "pagnes".

loans.use: To purchase cloth and "pagnes" (colorful African wax cloth)

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El señor Carlos G. es de Jejui - Choré, con casa propia,  tiene 54 años de edad, es casado, todos sus hijos  son mayores de edad.
       Es propietario de una despensa con 9  años de funcionamiento, tiene buena ubicación, la mayoría de los empleados de una  gran empresa cerca de su negocio  son sus clientes.

          

               Es su décima operación de créditos con esta institución, esta abonando en forma excelente sus cuotas.

                  Con el  crédito desea comprar bebidas y otras mercaderias para  su negocio, y de esa manera hacer que cresca  cada día más y esta muy agradecido por los beneficios obtenidos.
texts.en:
Sr. Carlos G. is from Jejui-Choré. He is 54 years old, married, and has his own home. All of his children are grown.

Carlos is the owner of a food pantry that he has managed for nine years. It is situated in a good location. His customers mostly consist of employees who work for a large company nearby. This will be his tenth loan with Fundación Paraguaya. His payment history is excellent.

With this loan, he wants to buy beverages and other merchandise for his business. This will allow him to continue growing each day. Carlos is very grateful for the benefits he has obtained.

loans.use: Purchase beverages & other merchandise

loans.name: Marianita Esther

texts.es:
Marianita de 46 años, vende pescados. Vive con sus dos hijos  en Primavera de Duran (zona periurbana, con una ecología en disolución a las afuera de Guayaquil). 

Hace 5 años atrás el hermano de Marianita comenzó a comprar pescados en Encabao a un precio muy económico para venderlos en la ciudad.  Debido a la necesidad ella le compraba los pescados a su hermano y los vendía a sus vecinos poco a poco obtuvo una clientela fija para vender los pescados y mariscos. En la actualidad vende la liba de pescado a $ 2.90, la libra de camarón a $ 2.80 las ventas de los mariscos la realiza por pedido. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar pescados, camarones, ostión para que sus clientes tengan más variedad al comprar. En el futuro quiere comprar un carro para hacer por pedido mas frecuentes.
texts.en:
Marianita, age 46, sells fish. She lives with her two children in Primavera de Duran, a periurban area outside of Guayaquil that has a deteriorating ecosystem.

Five years ago, Marianita’s brother began buying fish in Encabao at a very affordable price to sell in the city. She decided to buy fish from her brother to sell to her neighbors. Gradually over time she built up an established customer base for selling fish and shrimp. She currently sells fish for $2.90 per pound and shrimp for $2.80 per pound. Her seafood sales are made by request.

With this loan Marianita wants to acquire fish, shrimp, and oysters so that her customers will have more variety from which to buy. In the future, she wants to purchase a car so that she can make more frequent deliveries.

loans.use: Purchase fish, shrimp, and oysters

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman is a mother of three sons and five daughters who are college and school students. Her husband Sha'ban is a taxi driver; he owns the taxi he works on and drives passengers for long distances between cities.

Iman's husband Sha'ban needed to replace auto parts to extend his taxi's life and enhance its performance as it's the family's source of income. Iman came to FATEN and took a loan for this purpose.

Iman's husband Sha'ban appear in the picture here because Iman comes from a very religious family. 

About this loan product:
 
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m

loans.use: To purchase auto parts to fix her husband's taxi

loans.name: Hernan

texts.es:
El Señor Hernan G. en la compañia Gral. Resquin, vive en  casa propia,  tiene 28 años de edad, esta casado con la señora Carmen Figueredo de 25 años de edad.
 
           El cliente tiene un negocio de ventas y activación de celulares, tambien realiza recargas de saldos.  Su señora tambien tiene un comedor en el centro de dicha ciudad, ambos se ayudan para progresar cada dia más.
           
          El cliente no tiene operaciones de créditos con otras entidades, solamente con la Fundación Paraguaya, y está muy agradecido por los beneficios recibidos, ya que con los crédito que recibio anteriormente pudo comprar los modelos de celulares que frecuentemente solicitan sus clientes.
En esta oportunidas nuevamente solicita para la compra de nuevos modelos de celures y ademas desea comprar memorias, carcasa y otros accesorios para celulares.
texts.en:
Sr. Hernan G. González is from Gral, Resquin.  He is 28 years old, lives in his own home, and is married to Sra. Carmen Figueredo who is 25 years old.  

Hernan has a business where he sells and activates mobile phones.  He also performs phone charges.  His wife manages a diner in the city.  Both of them help each other make progress each day.

Hernan has not engaged in credit transactions with other entities, only with Fundación Paraguaya.  He is very grateful for the benefits he has received.  His previous loan was used to buy mobile phone models that are frequently requested by his customers.  With this new request, Hernan will buy new models of mobile phones as well as memory chips, cases, and other phone accessories.

loans.use: Purchase mobile phones, cases, memory chips, and other accessories

loans.name: Romualdo

texts.es: El Sr. Romualdo, vive en la zona de Huayllani, es su casa es propia, es agricultor siembra en sus tierras que se encuentran en palca, siembra Papa, haba, también se dedica al servicio de transporte tiene dos hijas, su esposa se dedica a la venta de verduras en palca, es una familia muy trabajadora, el préstamo lo destinara para la refacción del motor de su movilidad, ya que con esta movilidad también transporta sus productos  es un Sr. muy trabajador y dedicado a su familia, siempre velando por su bienestar y la felicidad de sus hijas, esta agradecido con la institución por apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sr. Romualdo lives in the District of Huayllani where he has his own home. He is a farmer and has land in Palca where he plants potatoes and beans, but he also provides transportation services. Romualdo has two daughters and his wife sells vegetables in Palca. They are a very hardworking family.

The loan will be used to repair the engine of his vehicle since it is used to transport his products. Sr. Romualdo is a hard worker who is dedicated to his family. He is always looking out for the welfare and happiness of his daughters. Romualdo is grateful to Emprender for the support it has provided.

loans.use: Pay for engine repairs

loans.name: Pascuala

texts.es:
La  señora Pascuala O., es casada tiene 4 hijos la mayoria mayor de edad, la señora se dedica a la venta de verduras y frutas en el mercado municipal de San Estanislao, según ella comenzo vendiendo mandioca y banana por la zona de Santani en una camioneta venia con su hijo cada dia.
Con el  correr de los tiempos, y con el sacrificio y la lucha constante acompañada por su hijo, consiguio alquiler un pequeño salon  en el mercado donde ella pueda almacenar sus mercaderias y atender mejor a cada uno de sus clientes, gracias a la ayuda que le brinda la Fundacion Paraguaya ahora ya compro otra camioneta donde sus hijos hacen reparto de sus productos por toda la zona de San Estanislao, su sueño es de tener un local propio para que puede trabajar en forma eficiente y asi tener una vida digna para poder salir adelante y lograr sus metas u objetivos propuestos.
texts.en:
Sra. Pascuala O. is married and has four grown children. She sells vegetables and fruits at the municipal market of San Estanislao. Pascuala says she began selling cassava and bananas from the District of Santani that her son brought in by truck each day.

As time passed and with great sacrifice, she continued to struggle along with her son. Pascuala was able to rent a small space at the market where she could store her merchandise and provide better service to each of her customers. Thanks to the assistance provided by Fundación Paraguaya, she has now purchased another truck so that her children can deliver her products throughout the area of San Estanislao. Her dream is to have her own store where she can work in an efficient manner. She wants to have a decent life in which she can get ahead and achieve her goals and proposed objectives.

loans.use: Purchase fruits & vegetables

loans.name: Ruffo Bolivar

texts.es:
Ruffo de 53 años, tiene una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa. Vive en una zona periurbana en el Fortín de Guayaquil caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra.  
 
El comenzó a comprar víveres para venderlos a sus vecinos, poco a poco con esfuerzo y dedicación pudo comprar suficiente mercadería para ubicar una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa que es de caña, ahora el trabaja desde las 09h00 hasta las 20h00pm en su tienda con ayuda de su esposa y en ocasiones su hijos de 18 y 16 años cuando llegan de la escuela.  

Para poder seguir con su tienda el quiere comprar con el préstamo cemento, bloques y zinc para convertir su tienda de cemento ya que le es dificultoso guardar la mercadería en la lluvia. En el futuro quiere tener su casa de cemento y incrementar su negocio con mercadería.
texts.en:
Ruffo is 53 years old.  He has a small store in the back part of his house.  He lives in a periurban area in Fortín de Guayaquil, which is characterized by its earthen roads.

He  began to buy food supplies in order to sell them to his neighbors, little by little with effort and dedication he was able to buy sufficient merchandise to locate a small store in the back part of his house, which is made of cane.  Now he works from 9am until 8pm in his store with the help of his spouse and, occasionally, his 18 and 16 years old sons when they return from school.

In order to continue with his store, with the loan he wants to buy cement, blocks, and zinc to build a store from cement as it is currently difficult to protect his merchandise from the rain.  In the future he wants to build a cement house and grow his business with merchandise.

loans.use: To buy cement, blocks, and zinc

loans.name: Rateibeh

texts.en:
Ratiba is a mother of three sons and one daughter. Ratiba and her family live in Gaza strip in Rafah. Ratiba's sons and daughters are school and college students; her oldest son Muhammad is the only one who works and supports the family.

Ratiba's son Muhammad runs a perfume store selling perfume that he makes from oils and scents according to the customers' taste. Muhammad wants to buy new oils and scents as well as changing the shelves and the store layout. Rateibah came to FATEN and took the loan to help her son perform the changes he wants.

Muhammad appears in the picture here as Rateiba is a religious woman and doesn't want her picture online.

About this loan product:
 
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m

loans.use: To purchase shelves and showing stands for perfumes

loans.name: Paula Karina

texts.es:
Paula de 30 años, tiene una tienda de víveres en la ventana de su casa. Vive con sus dos hijos en una casa de caña en una zona periurbana en el Fortín de Guayaquil caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra. 

Hace 5 años atrás comenzó con la tienda pero cuando se separo de su esposo cerro la tienda pero hace ya 11 meses que volvió abrirlo ya que necesitaba dinero para poder mantener a sus hijos. Vende arroz, pollos, bebidas, dulces en su tienda. Trabaja en distintos horarios ya que está en la parte delantera de su casa. 

Para poder seguir con su tienda ella quiere comprar con el préstamo arroz, pollos bebidas para convertir su tienda. En el futuro quiere tener su casa de cemento e incrementar su negocio con mercadería.
texts.en:
Paula, who is 30 years old, runs a general store from the window of her house.  She lives with her two children in a house made of sugar cane stalks in El Fortín, a peri-urban area of Guayaquil known for its dirt roads.

She started the store five years ago, but when she separated from her husband, Paula closed it.  Eleven months ago she opened the store again because she needed money to support her children.  She sells rice, chicken, beverages and candies in her store.  Paula works on a varying schedule since the store is in the front part of her house.

Paula wants to use the loan to buy rice, chicken and beverages to stock her store.  In the future she wants to have a cement house and expand her business with more merchandise.

loans.use: Rice, chicken, beverages

loans.name: Faustino

texts.es:
El señor Faustino Otazú tiene 43 años de edad, es oriundo de la ciudad de Ybycuí, está casado con la señora Vicenta Cañiza con quien tiene 5 hijos.
  Con el correr de los años la producción de su negocio no fue del nada bueno, por esa razón sus hijos tuvieron que emigrar a otras tierras con el fin de enviar ayuda económica, después de un tiempo pudo acceder a comprar una vaca lechera con la cual empezó a vender leche a vecinos, después compró otra vaca hasta que llegó a 4 lecheras la cantidad de vacunos con los que cuenta ahora gracias a la ayuda de sus hijos y con eso ya le provee de leche a todo el barrio donde vive.
El crédito solicitado fue para la compra de una vaca lechera en oferta.
Agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya. El crédito otorgado ya que con ese dinero pudo comprar una vaca más.
texts.en:
Faustino Otazú is 43 years old.  He is a native of the city of Ybycuí, and he is married to Vicenta Cañiza.  They have five children.

With the passage of years, Faustino's business did not do well, and for this reason his children had to emigrate to other places in order to send money home.  After a while, Faustino was able to buy a dairy cow, and he began selling milk to his neighbors.  Later he bought another cow and eventually came to own four cows, thanks to the help of his children.  Now he provides milk for his entire neighborhood.

Faustino asked for the loan to buy a dairy cow on sale.  He is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the loan since he was able to buy another cow with it.

loans.use: Purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a young mother of three sons and five daughters. Her husband is a National Palestinian Authority employee. Fatima wanted to help her husband support their big family and also fill her free time when her children are in school, so Fatima started selling clothes almost a year ago in her house.

Fatima came to Kiva's partner, FATEN, and borrowed a loan to purchase a large amount of clothing to sell and increase the store's returns as she became well-known in the area and more women visited her house to buy kids' clothing.

The picture shows Fatima in her house.

About this loan product:
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m

loans.use: Purchase a large amount of kids' clothing to sell

loans.name: Johanna

texts.es: Johanna Estefani Drakett Drakett tiene 35 años de edad con una amplia motivación por la Repostería Caribeña, negocio que  fundo hace 6 años al recibir gran inspiración de su madre.  Invertirá su crédito en la compra de ingredientes necesarios para continuar con la tradición familiar, solicitando un total de ₡500.000(Quinientos mil colones) para expandir su negocio en ámbitos nacionales e internacionales. Ella es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal CrediFácil R. G S.A, una de las 100 empresas asociadas por EDESA.
texts.en:
Johanna Estefani Drakett Drakett is 35 years old and is very enthusiastic about La Repostería Caribeña (The Caribbean Bakery), a business her mother inspired her to start six years ago.  She will use the loan to buy necessary ingredients for continuing with the family tradition.  She is asking for a total of ₡500,000 (five hundred thousand colones) to expand her business on both a national and international level.

Johanna is a member of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal CrediFácil R.G S.A  (EasyCredit Communal Loan Company), one of EDESA's 100 partner associations.

loans.use: Supplies for her bakery

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
El señor Luis O. tiene 43 años de edad, es oriundo de la ciudad de Ybycuí, está casado con la señora Apolinaria Candia, con quien tiene dos hijos.
           El señor Luis O. cuando era más joven viajo al exterior   en busca de trabajo, allí trabajo como mozo en un restaurant, donde adquirió experiencia en el ramo de la preparación de comidas rápidas, a los dos años regresó al país se casó y junto con su esposa abrieron un pequeño copetín donde elaboran y venden comidas rápidas (empanadas, milanesas, etc.) actualmente tiene muy buenas ganancias  y posee clientela formada. Además se dedican a la venta de leche.
         En busca de ampliar su negocio y en consecuencia sus ganancias se acercaron a nuestra oficina con el fin de solicitar un crédito para poder ampliar su local.  Agradece a la fundación el crédito otorgado y espera brindarles a sus clientes mejor y mayor comodidad.
texts.en:
Señor Luis Ortizis 43 years old.  He is a native of the city of  Ybycuí, and he is married to Señora Apolinaria Candia, with whom he has two children.

When señor Luis Ortizis was younger, he travelled to other countries to look for work.  There he worked as a waiter in a restaurant, where he gained experience in the business of preparing fast food.  After two years he returned to the country, got married, and with his wife opened a small restaurant where they make and sell fast food (empanadas, milanesas, etc.).  Currently he has very good earnings and he has an established clientele.  Also they sell milk.

In order to grow his business and thereby his earnings, they came to our office to ask for a load to enlarge their location.  They are grateful to the foundation for the approved loan and hope to bring their clients more and better convenience.

loans.use: To enlarge Luis' business

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
Felicitas es socia del Bancomunal Suni, tiene 44 años, es soltera pero esta a cargo de su sobrina de 23 años quien actualmente esta estudiando, Felicitas se dedica a la venta de Verduras como son col, cebolla, lechuga, tomate estos productos los vende en el Mercado Nery García Zarate los días Jueves Viernes y Martes desde las 2 a.m hasta las 5 a.m. estos productos lo tiene que vender muy temprano ya que sus clientes son de la Selva y a esa hora hacen sus compras, ella para expender estos productos siembra y también los compra para poder revenderlo.
El préstamo que solicita lo va ha invertir en la compra de verduras.
Felicitas es socia de FINCA Perú desde el 2005 ella se siente muy agradecida ya que gracias a los préstamos, ahora es mayorista en la venta de verduras.
La dificultad  que tiene es que no tiene un carro propio para poder transportar las verduras. 
El sueño de Felicitas es poder comprar su carro para el transporte de las verduras.
texts.en:
Felicitas is a member of Bancommunal Suni.  She is 44 years old and is single, but she supports her 23 year old niece, who is currently studying.  Felicitas works selling vegetables like cabbage, onion, lettuce, tomatoes.  She sells these products in the market Nery García Zarate on Tuesdays, Fridays, and Thursdays from 2am until 5am.  She has to sell these products very early as her clients are from the jungle and this is the time they go shopping.  In order to sell these products, she grows some and also she buys some for resale.

The loan she is asking for will be invested in the purchase of vegetables.

Felicitas has been a member of FINCA Peru since 2005.  She feels very grateful that thanks to the loans she is now a wholesaler of vegetables.
The difficulty she has is that she does not have her own car to be able to transport the vegetables.  Felicitas' dream is to be able to buy her car to transport the vegetables.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables

loans.name: Gumercinda Josefina

texts.es: Gumercinda Josefina M. tiene 63 años de edad  con un gran entusiasmo por la venta de ropa con un estilo Polaco. Desea adquirir el crédito para invertir en la compra de prendas como ropa para dama y para niños, con la aspiración de que progrese su negocio. El préstamo que solicita es de ₡200.000 (Doscientos mil colones). Ella es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Credi Fácil R. G S.A, una de las 100 empresas asociadas por EDESA.
texts.en: Gumercinda Josefina M. is 63 years old with a lot of enthusiasm for the sale of clothing in the Polish style.  She wants to get this loan to invest in the purchase of items of clothing like women's  and children's clothes, with the aspiration of growing her business.  The loan that she is asking for is ₡200.000 (two hundred thousand colones).  She is a member of Empresa de Crédito Comunal Credi Fácil R. G S.A, one of the 100 businesses associated with EDESA.

loans.use: To purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Marvin

texts.es:
Marvin R. Solís es un hombre trabajador quien se dedica a la venta de Lotería y tiene una pequeña pulpería en su casa de habitación desde hace cuatro años. Ella inicio con la venta de chiverias actualmente vende granos básicos, carne, gaseosas etc. 
El invertirá el crédito en su dos negocios dando prioridad a la lotería por los sorteos de este tiempo.
texts.en:
Marvin R. Solís is a hard-working man who works selling lottery tickets and has had a small grocery store in his home for four years. He started out selling dairy products and he now sells basic grains, meat, sodas and other products.

He will invest this loan in his two businesses, giving higher priority to the lottery because of the drawings that happen in this season.

loans.use: Purchase basic grains and lottery tickets.

loans.name: Pedro Cesar

texts.es:
Pedro de 63 años, alquila parasoles para los turistas en la playa.  Vive en un cantón llamado Playas uno de los lugares turísticos del Ecuador con una diversa dimensión de mariscos.  

Hace 35 años su suegra murió y el comenzó administrar el negocio que ella tenía para que el trabajo familiar continúe.  Por la buena administración que ha hecho con el negocio lo conocen muy los turistas para alquilar parasoles. Trabaja desde las 06h00am hasta las 17h00 en la playa alquilando cada parasol a $ 5.00 incluido sillas, carpas a $ 5.00 según sea el tamaño. 

Para continuar con su negocio el quiere comprar con el préstamo parasoles, carpas, sillas para que sus clientes tengan más variedad. En el futuro quiere tener un local frente a la playa para darle un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Peter is 63 years old. He rents umbrellas to tourists on the beach. He lives in an area called “Beaches”, one of the tourist locations in Ecuador that has a large variety of shellfish.
It has been thirty-five years since his mother-in-law died and he started working in the business that she left behind in order to continue the family business. He effectively runs his business, so many tourist know where to go to rent umbrellas. He works from 6am until 5pm on the beach renting umbrellas for $5.00 including a chair. Tents rent for about $5.00, depending on their size. 
In order to continue with his business, he would like to buy, with this loan, umbrellas, tents, and chairs for his customers so that he will have a variety of products. In the future he would like to have a booth on the beach in order to provide better service to his customers.

loans.use: Umbrellas, tents and chairs

loans.name: Ervin Santiago

texts.es:
Ervin Santiago L. es un hombre trabajador, esforzado y emprendedor quien tiene un taller de calzado desde 1998. Este negocio lo inicio junto con su esposa con unos cuantos materiales actualmente cuenta con nueve colaboradores y una producción diaria de 118 pares de zapatos. 
L. comercializa sus productos en Masaya y Managua donde cuenta con clientes fijos. En estas fechas tiene un encargo que requiere de una gran inversión en materia prima como cuero, cuerina, hilos, pega, adornos, remaches, bonte, forro, hebilla, elástico etc.
texts.en:
Ervin Santiago L. is a hard-working and enterprising man who has had a shoe shop since 1998. He started this business with his wife with a small amount of materials. He now has new partners and makes 118 pairs of shoes a day.

Mr. L. sells his products in Masaya and Managua where he has regular customers. He now has an order that requires a large investment in raw materials such as leather, faux leather, thread, glue, adornments, nails, lining, buckles, elastic, etc.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials such as leather, glue, insoles, thread, nails, etc.

loans.name: Canal De Bendicion 4, 5 Group

texts.es:
Solenny es una de los miembros del Grupo Canal de Bendicion 4 y 5; grupo que en su mayoria son emigrantes haitianos que habitan en La ciudad de La Romana, cuya economía depende de la industria de Azucar y del turismo de alto lujo, Siendo unos de los destinos mas exclusivo de Republica Dominicana, en donde como muchas hay escasez de agua potable y de energía eléctrica y con una población de dominicanos y emigrantes haitianos. Sus actividades principales son las ventas de Ropa nueva. Solenny es una joven muy activa de apenas 22 años, actualmente es soltera y nos dice que su reto o desafío más difícil es poder terminar sus estudios y convertirse en una profesional; ella vive con sus padres. Disfruta mucho estudiar y hacer sus ventas, por la cual ha conocido muchas personas.

Solenny está muy emocionada de recibir su quinto préstamo en Esperanza Internacional, después de haber pagado satisfactoriamente sus préstamos anteriores y así haber dado un paso para el crecimiento de su negocio. Ella ha tenido su negocio por alrededor de 3 años, el cual inició vendiendo productos miscelaneos. Está planificando invertir su nuevo préstamo en la compra  de ropas nuevas, las cuales tienen una gran demanda en estos meses de Diciembre. Planea utilizar sus ganancias para reinvertir en su negocio y ahorrar para poder celebrar las fiestas de navidad junto a sus familiares, pero tambien poder cumplir sus sueños de tener una tienda de ropa y poder casarse.
texts.en:
Solenny is one of the members of the Canal de Bendicion 4 y 5 group, a group in which the majority are Haitian immigrants who live in the city of La Romana, where the economy depends on the sugar industry and on luxury tourism.  It is becoming one of the most exclusive destination in the Dominican Republic.  There is a scarcity of potable water and electricity, and it there is a population of people from the Dominican Republic and Haitian immigrants.  Their principle activity is new clothing sales.  Solenny is a very active young person, about 22 years old.  Currently she is single and tells us that her biggest challenge is to be able to finish her studies and become a professional.  She lives with her parents.  She really enjoys studying and selling, and in this manner has met many people.

Solenny is very excited to receive her fifth loan from Esperanza International after having satisfactorily repaid her previous loans and having taken steps towards growing her business.  She has had her business for about 3 years, when she began selling miscellaneous products.  She is planning to invest her new loan in the purchase of new clothes, which are in high demand in the month of December.  She plans to use her earnings to reinvest in her business and save in order to be able to celebrate Christmas with her family, but also to be able to complete her dreams of having a clothing store and to be able to get married.

loans.use: To buy pants, skirts, shirts, etc.

loans.name: Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
Es  un comité conformada por 11 mujeres, la compañía Lomai; todas estas mujeres han manifestado que es la primera vez que han escuchado de la Fundacion Paraguaya y admiraron el préstamo para mujeres, ellas se encuentran motivados por la oportunidad.
      La presidenta del Comté es la Sra. Justina B. y se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo familiar.
Ella es una señora muy trabajadora por que ademas de su negocio ella cuenta con crias de varios animales, como gallinas, cerdos,  vacas, todos para el consumo de la familia y otras para vender.
Comenta que el negocio es muy importante para ella ya que cubre todos los gastos de alimentacion de la familia y desea continuar con un negocion bien surtido y completo para sus clientes.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderias para su despensa como harina, fideos, azúcar, lácteos, panificados, y otros.

     Todas las integrantes del comité son trabajadoras  en su zona quienes se dedican a la agricultura agradecen a la fundacion Paraguaya la oportunidad que les da para ir creciendo.
texts.en:
Lomai Company is a group of eleven women. This is the first time this group has joined The Paraguayan Foundation. They were attracted to this organization’s loans to women. They decided to take advantage of this opportunity.
   The president of the committee is Mrs. Justina. She sells items that are commonly used by families. She is a hardworking woman. In addition to this business she raises young animals such as chickens, pigs and cows. Her family consumes some to the animals and she sells the rest.
She says that this business is very important to her as it covers the cost of feeding her family. 
She would like to have a good assortment of items in her store to sell to her customers. She is asking for this loan in order to buy merchandise for her store such as flour, noodles, sugar, milk products, bread and other items.
All of these members are part of a hardworking committee located in an agricultural zone of Paraguay. They are thankful to the Paraguayan Foundation, which provides them with the opportunity for future growth.

loans.use: She will buy flour, noodles, sugar, milk products, breads and other items.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 65 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposo José de 68 años y sus 2 hijas, además de 3 nietas a las que cuida gran parte del día. Cada día esta emprendedora mujer se despierta muy temprano para cuidar a sus nietas, pues su hija se dirige a trabajar a la ciudad, como comerciante de calzado. Durante los ratos que le quedan libres le dedica a la venta de productos de belleza de una reconocida marca, ella ofrece a sus amigas y conocidas mediante catálogos y dice que aunque sus ganancias son regulares le sirven apara ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar. Paralelamente a esta labor ella también es propietaria de un auto que brinda  en alquiler a un chofer para que lo emplee como taxi; y las rentas que recibe a diario le permiten ahorrar algún dinero y vivir con comodidad. Como es una mujer muy emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado comprar un vehiculo más para continuar en el negocio de alquiler de autos, pues sabe que se obtiene regulares ganancias. Es el segundo crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente como siempre ya que no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Rosa tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de algunos productos de belleza que se encuentran en stock; además desea mandar refaccionar el auto y comprarle llantas nuevas.
texts.en: Rosa is 65 years old, lives in her home with her husband José who is 68, their two daughters, and their three grandchildren who she takes care of most of the day. Everyday this hardworking woman wakes up very early to take care of her granddaughters since her daughter heads out to the city to work as a shoe seller. During her free time she sells well-known beauty products. She offers her friends and acquaintances products through catalogs and in spite of her earnings being ordinary they are sufficient enough to help her husband with household expenditures. Along with this job she also rents a car to a taxi driver. The daily rent she receives allows her to save up money and live comfortably. Since she is a diligent woman she plans to buy another vehicle in the future to continue renting and receiving regular payments. This is the second loan she has with MFP and promises to repay her monthly payments as punctual as always since she does not want to disappoint the people who helped pave the way to improve her life. Rosa plans to use the loan to buy more beauty products that are in stock as well as to repair her car and buy new tires.

loans.use: To buy beauty products, repair her car, and buy new tires.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa de 41 años, vive en el Fortín de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y lomas), ella tiene una tienda de víveres en donde vende legumbres, enlatados, canes etc. 

Ha venido trabajando para poder mantener a su hijo con una buena vida y pueda estudiar. Trabaja en la tienda desde las 08h00am hasta las 21h00pm todos los días. Su tienda está ubicada en la parte delantera de su casa de caña, vende bebidas, arroz, azúcar, enlatados, etc. Una de los problemas que tiene para atender la tienda es el polvo que genera la calle de tierra cuando pasan los carros. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar bebidas, enlatados para surtir más su tienda ya que quiere agrandarla. En el futuro quiere que su hijo termine sus estudios con éxito, y poder expandir su tienda en otros lugares.
texts.en:
Rosa is 41 years old, lives in Fortín de Guayaquil (a Peruvian zone with dirt roads and hills) and has a grocery store where she sells vegetables, canned goods, meats, etc.

She began working to raise her child in a suitable life so he would be able to study. She works in the store from 8:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m. everyday. Her store is located in the front of her cane home. She sells beverages, rice, sugar, canned goods, etc. Her biggest problem is the dust that builds up from the roads when vehicles pass by.

With the loan she plans to buy beverages and canned goods to supply her store since she wants to enlarge it. In the future she wants her son to successfully finish school and expand her store to other locations.

loans.use: To buy beverages and canned goods.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
El señor Pedro Z. tiene 39 años de edad, esta casado con la señora Juana Jara, juntos tienen 3 hijos ya todos mayores.
Se dedica a esta actividad hace más de 20 años,, empezó trabajando en una empresa de obras en Asunción, ya que no habiendo nada que hacer por la zona en donde el vivía, tuvo que salir de su ciudad natal para salir adelante, después de 10 años regreso a su ciudad natal, fue ahí donde le conoció a la que iba a ser su esposa, la señora Juana, inmediatamente ya se casaron y tuvieron hijos.  

Continuo con el oficio que había aprendido fuera de su ciudad, el  préstamo solicitado es para la compra una mezcladora ya que esa herramienta es imprescindible para éste trabajo.
Agradece mucho a la Fundación Paraguaya el crédito otorgado.
texts.en:
Mr. Pedro Z. is 39 years old, married to Mrs. Juana Jara, and together they have three grown children.

He has been working in his job for 20 years. He began working in a construction business in Asunción. Since no work was available in his hometown, he had to leave to find work to improve his living conditions. After 10 years he came back to his hometown. It is there that he would meet his future wife, Mrs. Juana. Immediately they married and had children.

He continues working in the job he obtained outside of his city. The requested loan will be used to buy a mixer since it is an essential tool for his specific job.

He is grateful for the Paraguay Foundation for granting him the loan.

loans.use: To buy a mixer.

loans.name: Román

texts.es:
El Señor Román P. es oriundo de la Compañía Rincón Guazú, trabaja en el negocio de la elaboración de ladrillos hace cuestión de 14 años, con el correr de los años el trapiche(aparato donde se mezclan el lodo para la fabricación de ladrillos), se  va desgastando  por lo que hace falta su refacción.

El Sr. Román P. en vista a que no disponía de recursos económicos para dicha refacción recurrió a la Fundación Paraguaya para la solicitud de un crédito.

Agradece a nuestra entidad el apoyo y la confianza depositada en él ya que con eso pudo arreglar su trapiche y el horno ademas de comprar leñas para seguir elaborando los ladrillos.
texts.en:
Mr. Román P. is a native of the city of Ybycuí of Compañía Rincón Guazú.  He has worked in the brick-making business for around 14 years. With the passing of time, the mill (the aparatus where the mud is mixed for making bricks), became worn out and needed to be refurbished.  

In light of the fact that Mr. P. did not have the economic resources for the refurbishment, he visited the Fundación Paraguaya to request a loan. 

He thanks Fundación Paraguaya for the support and the confidence given to him, because with this he was able to fix his mill and his oven. He also bought firewood to continue making bricks.

loans.use: Buy raw materials and refurbish oven

loans.name: Mujeres Triunfadoras 3 Group

texts.es:
Genoveva es una de los miembros del Grupo Mujeres triunfadoras 3; localizado en La ciudad de Puerto Plata, cuya economía depende de la industria del ron, del sector turístico e inmobiliaria, fue el primer destino turistico del República Dominicana y unas de las ciudades mas productora de azúcar, en donde como muchas hay escasez de agua potable y de energía eléctrica y con una población de dominicanos y emigrantes haitianos. Su negocio es las ventas de cosméticos, zapatos, accesorios y diversos productos miscelaneos especialmente para las mujeres. Genoveva es casada, y su familia esta compuesta por ella y su esposo. Nos dice que su reto o desafío más difícil ha sido siempre luchar duro para conseguir su sustento, nunca ha podido estar esperando por las cosas, siempre la ha salido a buscar ella. Disfruta mucho compartir con los demas.

Genoveva está muy emocionada de recibir su préstamo en Esperanza Internacional, después de haber recibido la invitacion de formar parte del grupo que habia en su comunidad, donde ha visto otras mujeres como ella muy trabajadora, conseguir por medio de los prestamo capital para sus negocios. Está planificando relanzar su negocio ya que por falta de capital lo habia cerrado y va a invertir este préstamo en la compra Productos de belleza, cosméticos, zapatos, algunas piezas de ropa, accesorios, etc. Planea utilizar sus ganancias para ahorrar y poder compartir los gastos de su vivienda con su esposo, de esta manera pueden apoyarse mutuamente y ayudar a algun familiar que los necesiten. Su sueño es tener tengo un negocio estable y poder estar tranquila esperando su vejez.
texts.en:
Genoveva is one of the members of the “Mujeres Triunfadores 3” (Triumphant Women 3) group which is located in the city of Puerto Plata, whose economy depends on the rum industry, the tourist industry and the real estate industry.  It was the top tourist destination in the Dominican Republic and one of the biggest producers of sugar.  As in many other cities, there is a scarcity of drinking water and electricity and a population of Dominicans and emigrant Haitians.

Genoveva's business is selling cosmetics, shoes, accessories and other miscellaneous products, especially for women.  She is married and her family comprises herself and her husband.  She tells us that her most difficult challenge has always been to fight hard to support herself.  She has never sat back and waited for things, she has always gone out in search of them.  She really enjoys sharing with others.

Genoveva is very excited to be receiving her loan from Esperanza Internacional after having received an invitation to form part of the group in her community.  Here she has seen other hard-working women like herself manage to use their loans to gain capital for their businesses.  She is planing to relaunch her business since she had shut it through lack of capital.  She will use this loan to invest in buying beauty products, cosmetics, shoes, some clothes, accessories, etc.  She plans to use the profits she makes to save and be able to share the household expenses with her husband.  In this way they can support each other and help any family member who should need it.   Her dream is to have a stable business and be able to relax as she waits for her old age.

loans.use: To buy various products such as perfume, purses, shoes, etc.

loans.name: Mario Isidro

texts.es:
Mario tiene la edad de 48 años, es un padre de familia de dos hijos, teniendo el apoyo de su esposa ya que trabaja en servicios domésticos.
Su trabajo hoy en día, es de cadete de Taxi, siendo el vehículo propio que compro con parte de su liquidación de su trabajo anterior como conductor de bus y un financiamiento que logro en un banco.
Lo que para él fue de gran beneficio, lograr tener su propio carro para tener mejores ingresos para apoyar  a sus hijos con los estudios.  Lo único es que por el alza de la gasolina los clientes no quieren pagar la carrera más cara y muchas veces se gana poco en el día.
Atreves del financiamiento que Afodenic está  dando podrá dar mantenimiento en general a su vehículo, en los frenos, dirección, compra de llantas entre otros. Lo que está contento por poder mejorar las condiciones del carro y dar un buen servicio al cliente, ya que por falta de capital no lo había logrado.
texts.en:
