Mario is 48 years old and has two children. His wife helps him with household expenses as she works as a maid.

Mario works as a taxi driver. He bought a vehicle of his own with some of the money from a settlement from his previous job as a bus driver and a loan from a bank. Having a vehicle of his own has brought many advantages; he earns more money to help his children with their education. One of his biggest problems is the rising price of gasoline. His customers do not want to pay for expensive journeys, and some days he earns very little money.

Because of the loan that Kiva partner Afodenic is giving him, Mario will be able to maintain the brakes and steering on his vehicle and buy new tires etc. He is pleased to be able now to improve the condition of his car and to provide his customers with good service.

loans.use: to maintain the brakes and steering on his taxi and buy new tires etc.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es: Esther, de 39 años, vive al lado de sus 3 hijos menores y de su madre, juntos se esfuerzan cada día por salir adelante. El día para esta laboriosa mujer empieza con los primeros rayos de luz, pues la venta de bebidas calientes, que es el oficio al que  se dedica no puede esperar. Desplaza  su modulo especial para esta labor hasta la esquina de una transitada avenida, y en ese lugar empieza a las 5 de la mañana con la venta de emoliente, quinua, ponche de habas, maca (bebidas energizantes), y su actividad se prolonga hasta las 11 de la mañana. Con el tiempo sus clientes le sugerían más opciones de productos comestibles, desde entonces ofrece diversos sanguches que complementan su exquisita propuesta.  En la tarde empieza otra vez con la venta de bebidas calientes, desde las 6 de la tarde hasta las 11 de la noche. A ella le gusta mucho su labor pues le genera regulares ganancias. Como es una mujer emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado ampliar su negocio, pues ya esta analizando vender también otro tipo de bebidas que sabe tendrán mucha acogida. Es el  primer  crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Esther tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de materiales (ladrillos, cementos entre otros) para terminar de construir un baño e instalar una cochera en su casa, y con el alquiler de esta pieza espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Esther is 39 years old.  She lives with her 3 dependent children and her mother.  Together they work hard every day to get ahead.  This hard-working woman's day begins with the first rays of light since her business is selling hot drinks and it can't wait.  She moves her special unit to the corner of a busy avenue and there she begins, at 5 in the morning, to sell 'emoliente' (a traditional, medicinal drink), 'quinua' (quinoa drink), 'ponche de habas' (hot drink made from bean flour, milk, water, sugar, vanilla, cloves, cinnamon), and 'maca' (similar drink but made with 'maca' – a native root vegetable).  The last two drinks are energizing drinks.  She finishes at 11 in the morning.

Over time, Esther's customers suggested she sell food products too.  Since then, she also offers different sandwiches.  In the afternoon, Esther begins selling her hot drinks again from 6 in the afternoon to 11 at night.  She likes her work a lot since it makes her regular income.  As she is an enterprising woman, in the future she plans to expand her business.  She is already looking at selling another type of drinks which she knows will be very popular.

This is Esther's first loan with MFP and she promises to make her repayments punctually as she doesn't want to disappoint the people who made this support possible since it will enable her to continue working in search of progress.  Esther is planning to invest her loan in buying materials (bricks and cement among other things) to finish building a bathroom and install a garage in her house.  By renting out the garage, she hopes to improve her income.

loans.use: To buy building materials to adapt her bathroom and build a garage which she will then rent out

loans.name: Frecia Claribel

texts.es:
Frecia de 54 años, vende productos naturales. Vive con sus dos hijos  en Primavera de Duran (zona periurbana, con una ecología en disolución a las afuera de Guayaquil). 

Su trabajo lo realiza recorriendo las calles y vendiendo sus productos por catalogo. Tiene una estrategia de dar a crédito los productos cuando no tienen sus clientes para cancelar al instante. Trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 16h00pm.Vende productos naturales Herbalife hechos con Noni, aloe, frutas. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar más mercadería como productos naturales hechos por frutas, noni, aloe para tener más variedad para sus clientes. En el futuro quiere tener un club de nutricionistas.
texts.en:
Frecia is 54 years old.  She sells natural products.  She lives with her two children in Primavera de Duran (peri-urban area with a deteriorating ecosystem on the outskirts of Guayaquil).

Her business is selling her catalog products door to door.  She has a strategy of providing credit when her customers don't have enough money to pay up front.  She works from 7.00am to 4.00pm.  She sells Herbalife natural products which are made with noni juice, aloe and fruit.

She will use her loan to buy more merchandise such as natural products made with fruits, noni extract and aloe so that she has more variety for her customers.  In the future she would like to own a nutritionists' club.

loans.use: To buy aloe and noni extract

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase goods to sell in the store

loans.name: Wilma

texts.es:
La  Sra. De Los Wilma es casada, tiene dos  hijos,   en edad escolar .
Ella  tiene una pequeña despensa  en el Barrio San Jose , cuya venta cada vez más está en ascenso, generándole un buen ingreso .

Con la ayuda de su esposo y toda la familia están  saliendo adelante con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo.
Hoy día ella es una microempresaria exitosa con una clientela fiel y numerosa, debido a su amabilidad.
Ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y honesta en sus compromisos por lo que se merece  el apoyo necesario. 
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de fideos, harina, azúcar, aceite, arroz, y otros.
texts.en: Ms. De Los Wilma is married and has two school-aged children. She has a despensa [small grocery store] in the San Jose neighborhood, which is consistently growing and bringing in good profits. With the help of her husband and her entire family, and with much effort and sacrifice, she is getting ahead. Today she is a successful small businesswoman who, thanks to her friendliness, has customers who are faithful and numerous. She has shown herself to be a responsible and honest person when it comes to her commitments, and therefore deserves the support she needs. She is requesting a loan to buy noodles, flour, sugar, oil, rice, and other products.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her small grocery store, such as flour, rice, noodles, sugar, and other items

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana, married with four children, all of whom are still living with her, resides in the Hato Mayor region of the Dominican Republic, located in the east of the country. Hato Mayor is a fairly mountainous region where the principal industry is agriculture. Ana's community, like nearly all impoverished areas in the Dominican Republic, suffers from a constant shortage of running water and electricity. As well as Dominicans, Haitian immigrants make up a large proportion of Ana's community.

Ana is a former member of the 'Nueva Esperanza' ('New Hope') 'solidarity bank' (group of borrowers). Because she now requires a larger amount, Ana is requesting an individual loan to buy additional stock for her two-year-old clothing business. She would also like to put a small portion of the loan into a savings account set up with Esperanza International, Kiva's field partner in the Dominican Republic and Haiti.

Ana is very excited about taking out another loan so that she can continue to grow her business. She says that previous loans have made it easier to support her children, and she hopes that will continue with this loan and future ones. Ana says she most enjoys spending time with her children and looking after her house.

loans.use: To invest in stock for her clothing business

loans.name: Sonrisa Group

texts.es:
El grupo Sonrisa está conformado por tres féminas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras una de ellas Ivania Mercedes Enríquez Cerda  en 1984 a la edad de 15 años estudio costura en sus inicios cosía en la máquina de su tía hasta que su cuñada le regalo una maquina actualmente cuenta con tres máquinas. Además de este negocio con los préstamos invirtió en cosméticos Avon marca reconocida por sus ventas vía catálogo. 

Ella invertirá el crédito en telas, hilos y aplicaciones para la realización de ropa para niñas que es en lo que se ha especializado y sueña con tener su tienda de ropa. Enríquez tiene dos hijos uno de 17 años y una de 20 años la cual está en la universidad.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son Rosa C. Zapata quien comercializa cosméticos desde hace año ½  y Ana Patricia R. López vende cosméticos Avon aproximadamente desde hace dos años.
texts.en:
The Sonrisa ["Smile"] Group is made up of three hard-working and enterprising women.  One of them is Ivania Mercedes Enríquez Cerda, who studied dressmaking in 1984, at the age of 15.  She started sewing on her aunt's sewing machine, until she received her own as a gift from her sister-in-law.  Now she has three sewing machines.

With the loans she has received, she has invested in her sewing business as well as in Avon brand cosmetics, which are known for their catalog sales.  She will use this loan to buy fabric, thread, and appliques for making clothing for girls, which is her specialty.  She dreams of having her own clothing store.  Ms. Enríquez has two children: a 17 year-old son and a 20 year-old daughter, who is enrolled in university.

The other group members are Rosa C. Zapata, who has sold cosmetics for a year and a half, and Ana Patricia R. López, who has sold Avon cosmetics for approximately two years.

loans.use: to buy fabric for making girls dresses

loans.name: Yroito

texts.es: Yroito tiene 39 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su esposa Carmen de 38 años y sus dos menores  hijos, que estudian en el colegio y  juntos se esfuerzan por salir adelante. Este trabajador hombre se dedica desde hace 3 años a brindar servicio de transporte en su motocarro, vehículo que es propio, dice que le gusta mucho esta actividad pues se entretiene bastante y tiene bastante acogida por la zona donde vive. Paralelamente a esta actividad también tiene un taller en su casa, donde fabrica piezas en cerámica al frío que son utilizados como adornos en las casas, dentro de este trabajo, su esposa le ayuda bastante cuando tiene pedidos grandes. Él se siente muy satisfecho, pues en ambos negocios obtiene regulares ganancias que le permiten ofrecerle a su familia una buena calidad de vida. Como es un hombre muy emprendedor para el futuro tiene planeado ampliar su taller para producir en mayor cantidad sus piezas y de esta manera espera obtener mejores ganancias. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente ya que no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Yroito tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de materiales para continuar con su negocio de fabricación de piezas de adornos y también quiere mandar a refaccionar su motocarro.
texts.en:
Yroito is 39 years old and lives in his own house at the side of his wife Carmen, 38 years of age, and his two young school-aged children.  Together, they struggle to get ahead.  This hard-working man has dedicated himself to providing transportation services for the past 3 years with a motocar that is his own.  He states that he enjoys this activity very much as it is entertaining and he has a lot of demand in the area where he lives.

Concurrently, he has a workshop in his house where he creates ceramic pieces to be used as home decorations.  His wife helps him with this work when he has large orders.  He feels very satisfied since both businesses allow him to earn a consistent income, allowing him to offer his family a good quality of life.  As he is a very entrepreneurial man, he has future plans to expand his workshop to produce a larger quantity of his pieces, and therefore further augment his earnings.  

This is his first loan with MFP and he commits to making his installment payments on time, as he doesn’t want to fall out of favor with the people that made possible the support that will allow him to continue to advance.  Yroito plans to invest the loan he is requesting into purchasing materials for his business making decorative pieces.  He would also like to send his motocar to be refurbished.

loans.use: To purchase materials for making his decorative ceramics, as well as to refurbish his vehicle.

loans.name: Lucero Group

texts.es:
El grupo Lucero está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras proveniente de Managua una de ellas es Aurora García de 33 años quien inicio hace 5 años con la compra una paca de ropa usada y con los préstamos y su labor su negocio fue creciendo e invirtió en una camioneta para comprar chatarra. Ella cuenta con el apoyo de su familia con los cuales ha podido salir adelante y poder proporcionarle una mejor calidad de vida a sus cuatro pequeños.

García invertirá el crédito en sus dos negocios con el firme propósito de salir adelante, por otra parte ella ha participado en tres capacitaciones en Adim la cual le ha ayudado mucho a trabajar.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son Marta L. inicio vendiendo ropa luego invirtió en variedades de productos como  platos y  perfumes y Oneyda de M. compra y venta de reciclaje la cual tiene poco tiempo como un año aproximadamente alquilando una camioneta y actualmente obtuvo la propia.
texts.en: Lucero group consists of three hard-working, determined and enterprising women from Managua. One of them, Aurora García, is 33 years old. She started five years ago by buying a selection of used clothing and with loans and hard work her business grew and she invested in a small truck to purchase merchandise. She counts on the support of her family with whom she has been able to succeed and provide a better quality of life for her four children. García will invest the loan in her two businesses with the intention of augmenting them. On the other hand she has participated in three trainings in Adim which has helped her work a lot. The other members of the group are Marta L., who began selling clothing and later invested in a variety of products like dishes and perfumes, and Oneyda de M. who buys and sells recycled goods and has been doing so for about a year using a rented truck and later her own.

loans.use: The purchase of merchandise like clothing as well as recycled goods.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
doña Maritza C. Z. tiene 47 años de edad esta casada con el señor Reyes Zepeda con quien tiene dos hijos que dependen de ambos, viven en la colonia Morazan de la ciudad de San Lorenzo desde hace 30 años, tiene casa propia en donde tiene su negocio, una pulperia y venta de golosinas.
En su negocio vende harina de maiz, manteca, aceite, granos basicos, refrescos y otros,  tambien vende tacos, tortillas con quesillo y enchiladas y otras golosinas.
el credito lo utilizara para invertirlo en su negocio ya que desea ampliarlo y comprar algunos productos que no tiene en existencia.

su mayor deseo es que su negocio crezca cada dia mas y asi lograr mejores resultados en sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Maritza C. Z. is 47 years old. She is married to Mr. Reyes Zepeda and they have two children who depend on both of them. They have lived in the Morazan neighborhood of the city of San Lorenzo for 30 years. They have their own home in which Maritza has her business, a grocery and sweets store. In her store she sells corn flour, butter, oil, basic grains, drinks and other products. She also sells tacos, tortillas with cheese, enchiladas and sweets.

Maritza will use the loan to invest in her business because she wants to expand it and buy some products that she doesn't currently have. She will purchase beans, rice, sugar, butter, oil, margarine, corn flour, break, cookies, drinks, milk, soap, eggs, toilet paper, cereal, oats, chili, sardines, juices, pills, candles, matches and water.

Her greatest wish is for her business to continue to grow more every day and thus to have better income.

loans.use: Purchase beans, rice, sugar and other products.

loans.name: Mujeres Alfreras Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres Alfareras está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras originarias de Managua, una de ellas Losgia María R. de 40 años desde 1999 se dedica al comercio de ropa usada la cual tiene la meta de tener un tramo con una gran variedad de ropa.. Ella inicio con una pequeña paca de ropa con la cual le dio la oportunidad de crecer y apoyar a sus cuatro hijos de los cuales tiene a su cargo los dos menores de 10 y 11 años. 

Las otras integrantes son Odilia María B. quien vende ropa usada desde hace 13 años y Francisca G. quien es distribuidora de cajetas de leche, de masa, de coco, piñonate, coyolito etc.  Las cuales van a vender a sus colaboradores. Ella invertirá en gran cantidad de producto por la época en especial por la purísima donde es costumbre dar este dulce tradicional como brindis en esta celebración.
texts.en: The Mujeres Alfareras group consists of three hard-working, determined and enterprising women from Managua. One of them is Losgia María R. who is 40 years old. Since 1999 she has sold used clothing with the goal of getting a small store with a large variety of clothing. She started with a small section of clothes which gave her the opportunity to take care of and support her four children, the younger two at 10 and 11 years old being in her direct care. The other group members are Odilia María B. who has sold used clothing for 13 years and Francisca G. who is a distributor of milk, dough, coconut, piñonate (a type of candied pastry), coyolito (dessert with banana, sugar and cinnamon) etc. which she will sell to her partners. She will invest in a large quantity of products to sell during the Catholic holiday celebrating the Immaculate Conception, during which time it's customary to give traditional candies to others as a celebratory gift.

loans.use: The purchase of merchandise for their store.

loans.name: Somos Impacto 2006 Group

texts.en:
Margarita is the president of the group "We are Impact 2006."  She has been the president for two years, but the group has successfully borrowed together for more than five years.
 
Margarita has a life partner and five children who range in age from 14 to 25. She has enjoyed knitting since high school and started her own handbag business a few years ago. She makes brightly colored woven bags that her customers typically use as purses.  

Up until this point, Margarita has taken orders for purses and sold them out of her home. With this loan, Margarita is hoping to hire someone to help her knit and increase her inventory so that she might sell her purses in a local market. She is very excited to expand the business that helps to support her family.

loans.use: To expand her handbag business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a piece of land

loans.name: Esmit Yasmani

texts.es: Esmit tiene 23 años,vive su casa cpm si esposa y su hijo el mismo que aún se encuentra en edad escolar el trabaja brindando el servicio de taxi, trabaja ya varios años brindando este servicio, el sueña con darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus seres queridos, tal es asi que el desea realizarle un mantenimiento a su unidad de trabajo para poder trabajar sin problema y tener mayores ingresos, se le brinda el crèdito por contar con buenas referencias personales.
texts.en: Esmit is 23 years old and lives at home with his wife and a child who is still of school age.  He works servicing taxicabs and has been doing it for several years.  He dreams of being able to offer his loved ones a better quality of life, so much so that he wishes to perform some maintenance to his working unit in order to be able to work without problems and obtain a bigger income.  He receives the loan because he counts on very good personal references.

loans.use: Maintenance and work tools

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy beauty products and cosmetics

loans.name: María Verónica

texts.es:
Maria de 37 años, ella da sus servicios como empleada domestica. Vive con en Primavera de Duran (zona periurbana, con una ecología en disolución a las afuera de Guayaquil). 

Para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos familiares ya que tiene dos hijas ella comenzó a trabajar como empleada domestica en distintas casa. Ya tiene tiempo trabajando como empleada en distintas casas por eso ahora ha optado que con un pequeño capital que tenia comprar perfumes y ropa para seguir dándole a sus hijas una mejor vida ya que ellas estudian en una escuela fiscal.  Para mejorar su casa ella quiere comprar con el préstamo cemento, bloques, empaste. 

En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa y que sus hijas terminen sus estudios con éxito.
texts.en:
María, aged 37, offers her services as a housekeeper. She lives in Primavera de Duran, a peri-urban marginalized area of Guayaquil with ecology on the brink of collapsing.

To help her husband with household expenses (they have two daughters), she began to work as a housekeeper in several households. She still has some time left over after her housekeeping assignments, which is why she decided to buy some perfume and clothes with a little capital, enabling a better life to her daughters who study at the public school. María wants to use her loan to buy cement, stone blocks and filling to improve her home.

In the future she wants to finish building her house and that her daughters complete their studies successfully.

loans.use: To buy cement and stone blocks

loans.name: Agustin

texts.es:
Don Agustin de 40 años de edad es soltero, tiene un niño en edad escolar, trabaja en el MINSA del Rama desde hace 17 años como auxiliar de enfermeria.

Esta solicitando su 6to credito para seguir mejorando su vivienda, esta vez levantando 2 paredes, pues tiene hecho los arranques; con el credito anterior logro embaldosar su casa que anteriormente era de tierra.  

Su mayor sueño es poco a poco ir mejorando su vivienda para poder brindarle a su familia mayor comodidad.
texts.en: Don Agustin, age 40, is single and has one school-aged child. He has worked in the MINSA del Rama for 17 years as a nurse's assistant. He is requesting his sixth loan to continue improving his home, this time raising 2 walls. He has the foundation; with his previous loan he was able to tile his house where there was previously dirt. His greatest dream is to improve his home bit by bit in order to be able to offer his family greater comfort.

loans.use: to raise walls

loans.name: Leila Maria

texts.es:
Doña Leila es una mujer de 52 años de edad.  Ella vive con su esposor y tiene dos hijos ambos son mayores de edad.  Su hija vive en la parte trasera de la casa con su esposo y sus hijos . Doña Leila  es una mujer ,muy trabajadora, responsable, honrada,con grandes metas para el futuro. Es el primer crédito que solicita desde que se dedica al comercio .     
Ella empezo a vender desde hace 20 años con un capital de 5,000.00 colones, los cuales fuerón prestados por su esposo y e con ese dinero compro 5 docenas de calcetas por motivo de que su esposo trabaja en construcción y se habia quedado sin trabajo y la solicitante tomo la decisión de ponerse a vender para seguir adelante y sacar su familia.
La clienta  solicita crédito para invertirlo en la compra de mercaderia como ropa,zapatos,perfumes, medias,y todo lo que pueda vender, Ella dice que es una actividad muy rentable ya que su clientela es fija y es desde hace 20 años. Este crédito servira para cubrir las necesidades por el mes de dicembre ya que es un mes bueno y se requiere bastante demanda 
Doña Leila dice que su meta es ver el negocio ya establecido en su casa y poner un bazar en varios sectores de coronada ya que por ese sitio casi no hay tiendas ni bazares
texts.en:
Ms. Leila is a 52-year old woman.  She lives with her husband, and has two grown children.  Her daughter lives in the rear portion of the house, with her husband and children.  Ms. Leila is a very hard-working, responsible, and honorable woman, with great goals for the future.  This is the first loan that she has requested since she dedicated herself to commerce.

She started in sales about 20 years ago, with working capital of 5,000 colones borrowed by her husband, with which she bought 5-dozen pairs of socks.  Her reason for doing this was that her husband worked in construction and had become unemployed; therefore she made the decision to go into sales in order to help the family get ahead.  

The client requests credit to invest into merchandise such as clothing, shoes, perfumes, socks, and everything she might be able to sell.  She states that it is a very profitable business because the customer base is solid, and has been for 20 years.  The loan will help her cover her needs for the month of December, as it is a good month with a lot of demand.  Ms. Leila says that her goal is to open several branches of her business in various sectors of Coronada, since in this area there are no stores or bazaars.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Wilberto

texts.es:
Wilberto de 27 años de edad es casado, labora como tornero para el Taller del Sr. Bismarck Campos desde hace 10 años. 

Esta solicitando  su 3er credito con el objetivo de legalizar el terreno que le dio su papá y al mismo tiempo comenzar los arranques para comenzar la construccion de su casita para brindar mayor comodidad a su familia.

Su mayor sueño es poder tener su casa con las condiciones necesarias para su familia.
texts.en: Wilberto, 27, is married and has worked as a lathe operator for the Sr. Bismarck Campos Workshop for 10 years. He is asking for his third loan in order to legalize the land his father gave him and also to begin construction on his house and bring greater comfort to his family. His dream is to be able to have a home that is well-equipped for his family.

loans.use: legalize land and begin construction on his home

loans.name: Minkailu

texts.en:
This is 35 year-old Minkailu B.. He is married, and has four children aged 5, 8, 10 and 12  years. He has eight additional dependents who live with him because they are his relatives and they need him to assist them with their education. They also help in the business.  

In 1995, Minkailu established his plastic slippers business because he believed the business would improve his family's standard of living. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about 800000 SLL every month from this business. 

He needs a loan of 4500000 SLL in order to buy additional stock for the business. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 1200000 SLL. 

In the future, Minkailu plans to sell wholesale to supply other traders. He also hopes to continue to educate his children to the university level. He is serious and determined. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more plastic slippers for resale

loans.name: Piedra Preciosa Group

texts.es:
El grupo Piedra Preciosa está conformado por tres féminas trabajadoras una de ellas es Ana S. de 50 años quien tiene una pequeña y modesta venta desde hace seis años la cual gracias a los préstamos y su arduo trabajo ha ido creciendo actualmente tiene una tienda bien surtida. Ella es madre de cinco hijos de los cuales uno de ellos es menor de edad de 10 años. 
S. invertirá el crédito  en granos básicos, carne, chiverías, pan, huevos etc.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son Yesenia Cosea S. 28 años desde hace cinco años vende comida y Magda F. vende leña desde hace 7 años.
texts.en: The group Piedra Preciosa (“Precious Stone”) is comprised of three hard-working women.  One of them is Ana S., 50 years of age, who has had a small and modest store for 6 years.  Her business, thanks to the loans and her hard work, has been growing and she currently has a well-stocked store.  She is the mother of five children, one of whom is still a 10-year old minor.  S. will invest the loan into buying basic necessities such as meat, bread, eggs, etc.  The other members of the group are Yesenia Cosea S., 28 years of age, who for the past 5 years has been selling food, and Magda F. who has sold wood for the past 7 years.

loans.use: To purchase basic necessities such as meat, bread, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Tables, chairs, and supplies.

loans.name: Armonia Ii Group

texts.es:
El grupo Armonía II está conformado por cinco personas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedora una de ellos es la señora Martha Lorena Dávila Rodríguez ella hace 27 años que trabaja realizando bebidas típicas de pozol, semilla de jícaro y vende chatarra de los cuales hace 7 años que reside en Managua. Ella sueña con mejorar su casa.
Rodríguez de 47 años madre de seis hijos invertirá el crédito en chatarra y verduras para seguir creciendo y mejorando.    
Las otras integrantes del grupo son Adelia de los Ángeles L. Ortiz de 20 años se dedica al comercio de prendas de plata; Claudia Vanessa F. Rodríguez se dedica al comercio de frijoles cocidos y leña; Debora Rebeca Godíne tiene una tortillería y vende frijoles cocidos y Alfredo Mauricio R. venta de nacatamales y sopas los fines de semanas.
texts.en:
The Armonia II group has five members, all determined, hard-working and entrepreneurial.  Martha Lorena D. Rodriguez is one of the group's members.  She has operated a business making and selling food and drink--pozol (a traditional drink made with cacao and maize), jicaro seeds and snacks--since she moved to Managua 7 years ago.  She wants to make improvements to her house.
Rodriguez, 47, has six children.  She will use her share of the loan to buy snacks and vegetables to stock her business.  The other members of the group are: Adelia de los Angeles Lopez Ortiz, 20, who operates a business selling silver pieces; Claudia Vanessa F. Rodriguez, who operates a business making and selling frijoles and firewood; Deborah Rebeca G., who makes and sells tortillas and frijoles; and Alfredo Mauricio R., who makes and sells nacatamales and soups on the weekends.

loans.use: Buy merchandise to resell.

loans.name: Angel Group

texts.es:
MarceL. es socia del bancomunal angel, que inicia su 4to ciclo con 10 scoias. MarceL. tiene 29 años, es madre D. 4 hijos, L. mayor tiene 12 años y L. ultima 5 años; elL. se dedica a L. venta D. ropas como casacas, pantalones, polos y chompas, este negocio lo viene realizando desD. hace 4 meses en el centro comercial Mariscal Cáceres en un Stand que es propio, este stand lo consiguió con L. ayuda D. sus amiga ya que le hizo un traspaso del Stand.
Antes D. realizar este negocio, MarceL. se dedicaba a L. venta D. salchipollo, L. única dificultad que elL. tiene es L. poca mercadería ya que es reciente el negocio.
El préstamo que solicita lo va emplear en L. compra D. ropas D. L. estacion como pantalones y casacas.
MarceL. es socia D. FINCA Perú desD. hace 4 ciclos y lo que más le gusta D. las reuniones D. su banco comunal son las capacitaciones por que gracias a ello aprenD. más. L. meta D. MarceL. como Presidenta en este ciclo,  es que las socias sean mas cumplidas en sus pagos y en sus asistencias.
texts.en:
MarceL. is a member of the Angel community bank.  The bank is starting its 4th round with 10 members.  MarceL., 29, has 4 children who range in age from 5- to 12-years old.  She has operated a business selling clothing--jackets, trousers, shirts and sweaters--for 4 months, selling from her own stand in the Mariscal Caceres market.  She got the stand from a friend who leased it to her.  
MarceL. used to earn a living making and selling "salchipollo" (a traditional dish).  The main obstacle for her now is that she doesn't have enough merchandise to stock her clothing business because it's just getting off the ground.  
MarcelL. will use this loan to buy seasonal clothing.  Trousers and jackets, for example.  MarceL. has been a member of FINCA Peru for all 4 rounds and what she most likes about the meetings are the skills that she's learned.  Her goal, as president of the group for this round, is for all the members to be up to date with both their payments and attendance.

loans.use: compra de ropa de la estación

loans.name: Luz Y Amor Group

texts.es:
El grupo Luz y Amor está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es Jenny Gómez de 29 años quien vende ropa y cosméticos hace más de 5 años. Ella tiene cuatro hijos pequeños que estudian es por ello que el crédito lo invertirá en mercadería como perfumes, cremas, camisas, blusas, pantalones y lápiz labial etc.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son Norma E. vende perfumes y ropa y Silvia Rosa H. hace nacatamales y frito hace más de diez años.
texts.en:
The "Luz y Amor" [light and love] group is made up of three hard-working women. One of the members, Jenny Gómez, is 29 years old and has sold clothing and cosmetics for 5 years. She has four small children who are all in school. For this reason she is taking out this loan to invest in merchandise such as perfumes, creams, shirts, blouses, pants, lipstick, etc.

The other members of the group are Norma E., who sells perfumes and clothing, and Silvia Rosa H., who has made tamales and fried food for ten years.

loans.use: Purchase clothing and cosmetics

loans.name: José Ramos

texts.es:
José tiene 26 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene carga familiar, vive en casa de sus padres, ubicada en la Campiña Chacupe Bajo, una zona agrícola del distrito de La Victoria, se encuentra situada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo

José se dedica a la siembra de verduras, tubérculos y otros productos de panllevar, el ya tiene años de experiencia en este rubro, por lo que maneja muy bien las labores de su oficio, estos sembríos los cultiva en las tierras de su padre. Además el cliente se dedica a la prestar servicio de faenas agrícolas a los diferentes agricultores de la zona. 

José ha solicitado un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar insecticidas y abonos los cuales aplicará en sus cultivos, asegurándose una buena producción, en la actualidad tiene instalados  1,0 ha de camote y 0.25 ha de culantro.

El es una persona bastante conocida y estimada en la zona, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como agricultor y adquirir su propio terreno de cultivo.
texts.en:
José is a 26 years old bachelor who lives with his parents in Campiña Chacupe Bajo.  This is an agricultural area in La Victoria which is 20 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

José grows vegetables, roots and other crops.  He has years of experience and is very adept at what he does, and uses his father's farmland to grow his produce.  He also lends his agricultural services to other farmers in the area.

José is requesting a loan of 1000 PEN to buy insecticide and fertilizer which he will use to ensure optimum output of of his current crop of 1.5 acres of sweet potato and 0.62 acres of coriander.

He is a well-known and respected person in his area and his greatest hope is to continue developing his farming experience and eventually owning his own cropland.

loans.use: To purchase insecticides and fertilizer for crop growing and maintenance.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es socia del  Banco Comunal “Micaela Bastidas”, ubicado en el distrito D. Ilave, provincia D. el Collao, Departamento D. Puno, tiene 61 años D. edad, es viuda y tiene cuatro hijos.  Solo pudo estudiar la primaria.
Juana está trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace ocho años, el primer préstamo solicitado fue D. S/.300. 00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio D. venta D. cuero D. alpaca.
La señora solicitará un nuevo crédito D. S/ 1200.00 nuevo soles, éste dinero lo invertirá en su negocio y comprará más insumos. 
Su sueño  es seguir adelante con su negocio.
Lo  que le gusta del Banco Comunal  es la facilidad D. los préstamos.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the communal Bank "Micaela Bastidas", located in the district of Ilave, province of El Collao, department of Puno. She is 61 years old, widowed and the mother of four children. She could only attend elementary school.

Juana has been working with the microfinance institution Movimiento Manuela Ramos for eight years. Her first loan amounting to 300 nuevos soles was invested in her business selling alpaca leather. She applies for a new loan of 1200 nuevos soles which she will invest in her business and buy more supplies. Her dream is to go ahead with her business.

What she likes about the communal bank is the simplicity of the loan process.

loans.use: To buy alpaca leather

loans.name: Modesta

texts.es:
Modesta es socia del Bancomunal Nueva Vida, es conviviente 23 años, es madre de 5 hijos, la mayor tiene 22 años y la ultima 3 años; se dedica a la venta de frutas al por mayor como son plátano, yuca, nony y carambola, trabaja en el mercado Basilio Auqui este negocio lo viene realizando desde hace 10 años.
La dificultad que se le presenta es cuando se le malogran las frutas, y cuando la venta baja, porque la mercaderia se le queda y se malogra.
Modesta se siente feliz de ser socia de Finca Perú por que gracias a ello se capacita y aprende más. El sueño de Modesta es que sus hijos sean profesionales y poder aumentar su capital para poder tener más productos.
texts.en:
Modesta is a member of the Nueva Vida Communal Bank.  She has been in a common law union for 23 years and has five children, ages 22 through three years old.  

She has worked in the Basilio Auqui market for ten years where she sells banana, yuca, nony and carambola wholesale.  Her main problem arises when the fruit goes bad due to slow sales.  Modesta is happy to be a member of Finca Perú because she feels she has gained empowerment and can continue learning more and more.  Modesta's dream is to provide professional training for her children and to increase her capital in order to acquire more products.

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Esmeralda Del Socorro

texts.es:
Esmeralda de 37 años de edad es soltera, tiene un hijo, labora para la Alcaldia de Juigalpa en el area de atencion al contribuyente desde hace 9 años. 

Esta solicitando  su 8vo credito con el objetivo de reparar su casita cambiandole el techo que se encuentra en mal estado. 

Su mayor sueño es poder ir mejorando poco a poco su vivienda y brindarle a su familia las condiciones necesarias y que su hijo estudie y llegue a ser una persona de bien.
texts.en:
Esmeralda, 37, is single and has one child.  She has worked for the town of Juigalpa in the area of taxpayer assistance for 9 years. 

She is requesting her 8th loan, which she will use to repair her small house by replacing the roof, which is in bad condition.

Her main dream is to be able to gradually improve her house and provide her family with good living conditions.  She also dreams that her son will study and grow up to become a good person.

loans.use: to repair her roof

loans.name: Edilberto

texts.es:
Edilberto es un padre de familia de 29 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el caserío Sandial, una zona agrícola que pertenece al distrito de Pítipo, ubicado en la provincia de Ferreñafe, a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado vacuno para engorde, el compra ganado a sus vecinos y los alimenta para luego ofrecerlos en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde vive. Con los ingresos que le brinda esta actividad el se encarga de solventar los gastos de su familia.

Edilberto desea adquirir alimento balanceado para poder mejorar el desarrollo de sus animales y venderlos a mejor precio. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles con los cuales planea lograr su objetivo.

El es una persona bastante responsable y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Las personas que le conocen le consideran alguien tranquilo y confiable.
texts.en:
Edilberto is a 29 year old father who lives with his wife and children in Sandial village, an agricultural area belonging to the district of Pitipo in the Ferreñafe province, about an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

His activity focuses on feeding and raising his neighbors' cattle, which he then sells to businessmen visiting the area. This allows him to provide an income for family expenses.

Edilberto would like to buy balanced diet feed to improve his cattle's development in order to obtain a better sale price.  He has requested a loan of 1500 PEN from Edpyme Alternative in order to reach his goal.

He is a responsible, ambitious person interested in improving his situation.  People who know him consider him to be a calm, dependable person.

loans.use: To purchase balanced diet feed to improve cattle raising and sales.

loans.name: 8 De Enero Group

texts.es:
El grupo 8 de enero está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras una de ellas es Suyen del Carmen A. Áreas de 25 años tiene una tortillería desde hace cinco años y destaza cerdo. Ella trabaja junto con su madre en ambos negocios la cual es de gran ayuda principalmente para sustentar a sus cuatro pequeños a los cuales desea darles una mejor calidad de vida. 

Las otras integrantes del grupo son Karla M. Aragón de 30 años comercializa cosméticos desde hace un año y Gricelda Maudalena R. Solórzano de 24 años tiene una pequeña venta y vende sopa.
texts.en:
The "8 de enero" ["January 8"] group is made of of three hard-working, determined and enterprising people. One of them is Suyen del Carmen A. Áreas, who is 25 years old. She has operated a tortilla business for five years, and she also butchers pigs. She works together with her mother in both businesses, which is a great help to her, above all in supporting her four little children, for whom she would like to provide a better quality of life. 

The other members of the group are Karla M. Aragon, age 30, who has sold cosmetics for one year, and Griselda Maudalena R. Solórzano, age 24, who has a small sales stand and sells soup.

loans.use: Buying corn and firewood

loans.name: Ismael

texts.en:
Ismael is a 50-year-old man from Palestine, a father of four sons and two daughters. Ismael owns a sweets shop where he makes local sweets out of Semolina dough, cheese and sugar, such as Kunafa. Ismael started his shop three years ago.

Ismael wanted to double his production due to an increase in demand and business prosperity, so he came to FATEN and took a loan to purchase sugar, coconut, nuts, cheese and fat. Ismael has long experience making local sweets and has a good number of clients.

Ismael appears in the picture here in his shop.

About this loan product:

FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for sweets

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
Angélica es socia del Bancomunal Nueva Vida, tiene 37 años, es madre de 2 hijos, el mayor tiene 14 años y el ultimo tiene 2 años y medio.
Angélica posee una farmacia (Farmacia Mateo) este negocio ya tiene 3 años de antigüedad ella menciona que la única dificultad es que no tiene todas las medicinas que le piden sus clientes pero por lo demás le va muy bien.
El préstamo que solicita lo va a emplear en la compra de medicinas que le faltan; el sueño de Angélica es que pueda aumentar mas productos para así poder satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, también desea abrir otro tipo de negocio como es una ferretería.
A Angélica le gusta las reuniones de su bancomunal por que le enseñaron a ahorrar y por que las capacitaciones que recibe son muy dinámicas.
texts.en:
Angélica is a member of the Nueva Vida ["New Life"] communal bank. She is 37 years old and the mother of 2 children; the older one is 14 and the younger is two and a half. 

Angélica runs a pharmacy (Farmacia Mateo). The business is three years old, and she mentions that the only difficulty is that she does not have all of the medicines that her customers request, but otherwise it is going very well for her. 

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy medicines that she does not have. Angélica's dream is to be able to expand her product offerings in order to satisfy her customers' demands. She would also like to open another type of business, such as a hardware store. 

Angélica enjoys the meetings of her communal bank, because the members learn how to save, and because the training sessions they receive are very dynamic.

loans.use: Buying medicines

loans.name: Miriam Nicolasa

texts.es:
Miriam de 46 años de edad es soltera, labora para el MINED-Acoyapa desde hace 14 años como docente de primaria. Habita en su casita junto a sus 5 nietos a los cuales cuida mientras los papas trabajan fuera.  

Esta solicitando  su 7mo credito con el objetivo de terminar de cercar su propiedad con malla y poder instalar el servicio de agua potable en su casa, pues actualmente no cuenta con el. 

Su mayor sueño es poder brindarle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida y que sus nietos estudien y sean personas de bien que saquen adelante a nuestro pais.
texts.en:
Miriam, 46, is single and has worked as an Elementary School Teacher for the Ministry of Education-Acoyapa for 14 years.  She lives in her little house with her five grandchildren who she cares for while their parents work elsewhere.

She is requesting her 7th loan to finish fencing in her property with wire mesh and to be able to install potable water service to her house; she currently does not have it.

Her greatest wish is to provide her family with better living conditions and that her grandchildren go to school and become upstanding citizens who will help our country get ahead.

loans.use: To fence in the property and install electricty and running water.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis alberto es un padre de familia que reside junto a su esposa y a su pequeña hija en el caserío San Isidro del distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, a mas de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de ovejas, el cría estos animales en algunos ambientes ubicados cerca a su domicilio y las alimenta de pastos naturales. Cuando estas ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que visitan la zona y a sus propios vecinos. Adicionalmente se dedica a la agricultura, tiene un pequeño terreno de cultivo en donde suele sembrar limón.

Luis desea adquirir mas ovejas y alimento balanceado para ampliar su negocio y percibir mayores ingresos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar  a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles. Luis es una persona bastante tranquila y responsable. Las personas que le conocen le consideran alguien trabajador y honesto.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto is a father, living with his wife and small daughter in the San Isidro housing development, Tambogrande district.  This is a farming area located in the Piura province, Piura region, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region.

He raises and sells sheep, keeping the animals in places located near his home, and feeding them with natural grasses.  When the sheep are well developed, he offers them for sale to traders who visit that area, and to his own neighbors.  He also farms, and has a small plot where he usually plants lemon.

Luis wants to have more sheep and balanced feed to expand his business and bring in more money, and for this reason he has found it advantageous to request a loan of 1,000 new soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  Luis is a calm, reliable person.  Those who know him consider him to be hard-working and honest.

loans.use: To purchase sheep and balanced feed to expand his business (raising and selling sheep).

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
Dolores es socia del bancomunal Nueva Vida, tiene 56 años, tiene un matrimonio D. 39 años, tiene 7 hijos, el mayor tiene 32 años y el ultimo tiene 12 años que actualmente esta estudiando.
Dolores se dedica a la venta al por mayor D. frutas como son naranja, plátano, piña, papaya, mango, etc. La dificultad que ella tiene es cuando bajan las ventas.
El préstamo que obtuvo lo va emplear en la compra D. frutas al por mayor como son mango y plátanos.
Dolores esta contenta con las capacitaciones que recibe en las reuniones D. su bancomunal ya que gracias a ello aprenD. mas. El sueño D. Dolores es poder tener más capital.
texts.en:
Dolores is a member of the Communal Bank “Nueva Vida” (New Life). She is 56 years old and has been married for 39 years. Dolores has seven children. The oldest is 32 years old while the youngest is 12 years old and currently studying.

She encounters difficulty whenever her sales decline. The loan she received will be used to buy fruit in bulk such as mangoes and bananas. Dolores is pleased with the training she received at her Communal Bank meetings. She is grateful because she has learned a lot. Her dream is to have more capital.

loans.use: Purchase mangoes & bananas

loans.name: Mercy Del Rocio

texts.es:
Mercy de 43 años, reparte almuerzos a una clientela fija de trabajadores y tiene su pequeño restaurante. Vive con en Primavera de Duran (zona periurbana, con una ecología en disolución a las afuera de Guayaquil). 

Siempre le gusto cocinar a Mercy por eso eligió esta actividad para poder mantener a sus hijos. Se levanta en la mañana para hacer el almuerzo en su casa y poderlo repartir, ella hace distintos platos en su cocina y los vende en su restaurante, tambien los reparte a distinta clientela. Cada almuerzo contiene sopa, segundo (plato fuerte) y el jugo todo esto a $ 1.50. Reparte los almuerzos a una lista de clientes que trabajan. 

Ella quiere construir mejor su casa por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo cemento, empaste, bloques y asi asegurar su vivienda. En el futuro quiere tener un restaurante bien definido.
texts.en:
Mercy, age 43, manages a small restaurant where she serves lunches to an established clientele of workers. She lives in Primavera de Duran, a periurban area outside of Guayaquil with a deteriorating ecosystem.

Mercy has always enjoyed cooking, so she chose this line of work to support her children. She wakes up in the morning to prepare lunches in her home so that she can deliver them. Mercy prepares various dishes in her kitchen and then sells them at her restaurant. She also delivers lunches to different customers. Each meal consists of soup, an entrée, and juice for $1.50. She has a list of customers for whom she delivers lunches to their workplace.

Mercy wants to make improvements to her house, so she will use this loan to buy cement, mortar, and blocks to make her home secure. In the future she hopes to have a well-defined restaurant.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials for making home improvements

loans.name: Cristina Alicia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “LOS LIDERES ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Cristina; La socia tiene 21 años de edad, ella es soltera; la socia trabaja en una mueblería de madera, ella tiene un taller de fabricación de muebles en el barrio de Santiago y se dedica a dar los acabados finales de los muebles, barnizar, entornillas, poner manijas, pulir, y vender al cliente final. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar manijas y barniz para sus siguientes trabajitos. También quiere comprar lijar y pagar del alquiler del ambiente que utilizar para ofrecer los muebles. La socia solicita el préstamo para pagar del alquiler de su negocio y para la compra de manijas.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Cristina is a member of the Communal Bank “Los Lideres” (The Leaders), which is located in the District of Huanchac, Province and Department of Cusco.

She is 21 years old and single. Cristina works at a furniture store and also has a workshop in the neighborhood of Santiago where she makes furniture out of wood. She is also in charge of adding the finishing touches to the furniture such as varnish, screws, handles, and polish before selling them to the customer. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy handles and varnish needed to continue with her work. In addition, she will buy sandpaper and pay for the rental space that she uses to sell furniture.

Cristina is grateful and values the loan that has been provided. Therefore, she promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

loans.use: Purchase supplies & pay the rent on her vending space

loans.name: Rios De Agua Viva Group

texts.es:
La señora Sabina (de camisa morada y a rallas) es la presidenta del grupo “Ríos de Agua Viva” cuyo nombre significa "Living Waters."  Escogieron este nombre porque algunos miembros del grupo son cristianos evangélicos.
Sabina tiene 48 años y está casada con diez hijos.  Vende "salchipapas" (hotdogs con papas) en una esquinita por la tarde.  Lleva dos años vendiendo sus ricas salchipapas y todo va bien con el negocio, además  para aumentar  a sus ingresos ha comprado unos chanchos con este préstamo.  Los está criando para vender durante la temporada navideña, luego en enero, tiene planes de comprar unos chanchitos más para criarlos y más tarde, venderlos.
texts.en:
Sra. Sabina (wearing a purple striped shirt) is president of the group “Ríos de Agua Viva” which means “Rivers of Living Water”. This name was selected because some of the group members are evangelical Christians.

Sabina is 48 years old, married, and has ten children. She sells “salchipapas” (hot dogs and potatoes) on a street corner in the afternoons. Sabina has been selling her rich foods for two years and has done well with her business. To increase her income, she plans to buy a few pigs with this loan. She will raise and sell them during the holiday season. In January she plans to buy mO. piglets to raise for later resale.

loans.use: Acquire pigs to raise for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase iron, galvanized tubing, electrodes, and paint

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy lumber (raw material).

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “LOS LIDERES ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito D. Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Carmen; La socia tiene 58 años D. edad, ella es casada; la socia tiene 5 hijos; la socia trabaja vendiendo ropa D. cama, ella compra al por mayor D. las fábricas en la ciudad D. Lima y las trae a Cusco para la venta al por menor, la socia venD. D. forma ambulante ella ofrece a las instituciones y a sus amigas luego a las amigas y compañeras D. trabajo D. estas y así logra vender su producto, la socia desea a provechar esta temporada para viajar y traer con motivos naviD.ños una nueva colección D. invierno y navidad. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. ropa D. cama parea esta nueva temporada.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "LOS LIDERES" communal bank.  The communal bank is located in the Huanchac district which belongs to the Cusco province and department.

Mrs. Carmen is 58 years old, married and has five children.  She buys wholesale bed linen products from factories in Lima and then sells them retail in Cusco.  Her work consists of door-to-door sales to institutions, friends and colleagues.  She wants to take advantage of the season and bring new products for the winter and Christmas season.  She is applying for a loan to buy bed linens for the new season.

This member expresses her gratituD. for the loan and is committed to paying her monthly quotas as required.

loans.use: This member is requesting a loan for the purchase of bed linens for this new season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy American rice, oil, beans and sugar

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Triunfadoras” , ubicado en el distrito Cabanilla,  provincia de Lampa y departamento de Puno, tiene 65 años de edad, es  viuda y no tiene hijos,  la señora  no cuenta con estudios.

Viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela R. desde hace 04 años,  su  préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que  le sirvió para  incrementar el capital de  su negocio de venta de ganados.

La señora solicitará un nuevo crédito por la suma de S/. 2000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá en la compra de más ganado.

Su sueño para el futuro  es mejorar sus ganados y así obtener mejores ganancias.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the “Mujeres Triunfadoras” (Triumphant Women) community bank which is located in Cabanilla district, in Lampa province, in the department of Puno.  She is 65 years old, widowed and doesn't have any children.  She did not receive any schooling.

Juana has been working with Movimiento Manuela R. for 4 years.  Her original loan was for 300 nuevos soles which she used to increase the working capital of her business selling livestock.

She is requesting a new loan for 2,000 nuevos soles which she will invest in buying more livestock.

Juana's dream for the future is to improve her livestock and thereby obtain better profits.

What she most likes about her community bank are the savings.

loans.use: To buy livestock

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Triunfadoras”  ubicado en el distrito Cabanilla,  provincia de Lampa y departamento de Puno, tiene 38 años de edad, de estado civil  soltera y no tiene hijos,  la señora  estudió hasta 3ro de educación secundaria.

Viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela R.  desde hace 03 años,  nos cuenta que su  préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que  le sirvió para  incrementar el capital de  su negocio de venta de abarrotes.

La señora solicitará un nuevo crédito por la suma de S/. 350.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá en la compra de mercaderías de su negocio.

Su sueño para el futuro es tener una casa propia.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las reuniones y la facilidad de los préstamos.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the “Mujeres Triunfadoras” (Triumphant Women) community bank which is located in Cabanilla district, in Lampa province, in the department of Puno.  She is 38 years old, single, and doesn't have any children.  She studied up to the third year of high school.

Juana has been working with Movimiento Manuela R. for 3 years.  She tells us that her original loan was for 300 nuevos soles and she used it to increase the working capital of her grocery-selling business.

She is requesting a new loan for 350 nuevos soles to invest in buying merchandise for her business.

Hr dream for the future is to own her own home.

What she most likes about her community bank are the meetings and the ease of obtaining a loan.

loans.use: To buy groceries such as rice, sugar, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Raheefa

texts.en:
Raheefa is a mother of one daughter and seven sons and is married to Muhammad, who owns an auto repair workshop. Muhammad also works as a Palestinian National Authority employee. He started his workshop nine years ago.

The workshop is in a good location which attracts a lot of customers. Recently Raheefa's husband needed new efficient tools and car batteries. Raheefa came to FATEN and took a loan to help her husband purchase the mentioned items and have a better results and returns.

Raheefa's husband appears in the picture here in the workshop as she is a religious woman and doesn't want her picture online.

About this loan product:

FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m

loans.use: To purchase auto repair tools and car batteries

loans.name: Bartola Ceferina

texts.es:
Bartola de 48 años, tiene un criadero de pollos para venderlos. Vive con su esposo e hijos de 17, 15, 13 y 8 años en un cantón llamado Playas uno de los lugares turísticos del Ecuador con una diversa dimensión de mariscos.  

Hace 13 años ella escogió vender pollos para pasar más tiempo con sus hijos ya que su esposo es obrero y así poder pagar la educación de sus hijos. En la actualidad trabaja desde las 06h00am hasta las 21h00pm todos los días. Su trabajo es criar a los pollos hasta que crezcan y venderlos a un mayor valor en la actualidad tiene 200 pollos pequeño que los cría y le da de comer balansiado para que crezcan sanos. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar pollos recién nacidos para poder criarlos y venderlos económicamente. En el futuro quiere comprar una pollera para vender a mayor volumen sus pollos.
texts.en:
Bartola is 48 years old.  She has a chicken farm where she raises chickens to sell.  She lives with her husband and her children aged 17, 15, 13 and 8 in Playas canton.  It is a tourist destination in Ecuador and has a wide range of seafood.

13 years ago Bartola chose to sell chickens so that she could spend more time with her children since her husband is a laborer and this way she could pay for her children's education.  She currently works from 6.00am to 9.00pm every day.  She raises chickens until they are grown and then she sells them for a higher price.  She currently has 200 small chickens which she is raising and she gives them balanced feed so that they grow up healthy.

She would like to use her loan to buy newborn chicks in order to raise them and sell them cheaply.  In the future, she would like to buy a henhouse so that she can sell more chickens.

loans.use: To buy chickens

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es socia del  Banco Comunal “Bartolina Sisa”, ubicado en el distrito D. Ilave, provincia D. EL Collao, Departamento  Puno, tiene 42 años D. edad,  D. estado civil casada, con dos hijos y grado D. instrucción secundaria completa.
La señora está trabajando con Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace diez años, el primer préstamo solicitado fue D. S/. 300. 00 nuevo soles, dinero que utilizó para incrementar  el capital  D. su negocio (engorD. D. ganado vacuno), actualmente tiene una tienda D. abarrotes donD. se pueD. adquirir diferentes productos. 
Con éste préstamo D. S/ 1500.00 nuevo soles, comprará productos diversos para incrementar su stock.
Su sueño es tener un restaurant.
Lo  que le gusta del Banco Comunal  es conversar, bromear y las charlas facilitadas por la promotora.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the “Bartolina Sisa” community bank which is located in Ilave district, in El Collao province, in the department of Puno.  She is 42 years old, married, and has two children.  She completed her secondary education.

Juana has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for ten years.  Her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles and she used that money to increase the working capital of her business (fattening cattle).  She currently has a grocery store where people can buy different products.

She will use this loan for 1,500 nuevos soles to buy products to increase her stock.

Her dream is to own a restaurant.

What she most likes about her community bank is the chatting and joking amongst the members and the talks which they are given.

loans.use: To buy products such as rice, sugar, noodles, etc.

loans.name: María Esthela

texts.es:
La Señora. María A. es socia del banco comunal Dinastía Espoir, vive en la ciudadela  los Eucaliptos en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es conocida por la belleza de su centro histórico, tiene una gran variedad en su gastronomía, es muy rica en su cultura y tradiciones y su gente es amable y cordial.

Nuestra socia tiene 55 años, es casada y tiene 8 hijos, 7 son casados viven independientes, su último hijo está estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo se dedica al comercio actividad que le ha permitido mantener su familia, gracias al esfuerzo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

Doña María al igual que su esposo es comerciante de cosméticos y vende  joyas, billeteras, cinturones etc., esta labor la realiza hace 30 años, trabaja vendiendo sus productos en todas las ferias de la ciudad al igual que en las ferias de la ciudad de Azogues. Hace 5 meses tiene un local de medicina natural en el cual labora de 7 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde.

Se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y le gusta por que puede estar con sus amigas y pasar un buen momento junto a ellas. su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más mercadería. Su meta es  tener un local donde puede vender su mercadería sin necesidad de recorrer la ciudad.
texts.en:
Mrs. María A., 55, is a member of the Dinastía Espoir (Espoir Dynasty) communal bank.  She lives in Eucaliptos in Cuenca.  This city is knows for the beauty of its historic city center.  It has a varied gastronomy, is very rich in culture and traditions and its residents are kind and cordial.

She is married and has 8 children.  Seven of them are married and live independently; her youngest son is studying in school in the city.  Her husband is a merchant, an activity that has made it possible for him to support his family.  Thanks to their efforts as a couple they have succeeded in building their house.

María, like her husband, is a merchant.  She sells cosmetics, jewelry, belts, etc.  She has been in this line of work for 30 years.  She sells products in all of the city’s markets as well as in the market in the city of Azogues.  For the last five months she has had a location where she sells natural medicines from 7am until 5pm.

She’s in her second loan with the communal bank and she likes it because she can be with her friends and spend a pleasant moment with them.  She will use the new loan to buy more merchandise.  Her goal is to have a locale where she can sell her merchandise without having to traverse the city.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics, jewelry, wallets, belts and natural products.

loans.name: David

texts.es: La señor  David, se dedica a la carpintería y al Tallado de maderas, tiene 36 años y su Esposa la Sra. María de 23 años es ella quien le colabora en el trabajo de la carpintería cuando el Sr. esta sobre cargado de trabajo, Tienen una pequeña de 5 Añitos, El señor a Veces Que  realiza  Trabajos De Tallado a los muebles de Empresas de reconocido Nombre En la Ciudad. El Empieza su labor desde muy Temprano, son personas que quieren ampliar y crecer en su actividad mejorando su  taller y así tener personas q dependan de el y dar oportunidades a otros. Para asi  tener en el Futuro un bienestar para su hija y su familia. Vive en el barrio San Agustín de la Zona del Plan 3000.
texts.en: David is in the carpentry and wood carving business.  He is 36 years old and his wife María is 23 years old.  His wife helps him with his carpentry work when he is overloaded with jobs.  They have a little 5 year-old girl.  David sometimes performs wood carving work on furniture from well-known companies in the city.  He begins his work very early in the morning.  He is someone who wants to expand and grow in his business, improving his workshop so that he has people depending on him and also giving opportunities to others.  He hopes thereby to provide for the future well-being of his daughter and his family.  He lives in San Agustín neighborhood of Plan 3000 district.

loans.use: To buy raw material (wood) and to expand his workshop roof

loans.name: Jacinto Freddy

texts.es:
Jacinto de 32 años, tiene una panadería en la parte delantera de su casa. Vive con su esposa y tres hijos en una zona urbana llamada Guasmo y caracterizada porque la mayoría de sus habitantes son comerciantes. 
 
Hace 13 años el aprendió hacer panes en una panadería muy conocida en Guayaquil llamada “California” pero decidió ser independiente  y comprar un horno pudo tener su propia panadería en la parte delantera de su casa. En la actualidad trabaja desde las 05h00am haciendo panes hasta las 18h00pm es cuando termina su jornada de trabajo para poder pasar con su familia. 

El quiere comprar con el préstamo levaduras, harina, lácteos para su panadería. En el futuro quiere tener sucursales de su panadería en calles principales para tener mas oportunidades de venta.
texts.en:
Jacinto is 32 years old.  He has a bakery in the front part of his home.  He lives with his wife and three children in an urban area called Guasmo which is characterized by the fact that most of its inhabitants are traders and salespeople.

13 years ago he learned to bake bread in a very well-known Guayaquil bakery called “California” but he decided to start working for himself.  He bought an oven so that he could have his own bakery in his home.  He currently works from 5.00am baking bread until 6.00pm when his work day ends and he can spend time with his family.

He would like to use his loan to buy yeast, flour and dairy products for his bakery.  In the future, he would like to have branches of his bakery in main streets to provide him with more sales opportunities.

loans.use: To buy yeast, flour and dairy products

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana tiene 27 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa, junto a su querida hija Mayli de 6 años. Lo que más desea es brindar una mejor calidad de vida y para ello esta dispuesta a trabajar muy duro. Todos los días muy temprano por la mañana, Ana sale a trabajar sus campos, para ella no existen los días de descanso, ya que tiene que trabajar continuamente su chacra para tener una buena producción. Sus principales productos de siembra son: el cacao, el café y la hoja de coca, los cuales vende al por mayor en la ciudad de San Francisco. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la libertad que tiene trabajando en sus cultivos, ya que puede disfrutar libremente de sus verdes campos, lleva 6 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de las plaga de insectos que pueden aquejarlas. Para el futuro, planea comprar nuevas tierras, con las cuales pueda incrementar sus cultivos. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas y espera serlo ahora también. En su banco comunal es una persona muy querida por el resto de sus compañeras, ya que es muy alegre. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más semillas de cacao y café, también comprará abono, para mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Ana is 27 years old.  She is a very happy and hard-working woman.  She lives in her home with her beloved daughter Mayli who is 6 years old.  What she most desires is to provide her daughter with a better quality of life and she is prepared to work very hard for that.

Every day Ana leaves the house very early in the morning to work in her fields.  For her there are no rest days since she has to continually work on her farm to achieve a good production.  The main products she grows are cacao, coffee and coca leaf which she sells wholesale in the town of San Francisco.  What she most likes about her work is the freedom that she has working with her crops since she can freely enjoy her green fields.  She has been in this business for 6 years and she considers that the most difficult part of her work is dealing with insect infestations which can afflict her crops.

In the future, Ana plans to buy more land in order to increase her crops.  This is her third loan from MFP.  She has been very punctual in making her repayments and hopes to continue this.  She is very much liked by the other members of her community bank since she is a very happy person.  She will use the 2,000 nuevos soles she is requesting to buy cacao and coffee seeds.  She will also buy fertilizer to improve her crops.

loans.use: To buy coffee and cacao seeds, and sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Yadira Del Carmen

texts.es:
Yadira del Carmen M. Rodríguez es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora quien es propietaria de una pequeña pulpería desde hace 11 años. Ella inicio este pequeño negocio con la venta de gaseosas luego poco a poco y gracias a los créditos fue surtiendo su venta con granos básicos, chiverías, gaseosa, refrescos…etc.
Ella tiene la meta de mejorar su negocio amentarlo y mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Yadira del Carmen M. Rodríguez is a hard-working and enterprising woman who has owned her own small grocery store for 11 years.  She started this small business selling soda then, little by little and with the help of loans, she managed to stock her store with basic grains, dairy products, soda, soft drinks, etc.

Her goal is to improve and expand her business and to improve her house.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as basic grains, dairy products, soda and soft drinks

loans.name: Bertha Cecilia

texts.es:
Bertha Cecilia Torres Guido es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora de 59 años quien se dedica al destace de cerdo desde hace 30 años. Esta actividad es muy productiva principalmente porque no se desperdicia nada  desde la carne de ventas, el hueso, la manteca y el cuero para realizar nacatamales, moronga, frito, chicharrón etc.
Torres  de 59 años tiene cinco hijos a los que saco adelante por medio de su arduo trabajo y sacrificios. Ella es mujer alegre y llena de positivismo la  cual desea salir adelante.
texts.en:
Bertha Cecilia Torres Guido is a hard-working and enterprising woman.  She is 59 years old and her business is slaughtering pigs.  She has been in this business for 30 years.  The business is very productive mainly because she doesn't waste anything, from the meat which she sells, the bone, the fat and the skin which she uses to make 'nacatamales' (Nicaraguan 'tamales' - steamed corn dumplings with a savoury filling, wrapped in a plantain leaf), 'moronga' (pig's blood sausage), fried pork and 'chicharrón' (fried pork rinds).

59 year-old Torres has five children who she managed to get ahead in life through her hard work and sacrifices.  She is a happy woman who is very positive and keen to get ahead.

loans.use: To buy pigs to slaughter and to produce 'nacatamales'

loans.name: Waseem

texts.en:
Waseem A. F. is a young man from Deir A.-Balah in Gaza Strip. Waseem and his mother, who work in a UN school, are responsible for the household expenses. Waseem has a generA. store where he sells accessories, gift items, books and stationary. The store is located in front of a school in Deir A.-Balah and next to the city clinic, which guarantees customers.

Waseem wanted to expand his store and increase the returns, so he took a loan from FATEN to purchase a larger variety of goods. 

Waseem appears in the picture here in front of his store.

loans.use: To purchase stationary, accessories and gift items for a general store

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es: Bertha tiene 45 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Alfredo y sus 2 queridos hijos Nancy D. 10 y Alfredo D. 7 años, quienes son el motivo D. todos sus esfuerzos. DesD. muy pequeña Betha aprendió a trabajar en la chacra junto a sus padres, quienes le enseñaron todo lo que se tiene que hacer, para lograr un buen cultivo, ahora tiene sus propias tierras, las cuales cultiva y cuida con mucho amor y paciencia. Ella siembra cacao, café y hojas D. coca, las cuales lleva a vender a la ciudad D. San Francisco. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es cosechar sus cultivos, ya que siente que su arduo trabajo esta dando sus frutos, lleva 25 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos D. las plaga D. insectos que pueden perjudicar sus plantaciones. Su mayor deseo es comprarse nuevas tierras, para incrementar su producción. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente y esta dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre y siempre está poniendo la cuota D. humor en el grupo. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará abono para ser aplicados en sus campos D. cultivo donD. se espera mejora la productividad D. sus frutos.
texts.en: Bertha is a 45, cheerful and hardworking woman, lives in her own home with her husband Alfredo and their two children: Alfredo,10 and  Nancy, 7 years, who are the reason for all her efforts. Bertha has been working in a  farm since she was a little girl; her parents taught her everything about how to get a good crop. Now she takes care of her own land with lots of love and patience. She plants cocoa, coffee and coca leaves, and she sells her products in the city of San Francisco. What she likes about her job is the harvest and she feels that after 25 years of dedication, her hard work is paying off. The most difficult aspect of her job is to protect the crops from insect pests that can harm her plantations. Her greatest wish is to buy new land to increase the production. This is the fourth loan with MFP, aware that she has to pay according to schedule, and she is willing to do so. She is a very glad partner of her community bank and always sharing good mood with the group. With this loan she will buy fertilizer to use in the fields, where she expects to improve productivity and results.
