loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Dora Luz

texts.es:
Dora Luz P.  es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora de 60 años ella inicio su comideria vendiendo dos servicios de alimentos en la actualidad comercializa entre 30 y 50 platos. Ella tiene cinco hijos los cuales están casados y son independiente le único que tiene a su cargo es un nieto quien es su ayúdate.
P. con el crédito comprará arroz, frijoles, carne, pollo y aceite sobre todo. Además ella ha sido participe del proceso de capacitación en empresarialidad y género las cuales le han ayudado mucho para mejorar su negocio y vida personal.
texts.en:
Dora Luz P. is a hardworking, determined, and enterprising woman who is 60 years old. She started an eatery where she sells food. Dora currently sells anywhere between 30 to 50 dishes. She has five children who are married and independent. The only person in her care is a grandson who is also her assistant.

Dora will use this loan to buy rice, beans, meat, chicken, oil, and other items. She has also participated in entrepreneurship and general training classes that have been a great help in improving her business and her personal life.

loans.use: Purchase rice, beans, meat, chicken, oil, and other items

loans.name: Dora Mercedes

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “LOS LIDERES ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Dora; La socia tiene 36 años de edad, ella es soltera; la socia se dedica a la compra y venta de autopartes, ella trabaja con su conyugue en su pequeña tienda y se dedican a ofrecer productos para autos, desde forros de asientos, luces, protectores de timones y otros, la socia se alterna con su pareja y viajan a la ciudad de Lima y/o a la ciudad de Juliaca,  ya que en estas ciudades se encuentran hasta fábricas de accesorios para autos. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de accesorios.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Dora is a member of the "Los Lideres" community bank, located in the Huanchac distrct of Cuzco province.

Dora (36) is single. She and her spouse have a small automobile parts store, where they sell everything from seat covers, through lights to wheel covers. She and her spouse take turns to travel to the cities of Lima or Juliaca to buy stock at the factories where the components are made. She wants the loan to invest in stock of vehicle accessories.

Dora is grateful for and values this loan and undertakes to repay on schedule.

loans.use: Purchase of automobile accessories for resale

loans.name: Celso Jesus

texts.es:
Celso es un  hombre muy dedicado a su familia, como todo padre tener una casa digna ha sido su anhelo.
Trabaja como conductor desde hace varios años, con su ahorros ha venido mejorando su casa y ahora con el financiamiento de Afodenic logro levantar paredes de concreto. 
Hoy con este nuevo préstamo hará un muro, ya que tiene cerrado con zinc, pero una parte está en mal estado por tal razón levantara el muro, y lograr mejor seguridad para su terreno como mejor seguridad para su familia. Lo que comprara materiales de construcción como: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro entre otros materiales para comenzar esta mejora. contento porque se ha hecho posible la obra.
texts.en:
Celso is a man who is devoted to his family.  Like any father, to have a proper home has been his dream.

He has worked as a driver for several years.  He has been using his savings to gradually make some home improvements.   Now, with financing from Afodenic he was able to erect concrete walls.

Now he will use this new loan to build a wall because he currently secures his property with zinc metal but part of it is in bad shape so he will erect a wall to get better security for his property and family.

He will buy building materials and supplies like: stone, sand, cement and iron rods, among other supplies to start this project.  He is happy because the project is now possible.

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies to erect a wall which will lead to better security for his family.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: El señor Mario, se dedica al servicio de transporte Urbano, tiene 31 años y su Esposa la Sra: Eynny de 34 años es ella quien le ayuda Ejerciendo Trabajos de Manicurista  en la zona donde vive. Los trabajos lo realiza  en las tardes en la misma zona y a veces se va a otros lugares donde ya tiene clientes fijos, en el transcurso de la mañana, Ella se Dedica a vender gaseosas   en su propio Domicilio, Tienen dos Hijitas una De 2 y otra de 4 Añitos.  Viven en el barrio 15 De Agosto, de la Zona de la Villa Primero de Mayo, El señor Mario se levanta desde muy temprano para trabajar y regresa casi siempre muy tarde , Solicitaron el Credito para poder dejar en mejor estado su Herramienta de trabajo el cual es, su vehículo. son personas responsables y buscan mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mario (31) is a taxi driver and his wife, Eynny (34), works as a manicurist. She does this work in the evenings and occasionally goes to other towns in the mornings, where she has regular clients. 

She also sells soft drinks from her home. They have two daughters, aged 2 and 4. They live in the 15 de Agosto district, in the Villa Primero de Mayo zone. Mario gets up early every day to go to work and generally gets home very late. The loan is to refurbish the tool of his trade, i.e. his car.

They are both responsible people who want to improve their living standards.

loans.use: Mechanical and electrical repairs of a taxi

loans.name: Zuhair

texts.en:
Zuhair is a National Palestinian Authority employee.  He has two daughters (Abeer 20 and Samar 21) who are university students and one son (18) who is a school student. Zuhair's son Ahmed wants to work after school and help his father, besides saving money for university tuition fees next year. 

Zuhair took a loan from FATEN to purchase a motorcycle which a small carriage is attached to to use as a means of transportation in crowded places such as Gaza Strip where Zuhair and the family live. Zuhair hopes that his son will be able to purchase a car in the future and make a better return.

Zuhair's son Ahmed appears in the picture here as he is religious and refuses being photographed.

About this loan product:
 
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to use for transportation

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: El sr. Juan  vive en la urbanización Amboro de la zona del plan 3000, vive en la casa de sus padres en donde tiene su punto internet el señor juan es soltero el préstamo que esta solicitando es para comprar una computadora especial para juegos ya que tiene mucha demanda en su internet de estos juegos el ya tiene un saldo lo que le sobre es para comprar otra computadora para poder prestar un mejor servicio. El sr. Juan es una persona joven que esta reuniendo un capital para poder continuar con sus estudios universitarios, tiene muchas ganas de superación y cuenta con el apoyo de sus padres.
texts.en:
Juan lives in the Amboro area, Plan 3000 zone.He lives at home with his parents, where he runs an internet café.

Juan is single. He wants the loan to buy a special computer for games since there is a lot of demand for these games at his internet café. The additional computer will enable him to provide a better service. Juan is saving up to go to university. 

He is very keen to improve his situation and has his parents' support.

loans.use: Buy a computer

loans.name: Carmen Ester

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “LOS LIDERES ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Carmen; La socia tiene 39 años de edad, ella es soltera; y tiene 1 hijo, la socia se dedica  a la elaboración de carteras y las vende, la socia se dedica a fabricar todo tipo de carteras, de todo color y de todo tamaño, en macramé, cuero, tejidas, bayetas, la socia realiza bellos trabajos manuales y los ofrece de manera independientemente, primero con sus contactos y después con las amistades de los mismos. La socia desea comprar materiales para seguir elaborando sus carteras, ella es nueva en el grupo y está muy feliz de que le hayan invitado a formar parte de este ameno grupo. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar material para elaborar sus carteras y poder venderlas en navidad.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Carmen belongs to the “Los Líderes” (Leaders) community bank which is located in Huanchac district, in Cusco province, in Cusco department.

Carmen is 39 years old.  She is single and has one child.  She works making and selling purses.  She makes all kinds of purses, in all colors and all sizes, in macramé, leather, wool and cloth..  Carmen does beautiful hand-made pieces and sells them independently, first to her contacts and then to their friends.  She would like to buy materials so that she can continue making her purses.  She is new to the group and is very happy that they have invited her to be a part of this pleasant group.  She is requesting this loan to buy material to make her purses so that she can sell them at Christmas.

She is grateful for this loan and appreciates it.  She pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy material for making purses which she can sell at Christmas

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Mensajeras”  ubicado en el distrito Juliaca, provincia San Román  y departamento de Puno, tiene 44 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente y  tiene 06 hijos, estudió educación  primaria completo.

Viene trabajando  con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 05 años,  nos cuenta que su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que  le sirvió para  incrementar el capital de  su negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de peletería (elaboración de cojines, alfombras de peluche), tejidos.

La señora solicitará un nuevo crédito por la suma de  S/. 600.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá en mercaderías para su negocio, comprará insumos para la elaboración de sus productos.
	
Su sueño para el futuro  es comprarse una casa y poner un minimarket.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  es el ahorro.
texts.en:
Irma is a member of the “Las Mensajeras” (Messengers) community bank which is located in Juliaca, in San Román province, in Puno department.  She is 44 years old and lives with her partner.  They have 6 children.  She completed her primary education.

Irma has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 5 years.  She tells us that her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles and she used the money to increase the working capital of her business making and selling fur items such as cushions and rugs and also knitted items.

She is requesting this new loan for 600 nuevos soles to invest in merchandise for her business.  She will buy supplies for making her products.

Her dream for the future is to buy a house and set up a minimarket.

What she most likes about her community bank is the savings.

loans.use: To buy supplies for making knitted items and other items

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es: El Sr. Marcos, vive en la zona de la Urbanización de El Recreo de la Zona del Plan 3000, él se dedica a la chapería de movilidades desde hace 9 años, actualmente esta brindando servicios de chapería a los transportistas que llevan a la gente de Santa Cruz a la localidad de Porongo, por este motivo solicito el crédito ya que necesita mayor capital de trabajo para comprar macillas, arreglar su equipo soldador para abastecer a sus clientes. Su esposa es cliente antigua de Emprender y actualmente se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, tienen 4 hijos que están en edad escolar, Ellos se caracterizan por ser personas responsables y muy conocidas en el barrio, esperan ampliar el taller para poder generar más ingresos y así terminar de construir su casa para y brindarle mejores condiciones de  vida y mejores  oportunidades de estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en: Marcos lives in the El Recreo housing development in Plan 3000 district.  He has been in the panel beating business for 9 years.  He is currently providing panel beating services to taxi drivers who take people from Santa Cruz to the town of Porongo.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan because he needs more working capital to buy putty and fix his welding equipment so that he can serve his customers.  His wife is an old client of Emprender and currently she sells cosmetics.  They have 4 school-age children.  They are both responsible people and very well-known in their neighborhood.  They hope to expand the workshop so that they can make more income and thereby finish building their house which will provide better living conditions and better opportunities for study for their children.

loans.use: To buy putty and fix his welding machine

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es:
La persona que esta en la imagen es la esposa de Mariano 

Mariano M. Guzmán es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora que a pesar de la crisis económica el sigue adelante, desde hace un año entre el y su esposa se dedican a vender ropa usada en su propia casa para incrementar sus ingresos para poder cubrir sus gastos, por lo que ello quiere comprar mercancía de temporada para que sus venta no bajen.
texts.en:
The person in this picture is Mariano's wife.

Mariano M. Guzmán is a very hard-working and enterprising person who, in spite of the economic crisis, has managed to keep going.  For one year, he and his wife have been selling used clothes from their own home to increase their income and thereby cover their expenses.  Mariano would like to buy seasonal merchandise so that his sales don't fall.

loans.use: To stock his business

loans.name: Najwa

texts.en:
Najwa is a young woman from Rafah city in Gaza Strip. Her brother Hamdan owns a grocery store in the city. Hamdan wanted to increase the variety of goods he sells, such as children's sweets and chips and other home needs such as hygiene products.

Najwa came to FATEN and took a loan to help her brother purchase the goods he needs. Hamdan wants to expand his business and rent a bigger space to have a big grocery store.

Najwa is a conservative woman so her brother Hamdan appear in the store in the picture here.

About this loan product:
 
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m

loans.use: To purchase goods to sell in the store

loans.name: Maria Alejandra

texts.es: La Sra. María  Nacida en Santa Cruz de la Sierra vive actualmente en el Barrio España. Hace 5 años se dedica al bordado en chinelas donde ya a sentado presencia en sus clientes y para incrementar sus ingresos comercializa también adornos de esa manera ayuda en los gastos del hogar. el crédito que se le otorgo a la Sra. Alejandra es para la compra de mas chinelas ya que  su demanda de pedidos de chinelas bordadas a incrementado por la época de fin de año.  La Sra. agradece a la institución por la confianza depositada en su persona.
texts.en: María was born in Santa Cruz de la Sierra.  She currently lives in the España neighborhood.  For 5 years she has been embroidering thongs (flip flops).  She has built up a customer base and to increase her income she also sells jewelry.  In this way she helps with her household expenses.  The loan which Mrs Alejandra has been given is for buying more thongs since her orders for embroidered thongs have increased with the end-of-year season.  She is grateful to Emprender for the trust which they have placed in her.

loans.use: To buy thread, jewelry and thongs

loans.name: Reem

texts.en:
Reem is a young woman from Jineen. She is a university student in her third year. Her husband is the one responsible for family expenses. Reem wanted to continue her education in order to get a good job as she is an ambitious woman who considers education a necessity.

Reem took a loan from FATEN to pay university tuition fees. Reem's husband owns a small grocery store and a piece of land where he plants seasonal fruits and vegetables to secure a good life for his family.

Because Reem is a conservative woman she didn't want to have her picture online, so her husband Saber appears in the picture.

loans.use: To pay university tuition fees

loans.name: Martha Janneth

texts.es:
La Señorita. Martha S. es socia del banco comunal Mi Bankito, vive en la comunidad de Guncay que  pertenece a la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es conocida por la belleza arquitectónica que encierra su centro histórico, su gente es muy calida,  amable y conservan su cultura y tradiciones.

Nuestra socia es una mujer muy joven, tiene 21 años de edad, es soltera y vive con sus padres, su mamá se dedica a la venta de quesillo, su padre es chofer profesional y maneja un camión, sus padres tienen casa propia y es gracias al esfuerzo de su trabajo.

La Señorita. Martha se dedica a la cría de pollos, actividad que la realiza hace 5 años, a sus pollos los compra muy pequeños pero en tres semanas ya están listos para la venta y los vende pelados a sus fieles clientes. También cuenta con un local en donde vende productos naturales hace 3 años, labora de domingo a domingo sin descansar un solo día desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 3 de la tarde.

Se encuentra en su tercer crédito y fue invitada por una tía a formar parte del banco comunal, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y en su alimento. Su meta es superarse mas y su sueño es  tener una casa y un vehiculo propio.
texts.en:
Miss Martha S. is a member of the Mi Bankito communal bank.  She lives in Guncay which is part of the city of Cuenca.  Cuenca is knows for its architectural beauty surrounding its historic city center.  Its residents are warm and kind and keep their culture and traditions.

Martha, 21, is a very young woman.  She is single and lives with her parents.  Her mother sells quesillo (a popular local cheese) and her father is a professional truck driver.  Her parents own their home thanks to the effort they put into their work.

Martha has been raising chickens for the past 5 years.  She buys the chickens when still very small but in three weeks they are ready for sale; she sells them dressed to her regular customers.  She also has a locale where she has sold natural products for the last three years.  She works from Sunday through Sunday with not a single day off from 8am until 3pm.

She is in her 3rd loan.  She was invited by her aunt to join the communal bank.  She will use the new loan to buy chickens and feed for them.  Her goal is to improve still more and her dream is to have a house and a car of her own.

loans.use: To buy chickens and feed for them.

loans.name: Fany Rocio

texts.es:
La Señora. Fanny L. es socia del banco comunal Mi Bankito, vive en la comunidad de Guaguanchi que pertenece a la parroquia del Valle, esta parroquia es de clima frió, es conocida por la belleza de su naturaleza, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales y a la agricultura.

Nuestra socia tiene 36 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 16, 14 y 11 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos estudian en un colegio de la ciudad y su ultima hija está en la escuela. Su esposo es de profesión sastre y tiene un taller en su casa, la casa en la que habitan es de su propiedad la que han construido con el esfuerzo de su trabajo.

Doña Fany es de profesión sastre la misma que la viene la ejerciendo hace 13 años, su oficio  aprendió desde muy corta edad, ha trabajado en esta actividad y con el tiempo se ha puesto su propio taller con la ayuda de su esposo, laboran de lunes a sábados desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde, como labora en su casa tiene tiempo para dedicarse a la cría de pollos y chanchos a los cuales los vende en su comunidad y también son para el  consumo de su familia.

Se encuentra en su tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y fue  invitada por su hermana.  Los créditos anteriores la han servido para comprar materia prima y este lo va ha utilizar  en la compra de una maquina cortadora de tela para su taller.  Su mayor sueño es tener una fábrica.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fanny L., 36, is a member of the Mi Bankito communal bank.  She lives in Guaguanchi which is part of Valle parish.  This parish has a cold climate and is known for the beauty of its natural scenery.  Its residents are dedicated to farming and animal raising.

She is married and has three children who are 16, 14 and 11 years of age.  Her two oldest children go to high school in the city and the youngest is in school.  Her husband is a tailor and has a workshop installed in their home.  The home they reside is theirs and they have built it with the effort they’ve put into their work.

Fanny is also a tailor.  She has been in this occupation for 13 years.  She learned this skill while still very young.  She has worked at this and in time set up her own workshop with help from her husband.  They work from Monday through Saturday from 8am until 6pm.  Since she works from home she also has time to raise chickens and pigs which she sells in her community and also uses for her family’s consumption.

She is in her 3rd loan with the communal bank.  Her sister invited her to join.  The previous loans have been used to buy raw materials and this one will be used to buy a fabric cutting machine for her workshop.  Her greatest wish is to have a factory.

loans.use: To buy a fabric cutter.

loans.name: Nelly Uvaldina

texts.es:
La Señora. Nelly es socia del banco comunal Mi Bankito, vive en la comunidad del Carmen de Guaguanchi que pertenece a la parroquia del Valle, esta parroquia es de clima frió y es conocida por la belleza de su naturaleza, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales y a la agricultura.
 
La Señora. Nelly se dedica a la cría de pollos, actividad que la realiza desde que se ha casado hace 15 años, labora de lunes a viernes desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde. También labora en la agricultura, siembra hortalizas y las vende en la feria libre en la ciudad de Cuenca.

Doña Nelly tiene 35 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 16, 14 y 12 años de edad, todos  estudian en el colegio. Su esposo labora en un talle de estucos (cielos rasos), con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

Este en su segundo crédito en el banco comunal y fue invitada por su cuñada a formar parte de este grupo. Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de semillas y abono para sus tierras. Su meta es  agrandar su casa ya que por el momento es de un solo piso.
texts.en:
Nelly is a member of the Mi Bankito Community Bank. She lives in Carmen de Guaguanchi, which is in the Valle parish, which has a cold climate and is known for its natural beauty. The people live off of agriculture and raising animals.

Mrs. Nelly works raising chickens; she has had this job since she got married 15 years ago. She works from Monday to Friday from 8 in the morning until 6 at night. She also grows vegetables and sells them at the fair in the city of Cuenca.

She is 35 years old, married, and has three children (16,14, and 12) all of whom are in high school. Her husband works in a stucco shop and between their hard work they have been able to build their own home.

This is her second loan with the community bank and was invited to join the group by her sister-in-law. She will use her loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for her fields. Her goal is to expand her house, which is just one story high.

loans.use: Purchase of seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge L. Ortiz  fue construyendo su vivienda poco a poco con ahorros que junto de varios años, en este momento se le termino el capital par seguir con su proyecto el cual recurre a esta institución para que sea poyado para terminar su vivienda. Jorge quiere enjarrar por dentro y fuera de la casa para esto el necesita comprar cemento, arena y pagar mano de obra así ofrecerá a su familia una casa digna para habitar.
texts.en: Jorge L. Ortiz was building his home little by little with savings collected over many years. To obtain the capital required to continue his project, he has come to this institution for support. Jorge wants to plaster the inside and outside of his home. To do this, he must buy cement, sand, and labor to offer his family a dignified home.

loans.use: To plaster walls

loans.name: Diamante Verde Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama Diamante Verde se encuentra localizado en la comunidad de Tlalnepantla , en el estado de Morelos, México, este grupo se compone de 4 integrantes mujeres que se conocen y son vecinas ellas son la señora Mirella Espinoza Ramírez va a comprar con su préstamo insecticida para fumigar su parcela de nopal, la señora Caritina Rayón F. va a comprar ropa para bebe, conjuntos, camisetas, trusitas, toallas y papelería para surtir su tienda, la señora Alicia H. A. va a comprar insecticidas para fumigar el nopal, la señora Carolina A. Rayón va a comprar insecticidas para fumigar su parcela de nopal y va a comprar una bomba para fumigar. La señora Alicia H. A. es la representante del grupo, ella tiene 26 años de edad, estudio hasta el 3er. Año de secundaria tiene su certificado, ella tiene 3 hijos Fredy tiene 7 años estudia el 2º. Año de primaria, María Fernanda tiene 5 años de edad y Paola tiene 4 años de edad  ellas dos están en preescolar. Ella tiene su siembra de nopal y solicito su préstamo para comprar abono y fumigantes para la siembra de nopal, ella inicio con el negocio desde pequeña sus papas los llevaban al campo a sus 7 hermanos y ella a trabajar en la siembra de nopal  a quitarle la hierba con un azadón. Este negocio es herencia de sus papas, se encuentra localizado a media hora de su casa en los campos de Tlalnepantla y llega a su parcela en carro o caminando, su negocio es importante porque de ahí se ocupa para todos los gastos, cuando vienen tiempos buenos y tiene buen precio el nopal es cuando puede ahorrar, su parte favorita de este negocio es atenderlo del diario, ella hace la comida para llevar al campo para su esposo y los trabajadores que están trabajando en el nopal y se siente orgullosa cuando su siembra tiene mucho nopal porque se cosecha mucho y tiene más dinero. Las personas servidas por su negocio son compradores que vienen de fuera de Milpa Alta, de la Cd.de México, de Guadalajara. Los desafíos que enfrenta el negocio son las plagas que echan a perder su producción, también enfrenta la competencia como todos siembran nopal hay veces que todas des pencan al mismo tiempo y hay mucho nopal, las ganancias del negocio las reinvierte, se abona otra vez cada año. Tlalnepantla es un pueblo muy tranquilo donde pueden salir de noche sin peligro, hay muchos cerros y se ve el volcán, es de clima frio. Este negocio le ha ayudado a su familia económicamente para cubrir todos sus gastos la alimentación y para los estudios de sus hijos, las mejorías que desea realizar a su vivienda es remodelar porque son desde que sus abuelitos la construyeron y quieren hacer los cuartos para sus niños, sus sueños y esperanza son que crezca mas el negocio tener más productos. La señora Alicia está muy contenta con el préstamo que le proporcionan porque le va a ayudar mucho para crecer su negocio. Las mejoras que desea lograr par el futuro de sus hijos son darles estudio, que sigan estudiando y darles todo lo que necesiten. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “gracias por los préstamos que nos dieron y ojala y nos sigan ayudando.”
texts.en:
This committed group called Diamante Verde is located in the community of Tlalnepantla, in Morelos state, Mexico. It is composed of four women who are neighbours. Señora Mirella Espinoza Ramírez is planning to use her loan to buy insecticide to put on her nopal (prickly pear cactus) field. Señora Caritina Rayón F. will use her loan to buy baby clothing, outfits, shirts, pants, towels, and stationery for her store. Señora Alicia H. A. will buy insecticide to put on her nopal field. Señora Carolina A. Rayón will also buy insecticide spray for her nopal field.

Alicia is the group’s representative. She is 26 years old and has completed the third year of high school. She has three children, Fredy aged 7, who is in second year of primary school; María Fernanda aged 5 and Paola aged 4 who are both in pre-school. Alicia is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her nopal crop. As a young girl, her parents used to take her and her seven siblings to the countryside where she weeded the nopal plants with a special hoe.

She inherited the farm from her parents. It is located about a half hour from her house, in the countryside around Tlalnepantla, and she gets there either by car or by walking. Her business is important because it has to pay for all her expenses. When times are good and the price for her nopal crop is good, she manages to save some money. Her favourite part of the job is working there daily. She makes food to take there for her husband and the labourers who are working in the nopal fields, and she feels proud when her plants produce lots of nopal fruit because then the harvest is good and she has more money. The people who buy the fruit come from as far away as Milpa Alta, Mexico City, and Guadalajara.

Alicia’s biggest challenges are the insects which can attack the nopal fruit, and competition from other nopal growers. Sometimes there’s a lot of nopal for sale at the same time. She plans to reinvest any profit in the business by spreading fertilizer a second time in the year. 

Tlalnepantla is a quiet town where you can go out at night without worrying. There are many hills and you can see the volcano. It has a cold climate.

The farm provides financial support for the family and covers the cost of food and education for the children. Alicia wishes to renovate the house as it is still as her grandparents built it, and she wants to build on bedrooms for the children. Her hopes and dreams consist of expanding the farm and growing more produce. She is very happy with the loan as it will help her greatly to expand the business. She also wants her children to be well-educated and to be able to provide them with whatever they need. 

The group members wish to say thank you to Kiva and Fundación Realidad for the loan. They hope there will similar opportunities in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticide for the nopal crop

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es:
El señor Enrique D. G. es padre de familia preocupado por el patrimonio y el bienestar de ella misma. Hace tiempo adquirió una vivienda de interés social al que poco a poco le ha hecho mejoras a ella con prestamos de esta institución, el cual agradece por el apoyo brindado ya que por esto el ha podido realizar sus proyectos.
Enrique en este momento esta terminando la fachada de afuera de su vivienda, por lo que el necesita capital para seguir con la construcción y así su casa se vea presentable.
texts.en:
Mr. Enrique D. G. is father concerned about the assets and well-being of his family. Some time ago, he acquired middle-income public housing, and, little by little, he has been renovating it with loans from this institution. He is thankful for the support offered to him because it has enabled him to complete his projects.

At this time, Enrique is completing the façade of his home. To do this, he needs capital to continue with the construction and to makes his home look presentable.

loans.use: To finish construction

loans.name: Martha Elma

texts.es: La señora Martha Elma G. Martínez y su esposo han trabajado mucho para ofrecer a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida. Hace ya doce años adquirieron su vivienda de interés social, por lo que son pequeñas y angostas, por tal motivo esta familia pensó en construir un cuarto mas para ampliarla y así tener mas espacio. Para terminar su cuarto ellos necesitan poner la losa.
texts.en: Mrs. Martha Elma G. Martínez and her husband have worked hard to offer their children a better quality of life. Twelve years ago, they acquired middle-income social housing, which was small and cramped. This motivated them to construct a larger room so that they would have more space. To complete the room, they need to pour the slab.

loans.use: To pour slab

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: La señora María Teresa Rodríguez es una mujer muy activa que se dedica a vender variedad de cosas como los son Venta de tamales por docena, joyería y al tejido de bufandas para esta temporada de frio actividad que realiza desde hace 20 años para el sostén de sus gastos.  María Teresa desea invertir en su negocio como ya viene la época navideña es cuando tiene mas pedidos y quiere estar preparada antes que esto pase.
texts.en: Maria Teresa R. is a very active woman who makes a living selling a number of things. These include tamales by the dozen, jewelry, and knitted scarves for the cold season. She has been doing this for the past 20 years as a way of making ends meet. Maria Teresa wants to invest in her business since Christmas is on the way and it's when she has the most number of orders, so she wants to be ready.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for the business

loans.name: Olivia

texts.es: Olivia G. R. se dedica a la venta de ropa usada, nueva y artículos para el hogar desde hace 4 años. Ella es madre de 4 pequeños por quienes sale adelante para ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida. Aunque es apoyada económicamente por su esposo, ellos optaron por el negocio para tener una entrada más de dinero, al que en este momento desea invertir con ropa de temporada ya que en la época navideña se incrementa más sus ganancias.
texts.en: Olivia G. R. sells used clothes, new clothes and articles for the home.  She has been in this business for 4 years.  She has four young children and she works so that she can offer them a better quality of life.  Although she receives financial support from her husband, they decided to set up her business in order to have another source of income.  She would currently like to invest in buying seasonal clothes since her profits increase over the Christmas period.

loans.use: To stock her business

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es: Rosa María V. P. cuenta con un negocio de la venta de ropa usada desde hace 4 años para apoyar a su esposo con el gasto familiar. Rosa vende ropa, juguetes para niño y más a un precio cómodo para el público de acuerdo a su economía. La señora desea invertir en su negocio para que sus ventas sean incrementadas.
texts.en: Rosa María V. P. has had a business selling used clothes for 4 years.  Her business helps support her husband with their family expenses.  Rosa sells clothes, children's toys and other products to the public for a comfortable price, according to their means.  She would like to invest in her business to increase her sales.

loans.use: To stock her business

loans.name: Herlinda

texts.es: Herlinda E. Q. es una señora muy trabajadora y emprendedora, desde hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de ropa usada, nueva y zapatos en una de las pulgas muy conocidas en la ciudad. La señora desea comprar ropa para la temporada de frio ya que es cuando sus ventas incrementa y así genera mas ganancia para el sostén de sus gastos.
texts.en: Herlinda E. Q. is a very hard-working and enterprising lady.  For four years she has been selling used and new clothing and shoes in one of the best-known flea markets in the city.  She would like to buy clothes for the cold season since this is when her sales increase and in this way generate more profits to cover her expenses.

loans.use: To buy merchandise to stock her business

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: El Sr. Hernández es un hombre muy trabajador el cuenta con cuatro años laborando para el municipio en el area de imagen urbana, es una persona responsable con su familia y siempre dispuesta a sacarla adelante en este momento vive en casa propiedad de su suegra tiene 10 años a partir de que se caso viviendo en dicho domicilio, su suegra vive en un racho situado en las afueras de la ciudad, y es por eso que desde entonces el se ha hecho cargo de la casa que sabe que es el patrimonio de su hija debido a que ella sera la veneficiaria de dicha propiedad, a base de gran esfuerzo el ha estado terminando y mejorardo la vivienda. Es por eso solicito el credito para seguir dandole mantenimiento a la misma.
texts.en: Mr Hernández is a very hard-working man who has been working for the town council in the field of urban design for four years.  He is a responsible person who is always ready to get his family ahead.  He currently lives in his mother-in-law's house.  He has been living there for 10 years since he got married.  His mother-in-law lives in a ranch on the outskirts of the city.  He has been taking care of the house because he knows that it is her daughter's estate and she will be the beneficiary of the property.  With a lot of hard work he has been finishing off and improving the house.  He is requesting a loan so that he can continue doing maintenance work on it.

loans.use: To finish plastering his house

loans.name: Oralia

texts.es: Oralia M. O. desde hace 3 años opto por poner un estanquillo de comida corrida en su misma casa que son tamales y menudo al que abre todos los días por ser ya conocida en su alrededor. La señora quiere invertir en su negocio ya que en esta temporada de frio es cuando ella tiene mas pedidos y quiere estar preparada para seguir incrementando sus ventas.
texts.en: Three years ago Oralia M. O. decided to set up a fast food place in her home selling tamales and 'menudo' (tripe soup).  She opens every day as she is already well-known in her neighborhood.  She would like to invest in her business since the cold season is when she has most orders and she would like to be prepared so that she can continue increasing her sales.

loans.use: To invest in her business

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
The mother of three children, Rosa lives in the Hato Mayor region of the Dominican Republic, located in the east of the country. Hato Mayor is a fairly mountainous region where the principal industry is agriculture. Rosa's community, like nearly all impoverished areas in the Dominican Republic, suffers from a constant shortage of running water and electricity. Haitian immigrants make up a large proportion of Rosa's community.
  
Rosa requires a loan to buy diverse inventory (such as rice, chicken, beans, sugar and flour) for her convenience store, which she has been running for five years. Rosa has taken out a number of loans with field partner Esperanza International over the past five years, all of which have been paid back in full. She has used these loans to diversify the products that she sells. 

Rosa used to be a member of the "Solidarity Bank" (a group of borrowers) but has now applied for a loan that is larger than is usually offered to members of a group. Rosa is very excited about taking out the loan so that she can continue to grow her business. 

Rosa says that her favorite thing is studying, and she hopes that the profits from her business will make this easier to fund in the future. Her dream is to gain a degree in market research.

loans.use: To buy stock for her convenience store

loans.name: María  Lourdes

texts.es:
La Señora. María M. es socia del banco comunal Mujeres de Combate, vive en la comunidad de Huizhil que pertenece a la parroquia Baños, esta parroquia es conocida por sus aguas termales contando con una gran cantidad de piscinas, tiene varios lugares turísticos para distraerse con la familia y cuenta con una gran variedad en su gastronomía.
 
Doña María tiene 48 años de edad, es soltera y vive en casa de su mamá a quien cuida y hace compañía, siendo el sostén de la casa, se dedica a la venta de frutas, verduras y granos, actividad que la realiza desde que tenia 12 años de edad ya que ayudaba a su mamá, su producto lo compra a los vendedores mayoristas, labora 4 días a la semana desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde, tiene un puesto propio el mismo que fue de su mamá.

Es socia del banco comunal hace un año y medio, siendo una de las socia fundadoras del mismo.  el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de frutas, verduras y granos para su local. Su sueño es tener algún día su casa propia.
texts.en:
Mrs. María M., 48, is a member of the Mujeres de Combate (Women of Battle) communal bank.  She lives in Huizhil which is part of Baños parish.  This parish is known for its thermal waters and it has quite a few swimming pools and tourist destinations where families can go to relax; it also has quite a varied gastronomy.

María is single and lives in her mother’s house; she cares for and keeps her mother company.  She supports the home selling fruit, vegetables and grains, an activity she’s been doing since she was 12 years old because she used to help her mother.  She buys her products from wholesalers.  She works four days a week from 7am until 6pm.  She has the same stand that once belonged to her mother.

She has been a member of the communal bank for a year and a half.  She is one of the founding members.  She will use the money from the loan to buy fruit, vegetables and grains for her stand.  Her dream is to someday have a house of her own.

loans.use: To buy fruit, vegetables and grains.

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es:
Tomasa es una madre de familia de 64 años de edad que reside junto a su familia en el sector Cruce Jaén – Nuevo Olmos, una zona rural que tiene como principal actividad a la agricultura, pertenece al distrito de Olmos, en la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra situada a mas de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace seis años al cultivo y comercialización de maracuyá, ella cuenta con un terreno de cultivo en donde suele sembrar esta fruta y luego la cosecha para venderla a un acopiador. Adicionalmente también compra maracuyá a sus vecinos para comercializarla. Con los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades se encarga de ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Tomasa desea adquirir fertilizantes para poder asegurarse una buena producción de su cultivo, asimismo desea contar con un pequeño capital que le permita seguir comercializando con los acopiadores la maracuyá que producen sus vecinos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Ella es una mujer bastante activa y entregada a su familia. Las personas que le conocen le consideran alguien honrada y de confianza.
texts.en:
Tomasa, 64, lives with her family in Cruce Jaen-Nuevo Olmos, a rural area where the principal livelihood is farming.  Cruce-Jaen-Nuevo Olmos is in Olmos, a district in the province of Lambayeque, some two hours from the Peruvian city of Chiclayo.  

Tomasa has operated a farming business for the last six years, growing and selling passion fruit.  She sows the fruit in her fields and, when they're ready, she harvests them for sale to local warehouses.  She also buys passion fruit from her neighbors and resells them.  Her earnings from the business allow her to help her husband support their family.

Tomasa wants to buy fertilizers to improve her crop yields.  She also wants funds to buy fruit that she will sell on to wholesalers.  She thinks that she needs S/.1,500 new soles for the business and she is applying to Edpyme Alternative for that amount.

Tomasa is energetic and devoted to her family.  The people that know her say that she is honorable and trustworthy.

loans.use: Buy supplies for farming business.

loans.name: Flavio

texts.es:
Flavio es un padre de familia de 46 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el sector Piedra del Toro del distrito de Morropón, ubicado en la provincia del mismo nombre, esta zona pertenece a la región Piura y se encuentra ubicada aproximadamente a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace cuatro años a brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado que consiste en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para realizar actividades de transporte). El brinda este servicio en la zona en donde vive y con los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad se encarga de sacar adelante a su familia.

El continuo uso brindado a su unidad móvil ha hecho que esta empiece a sufrir algunas fallas que requieren de urgente reparación para garantizar su correcto funcionamiento, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Flavio es una persona bastante amable y con ganas de salir adelante. Las personas que le conocen le consideran alguien responsable y de confianza.
texts.en:
Flavio, 46, lives with his wife and children in Piedra del Toro, a town in Morropon, a district in the province of the same name, some three hours from Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.

Flavio has operated a taxi business for four years, picking up and carrying passengers in a moto-taxi (a motorcyle with an attached cabin for passengers).  He operates the business in the town where he lives and the income from it has allowed him to support his family.

The moto-taxi has been in constant use and the wear and tear is beginning to show.  Flavio is applying to Edpyme Alternativa for a S/.1,500 new soles loan so that he can fix the various problems that he has to urgently fix.

Flavio is a friendly person, eager to get ahead.  The people who know him say that he is responsible and trustworthy.

loans.use: Repair and maintain moto-taxi.

loans.name: Rosa Olga

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa Ludueña es socia del banco comunal Mujeres de Combate, vive en la comunidad de Huizhil que pertenece a la parroquia Baños, esta parroquia es conocida por sus aguas termales contando con una gran cantidad de piscinas, tiene varios lugares turísticos para distraerse con la familia y cuenta con una gran variedad en su gastronomía.

Nuestra socia tiene 38 años, es casada y tiene 5 hijos  de 18, 15, 14, 12, 10 años de edad, su primera hija estudia en la universidad, sus tres hijos siguientes están estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad y su ultimo hijo está en la escuela. su esposo se dedica a  la construcción ya que labora como albañil, la casa en la que habitan es propia siendo el fruto del trabajo, constancia y esfuerzo conyugal.

Doña Rosa se dedica a la venta de helados, los vende en una escuela de su comunidad, esta actividad la realiza desde que ha tenido una muy corta edad ya que antes ayudaba a su mamá y desde que se ha casado ha iniciado su propio negocio. También en su casa se dedica a la cría de pollos, cuyes y cerdos a los cuales los vende en su comunidad.

Es socia del banco comunal hace más de un año y fue invitada por una amiga, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de un congelador para su negocio. Su meta es  ampliar su casa para que tenga una mayor comodidad su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa Ludueña, 38, is a member of the Mujeres de Combate (Women of Battle) communal bank.  She lives in Huizhil which is part of Baños parish.  This parish is known for its thermal waters.  It has quite a few swimming pools and tourist destinations where families can come to relax; it also has a varied gastronomy.

She is married and has five children who are 18, 15, 14, 12 and 10 years of age.  Her oldest daughter is in the university.  The next three children are in high school in the city and the youngest is in elementary school.  Her husband is a construction worker, he is a bricklayer.  The house they live in is their own and is the fruit of their labors as a couple.

Rosa sells ice cream at a school in her community.  She has been in this activity since she was very young since she used to help her mother.  When she married she started her own business.  She also raises chickens, guinea pigs and pigs at home that she sells in the community.

She has been a member of the communal bank for over a year; she was invited to join by a girl friend.  She will use the new loan to buy a freezer for her business.  Her goal is to enlarge her house so that her family will be more comfortable.

loans.use: To buy a freezer.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
La Señora. Blanca A. es socia del banco comunal Mujeres de Combate, vive en la comunidad de Huizhil que pertenece a la parroquia Baños, esta parroquia es conocida por sus aguas termales contando con una gran cantidad de piscinas, tiene varios lugares turísticos para distraerse con la familia y cuenta con una gran variedad en su gastronomía.

Doña Blanca se dedica a la venta de comida, actividad que desempeña hace 5 años y labora de domingo a domingo en su propia casa desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 2 de la tarde. También se dedica a la cría de pollos y cuyes los mismos que son para la preparación de sus platos.
 
La Señora. Blanca tiene 50 años, es viuda y tiene 2 hijos de 32 y 16 años de edad, su primer hijo es casado y vive independiente con su familia y su hija  estudia en un colegio de la ciudad. Tiene casa propia la misma que ha construido ella sola.

Es socia de la banca comunal hace 8 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos, cerdos, cuyes y más utensilios de cocina para su comedor. Su meta es  tener una pollería.
texts.en:
Mrs. Blanca A., 50, is a member of the Mujeres de Combate (Women of Battle) communal bank.  She lives in Huizhil which is part of Baños parish.  This parish is known for its thermal waters and it has quite a few swimming pools and tourist destinations where families can come to relax; it also has a varied gastronomy.

Blanca has sold prepared food for five years.  She works from Sunday to Sunday at home from 8am until 2pm.  She also raises chickens and guinea pigs that she uses to prepare her dishes.

She is a widow and has two children who are 32 and 16 years of age.  Her oldest son is married ad lives independently with his family and her daughter is high school in the city.  She has a house of her own which she has built by herself.

She has been a member of the communal bank for 8 years and will use the new loan to buy chickens, pigs, guinea pigs and more kitchen utensils for her eatery.  Her goal is to have a roasted chicken shop.

loans.use: To buy chickens, pigs, guinea pigs and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita  B. is a married woman who lives in Sitio Mahayahay, Brgy. Daanlungsod, Medellin, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a fishing business. Her husband, Romeo B., who is 49 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have four children who are between 13 and 24 years old. 

Conchita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past five loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Conchita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 11000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 13200, uplifting the family's standard of living. 

This time, for her sixth loan, she is borrowing PHP 10000, which she intends to use to buy an additional boat so that she can continue to save up for the future. 

Conchita B. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon, a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To buy an additional boat

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie N. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 46 years old and married. She has one child who is 9 years old and goes to school. 

To make a living, Elsie plants rice and harvests it  for sale. Elsie works hard to provide for her family and sustain her child's education.

Elsie joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Elsie has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. She is requesting a loan of 17000 PHP, which will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Phan

texts.en: Phan S. has been a farmer for many years. She lives in the province of Kompong Cham. Since 2007, Phan has owned and operated her farm to cultivate rice crop, as well as selling corn next to her house, from which she earns a daily income. Phan is married to Sok Channa, age 37, who is a local farmer and also works in construction. They have been married for years and have one child who attends school. Phan hopes to increase her business and is applying for a $400 loan to be used to buy a larger amount of corn to sell. The rest of the loan will go towards accruing capital for her husband's construction business.

loans.use: To buy more corn to sell and to accrue capital for her husband's construction business

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes G. is a married woman who lives in Purok 4, Barangay Tinungan, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: a general store and a pig fattening business. Her husband, Manuelito G., who is 43 years old, works as a laborer to earn his living and also helps with his wife's business activities. They have three children who are between 11 and 20 years old. 

Agnes joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 18 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Agnes has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 17,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 10,000 PHP, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 19th loan, she is borrowing 17,000 PHP, which she intends to use to buy stock for her general store, so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Agnes G. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia P. is a married woman who lives in Malocbaloc, Barangay Agujo, Daanbantayan, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a general store business. Her husband Manuel P., who is 50 years old, works as a security guard to earn his living. They have four children who are between 17 and 25 years old. 

Amalia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past two loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Amalia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 6,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 2,000 PHP, uplifting her family's standard of living. This time, for her third loan, she is borrowing 15,000 PHP. She intends to use it to purchase more stock to sell, so that she can continue to save up for the future construction of a house and improvement of her living condition. Amalia P. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn E. is 28-years old, married, and supports her family by operating a general store business. A resident of Brgy. Tuguis, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental and a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2006, she has been improving her living conditions with the help of loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store business, Ailyn is gradually making her family more economically stable and now earns an average income of PHP 6,000.

Ailyn is now borrowing PHP 19,500, her 12th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon, in order to purchase more store stock to sell. Her previous loan of PHP 19,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Ailyn aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a community member who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of goods to sell to customers

loans.name: Ma. Ana

texts.en:
Ma. Ana P. is 27 years old, married and supports her family by operating a fishing/fish vending business.  She lives in Malocbaloc, Brgy. Agujo, Daanbantayan, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2009 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. 

By working hard in her fishing/fish vending business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 4,800. Ma. Ana is now borrowing PHP 10,000 so that she can purchase fishing gear and equipment. This will be her third loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 5,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. 

Ma. Ana aspires to improve her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon -- a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase of fishing gear and equipment

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma M. is a widow who lives in Sitio Maasin, Brgy. Bato, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by running an eggplant plantation.

Alma joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 11 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Alma has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, improving the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 12th loan, she is borrowing PHP 20,000, which she intends to use to buy fertilizers for the vegetables so she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Alma M. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon -- a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Fund the operations of eggplant plantation

loans.name: Tuy

texts.en:
Tuy S., 46, is married and resides with her husband and children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. 

S. and her husband sell watermelons and corn, earning an income of about USD 8 per day. S. has to spend USD 100 on food, USD 7 on electricity and water supplies and USD 76 on other necessary expenses every month.  

S. is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase more watermelons to sell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: to buy more watermelons to sell

loans.name: Sen

texts.en:
Sen S., 22, is married and resides with her husband and child in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. 

S. and her husband sell firewood, earning an income of about USD 3.16 per day. S. has to spend USD 79 on food, USD 6 on electricity and water supplies and USD 26 on other necessary expenses every month.  

S. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase more firewood to sell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy more firewood to sell

loans.name: Arvin

texts.en:
Arvin A. is a single man who lives in Bagumbayan Street, Brgy. 7, Isabela, Negros Occidental. He earns his living by operating a used clothing sales business. 

Arvin joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because he aspired for something better for his family. With the help of his past 12 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Arvin has been incrementally lifting his family out of poverty by the sweat of his brow. His previous loan of PHP 17,000 helped him earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, increasing the family's standard of living.  

This time, for his 13th loan, he is borrowing PHP 20,000, which he intends to use to purchase stocks of clothes to sell so that he can continue to save up for the future expansion of his business. 

Arvin A. is a Dungganon man who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of his dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon -- a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more clothing to sell to customers

loans.name: Phorn

texts.en: Phorn N., 52, is a farmer who lives in the province of Kompong Cham. She earns about $1.30 per day. Her husband, Mr. Chea Lounh, is a 53-year-old farmer who also makes about $1.30 a day. They have two children, one of whom is single while the other one is married and living away from home. In the past, Phorn N. bought a piece of land from her neighbor on credit, and she always paid her creditor every month. She wants to pay it off presently, but she doesn't have enough money to make it possible. To solve this problem, Phorn N. would like to request a loan to pay for the cost of the land she bought on credit.

loans.use: To pay for the cost of land which she bought on credit

loans.name: Li

texts.en: Li S., 38, is married and resides with her husband and four children in the Cambodian province of Kampong Cham, an area known for rubber plantations. S. is employed as a staff member at a private company, earning an income of about 9 USD per day. Her husband is employed at a local clinic in the town, earning an income of about 2.36 USD per day. S. has to spend 70 USD on food, 5 USD on electricity and water supplies, and 82 USD on other necessary expenses every month. S. is requesting a loan of 1,200 USD to purchase cassavas in stock to resell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy cassavas in stock to resell when the price is good

loans.name: Futuro De Vida (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Futuro de Vida está formado por 11 mujeres que realizan  diferentes actividades para ayudar en la economía de sus hogares y poder  salir  adelante, y asi dan el ejemplo a sus hijos. Viven por diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es conocida por sus cuatro ríos que la bañan, la arquitectura de sus iglesias, su gastronomía y su gente que se caracteriza por ser cordial y amable.

La Señora María G. vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 28 años, es casada y tiene  un niño de 6 meses de edad, su esposo labora en un talle de aluminio y vidrio. 
Doña María labora como secretaria de en un taller de aluminio y vidrio, trabaja de lunes a viernes de 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde y por la noche en su casa se dedica a la venta de comida rápida, trabaja de lunes a domingo,  vende hamburguesas hot dog  y papas fritas.
Es el primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y fue invitada por una amiga.  El dinero de su crédito va a utilizar en comprar los víveres para la preparación de sus productos. Su meta es crecer y salir adelante con su negocio.

La Señora Rosa I. vive por el sector de la Empresa Eléctrica, es el segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y le gusta por que puede estar con sus amigas y así sale de la rutina. Se dedica realizar los quehaceres de una casa en donde cuida de dos abuelitos, labora todo el tiempo que ellos la necesiten, esta actividad la realiza hace 5 años.
Doña Rosa tiene 29 años, es madre soltera de 6 hijos que tienen 14, 13, 9, 7, 2 años de edad y un bebe de meses, sus dos primeros hijos estudian en un colegio de la ciudad, su tercero y cuarto hijos están en la escuela, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 Con su nuevo crédito va a iniciar en el negocio de cría de cerdos. Su meta es ser una buena madre para sus hijos y darles todo lo que esté en sus manos para que se superen
texts.en:
The Futuro de Vida (Life’s Future) communal bank has 11 female members that are in various activities designed to improve the economies of their homes and to get ahead in life thus providing a good example for their children.  They live in various parts of Cuenca, a city known for the four rivers that bathe it, the architecture of its churches, its gastronomy and its residents who are characteristically kind and cordial.

Mrs. María G., 28, lives in Cuenca.  She’s married and has a 6-month-old son.  Her husband is employed in an aluminum and glass workshop.  María is employed as a Secretary at an aluminum and glass workshop.  She works from Monday through Friday from 8am until 6pm.  At night she works from home selling fast food from Monday through Sunday.  She sells hamburgers, hotdogs and fried potatoes.

This is the first loan she’s taken in the communal bank; she was invited to join by a girl friend.  The funds will be used to buy ingredients to prepare her products.  Her goal is to grow and get ahead with her business.

Mrs. Rosa I. lives in the Empresa Eléctrica neighborhood.  This is her second loan with the communal bank.  She likes it because she can be with her friends and get out of her usual routine.  She works at a home where senior citizens are cared for doing domestic chores.  She works whenever she’s needed and has been doing this for five years.

Rosa is 29 years old and a single mother of six children who are 14, 13, 9, 7, and 2 years old and a baby who is a few months old.  Her oldest two children go to high school in the city, her third and fourth children are in school.  She does not own her house; she rents.

She will use the loan to start a business raising pigs.  Her goal is to be a good mother to her children and to give them everything she can so that they will do well.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs/To start raising pigs.

loans.name: Tith

texts.en: Tith R., 34, is married and resides with her husband and three children in the Cambodian province of Kampong Cham, an area known for rubber plantations. R. and her husband sell groceries, earning an income of about 4.16 USD per day. R. has to spend 50 USD on food, 3 USD on electricity and water supplies, and 30 USD on other necessary expenses every month. R. is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase a motorbike for the family to use. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for the family to use

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria Gagantoca is a single woman who lives in Kenon Street, Brgy. 7, Isabela, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  a eatery ('carinderia') and a farming business. Candelaria joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 19 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Candelaria has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. 

Her previous loan of PHP 10,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 15,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 20th loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000, which she intends to use to pay for more additional working capital for her business so that she can continue to save up for future home repairs and put aside savings for future use. Candelaria Gagantoca is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:

 In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Fund the operations of eatery and farming

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Chhean

texts.en:
Chhean S., 48, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for its rubber plantations. S. grows vegetables, earning an income of about USD 3 per day. Her husband is a barber, earning an income of about USD 4 per day.

 S. has to spend USD 40 on food, USD 2 on electricity and water, and USD 10 on other necessary expenses every month.  S. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase old cars to repair for sale. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy old cars to repair for resale

loans.name: Sou

texts.en:
Sou S., 45, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for its rubber plantations. S. is a housewife while her husband manufactures wooden furniture, earning an income of about USD 3.33 per day. S. has to spend USD 56 on food, USD 12 on electricity and water, and USD 10 on other necessary expenses every month.  

S. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase hairdressing equipment to start a business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. S.'s husband appears in the photograph because S. was not available.

loans.use: buy hairdressing equipment to start a business

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok S., 32, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kompong Cham Province, Cambodia. Sok S. inherited in farmland from her grandmother and she grows different kinds of crops. Her husband (pictured) helps her in the same business, and he is also a fisherman to earn additional income. 

This rice-growing season, the family planted rice two months ago but their rice is not growing well due to the lack of fertilizer. Because of this condition, Sok S. needs a loan from Kiva in order to purchase fertilizer to improve her crops' yield. With the rest of the funds she will pay for land which she has purchased on credit.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer to improve her crops' yield and to pay for land which she has purchased on credit.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth M. is from the village of Bayo, Iguig, Cagayan. She is 50 years old. Elizabeth is married and has 7 children. To make a living, Elizabeth owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Elizabeth has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Elizabeth joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elizabeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from ASKI. Elizabeth is requesting a new loan of 33,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 10th loan taken out by Elizabeth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok S., age 40, lives in the province of Kompong Cham, which is the best territory for farming. Sok S. is a married woman who is devoted to her three children, one of whom is single, studying at school, and still depends on her care. The remaining two are employed as garment workers in a factory and have a proper salary each month.
